loans.name: Natalya

texts.ru: Наталья, 62 года, вдова, мать 5 детей. Она агроном по специальности, около 20 лет назад начала заниматься цветоводством. Она разводит комнатные домашние цветы на продажу, также оказывает дизайнерские услуги, украшая пансионаты, кафе, дома цветами к праздникам. Сын помогает в доставке на автомобиле цветов к клиентам. Среднемесячный доход составляет до 36,000 сом (KGS). Наталья обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 130,000 сом (KGS) на покупку семян цветов для разнообразия ассортимента и удобрений для цветов. Доходы от кредита позволят Наталье развить бизнес и приобрести новый автомобили для доставки.
texts.en: Natalya is 62 years old, a widow, and the mother of five children. She is an agronomist by profession. She started working in floriculture about 20 years ago. She grows house plants for sale, and also provides design services, decorating care boarding houses, cafes, and houses with flowers for festivals. Her son helps her to deliver the flowers to her clients by car. Her average monthly income is up to 36,000 som (KGS). Natalya has applied to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 130,000 som (KGS) to buy flower seeds to vary her range and fertilizer for the flowers. The proceeds of the loan will enable Natalya to develop her business and buy a new car for deliveries.

loans.use: to buy flower seeds to vary her range and to purchase fertilizer for her flowers.

loans.name: Lena

texts.ru: Лена успешно погасила свой кредит, использовав его по назначению. Она благодарна Фонду Кива и всем, кто помог ей в финансировании. В хозяйстве Лены на сегодняшний день имеется 4 коровы, 24 овцы и 3 лошади. На 1,65 Га собственной  земли она выращивает люцерну для откорма скота. Ежемесячный доход составляет около 15,000 сом (KGS). Лена решила развивать свой бизнес и вновь обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овец для откорма и реализации. Вырученные доходы от бизнеса Лена планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, она мечтает накопить на открытие цеха по производству молочной продукции.
texts.en: Lena successfully repaid her loan, having used it for its intended purpose. She is grateful to the Kiva Fund and to everyone who helped to finance her. Today Lena's farm has four cows, 24 sheep and three horses. She grows alfalfa to feed her livestock on 1.65 hectares of her own land. Her monthly income is about 15,000 som (KGS). Lena has decided to develop her business and has once again applied to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) to buy some sheep for fattening and resale. Lena plans to invest the income she receives from the business in further increasing her number of domestic livestock. She dreams of saving up to open a plant to produce dairy products.

loans.use: to buy some sheep for fattening and resale.

loans.name: Firdous

texts.en:
Firdous is 51 years old, married, and the mother of four children. Her husband is a driver by profession and provides transportation services using his rickshaw, which is always in bad condition. He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family's expenses, but now his rickshaw requires proper maintenance to keep it in a functional state.

For this reason, Firdous has contacted Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan for a loan so that her husband can repair his rickshaw. He wants to repair one wheel and the engine’s piston and wants to pay the labor costs. This will help him drive more smoothly and provide better transportation services to his passengers.

Firdous is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business. She thanks Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to repair her husband's rickshaw.

loans.name: Jojalyn

texts.en:
Jojalyn is 30 years old, married, and has two children. She manages a transport business to help her husband, who is a salesman, in providing for their children.

Jojalyn requested a loan to purchase spare parts for motorcycle maintenance. With the loan, she can continue to cater to more passengers and provide good services to her passengers to generate greater income. She hopes to buy a sidecar so that she can cater to more passengers and earn a better income.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for motorcycle maintenance.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Lucy works hard to support her family.

She has a shell crafting business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Lucy is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to buy shells and other supplies to use in her business of shell crafting.

Lucy has been sustaining her business activities through her past 11 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy shells and other supplies to use in her business.

loans.name: Jonalyn

texts.en:
Jonalyn is 33 years old and married with one child. She works very hard to provide for them.

Jonalyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, milk, coffee, drinks, bread, spices, juice, etc.

Jonalyn has been in this business for three years.

In the future Jonalyn would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, milk, coffee, drinks, bread, spices, juice, etc.

loans.name: Hilda

texts.en: It’s been four years since Hilda starts her food (snacks) selling business to raise her children; three are already grown up and the other three are still school aged children. They lived a simple life in the city of Baybay, Leyte and earn only PHP2000 per month. She is asking for a loan for additional capital to buy food ingredients such as flour, cooking oil, sugar and banana fruit. She will also buy chips, biscuits, candies and juice to sell. In addition, 47-year-old Hilda dreams to have a stable business to help her augment her livelihood.

loans.use: to buy flour, cooking oil, sugar and banana fruit; chips, biscuits, candies and juice to sell

loans.name: Sophia

texts.en:
Sophia is a 46 years old, married and have two children to provide. To earn for living she engaged in a sari sari store business and through this business she generate income that helps a lot for her family in their daily needs. She aims for a greater income that's why she decided to borrowed a loan to purchase additional good items for the store to sell and able to increase her inventory also in her store.

Sophia plan for the future to expand her business to sustain the education needs of her children and can finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase additional good items for the store to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase more stocks and supplies such as; sugar, noodles, wheat, rice, kerosene, cooking oil, etc

loans.name: Josefa

texts.en:
Josefa is 35 years old and married with three children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Josefa runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 3,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, milk, coffee, drinks, bread, spices, juice and personal care products.

Josefa has been in this business for four years.

In the future Josefa would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, milk, coffee, drinks, bread, spices, juice and personal care products.

loans.name: Erna

texts.en:
Erna is 59 years old, married with ten children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29500 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks to sell like noodles, egg, can goods, soft drinks etc.

Erna has borrowed and paid 19 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 30 years and also earns an income from fish vending and buy and sell vegetables.

She aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks to sell like noodles, egg, can goods, soft drinks etc

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Cristina works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig raising. Cristina is borrowing PHP 30000 throughbuy additional wood, bamboo, fishing net, etc for her fishing business.

Cristina has been sustaining her business activities through her past 24 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional wood, bamboo, fishing net, etc

loans.name: Ishrat

texts.en:
Ishrat is a housewife, is need of a loan for her husband so that he can refurbish and expand his restaurant.

She has six children, and she aims at getting them educated with the funds generated from this restaurant.

The items required include furniture which can be bifurcated into tables and chairs, groceries which can be further divided into vegetables and meat, plus a new gas cylinder.

Hence, this loan is pivotal for Ishrat as it would help her enhance her husband's earnings with the expansion of his restaurant, simultaneously fulfilling her aim of getting a quality education for her children.

loans.use: for refurbishing and purchasing food items for her husband's restaurant. .

loans.name: Quy

texts.en: Mrs. Quy is 37 years old, she is a hardworking woman. There are four people in her family. The loan can help her to build a sanitation latrine, which can contribute to improve the health for her family as well as environment protection. Husbandry and fishing are main income source of her family so she is able to pay the loan monthly .

loans.use: to build the latrine to improve the health of her family.

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en:
Marlyn is 36 years old, married, and has one child, who attends school. She works very hard to provide for them. Marlyn operates a general store in the Philippines, which she has been doing for three years.

Marlyn requested a loan from NWTF for 12,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase more groceries to sell such as canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, bread, shampoo, snack foods, and personal care products. In the future she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell such as canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, bread, shampoo, snack foods, and personal care products.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Edna works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell dried fish business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. Edna is borrowing PHP 14000 through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of dried fish for her buy and sell dried fish business.

Edna has been sustaining her business activities through her past 6 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of dried fish

loans.name: Arjuna Group

texts.en:
Several months had passed and Arjuna group was able to pay off on time. In the journey of its business, the group members are progressing quite rapidly. They can raise pigs in a good way so that they gets a satisfactory result. Because they gets a satisfactory result, some of the members of the group got enough money for saving. During this time their activities are monitored by the Loan Officer for their achievements and serve as an example for other farmers. 
Ni Wayan sold all of her piglets and earns enough profit after deducted with other cost. From the profit she can fulfill her family daily needs and saving. She and all the member of the Arjuna group said their gretting to all Lenders, Kiva and MUK.

Because the prices of feeds are high enough, the  Arjuna  group went on loan  with increasing loan amount. At the time of disbursement of funds in the field, 2 members can’t attend the meeting because of religious ceremony at the temple. Each member gets 2.000.000 IDR. The loan will be use to buy super quality piglets and feed.
Ni Wayan use the loan to buy 3 superior piglets and quality feed. To reduce costs, she still gives the mixture feeds. She hopes the pigs will grow healthy and not attacked by disease. If she already have enough savings to venture capital, she will raise pigs with her own capital.

loans.use: to buy 3 superior piglets and quality feed

loans.name: Eulalia

texts.en:
Eulalia is a 58-year-old woman who lives a simple life with her family in the town of Catigbian, Bohol. Her husband is a farmer, while Eulalia is running a sari-sari store business. She has been doing this proficiently for 30 years.

Eulalia and her husband work hard to raise their big family. They have five children; they are four adults and one school-aged child. 

She is asking for a loan to buy commodities to sell such as spices, eggs, cooking oil, noodles, canned goods, chips, biscuits, bread, candies, toiletries, salt, sugar, powdered milk and chocolate drink. She will also buy rice for seedling. In the future, she wants to uplift their livelihood for sustainability.

loans.use: to buy spices, eggs, cooking oil, noodles, canned goods, chips, biscuits, bread, candies, toiletries, salt, sugar, powdered milk and chocolate drink, and rice

loans.name: Connie

texts.en:
Connie is 43 years old, married with six children.

Connie works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 9000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, milk, coffee, drinks, bread, spices, juice and etc.

Connie has borrowed and paid 2 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 25 years and also earns an income from fishing.

Connie aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, milk, coffee, drinks, bread, spices, juice and etc

loans.name: Alfreda

texts.en:
Alfreda is 57 years old and widowed with three children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Alfreda runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 9,500 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, bread, junk foods, home-care products and other groceries.

Alfreda has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items. 

In the future, Alfreda would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, bread, junk foods, home-care products and other groceries

loans.name: Vien

texts.en: Mrs. Vien is 52 years old, a widow and has two children, all of them are schooling. She would like to improve her family’s living standard, especially her children but lack of capital. The loan can help her to build a sanitary latrine and she is able to repay the loan from cultivation and selling chicken in her garden.

loans.use: to build the latrine to improve the health of her family.

loans.name: Hanh

texts.en:
Mrs. Hanh is a hardworking woman, 32 years old . She lives with her husband and four children in a small house and without hygienic latrine. Her family’s income is mainly from husbandry and fishing.

She would like to take a loan to build a latrine, which can help to improve the health of her family’s member. With support from her husband, she is able to repay the loan monthly.

loans.use: to build the latrine to improve the health of her family.

loans.name: Zahida

texts.en:
The person who is shown in the picture named Zahida, 50 years old and living in the populated area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband has been running a small general store for many years and it's working very well. His shop is situated near a populated area and lots of customers are available here to buy miscellaneous general store items.

He does not want to refuse and disappoint his any respected customer for any product. He wants to offer all those products which are necessary and consumable in daily routine. In this way he will be success to win the trust of his customers and increase his income as well. He wants to offer additional items such as bread, jam, little bit stationery items, soft drinks and ice creams also. But he does not have refrigerator to keep ice cream and jam fresh.

Therefore, Zahida has requested a Kiva loan from Kvia’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so her husband would be able to buy additional item such as bread, jam, stationery items, soft drinks and ice creams etc.

She is very glad after receiving this loan and hopeful that her husband will be success to fulfill each request for any item and abstain from the disappointment of his customers. Zahida is very thankful to the Kiva’s field partner’s BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy bakery items for her husband's general store so he can fulfill each demand of his customers. .

loans.name: Samet's Group

texts.en: Samet’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Samet works as farmer and he also does extra work as construction worker to support his family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these man and women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Farkhanda

texts.en:
Farkhanda is a 34-year-old woman, living with her three children and spouse in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Farkhanda’s husband has been driving a rickshaw for many years. It has been depreciating with the passage of time, so he sold his old rickshaw and wants to buy a new rickshaw. He belongs to an ultra poor family and has to feed his children, and now his children are growing older, and their needs increase as well. 

She has been making savings for many days to buy a new auto rickshaw for her husband, but at the time of purchasing, some money has become short. Therefore, she has requested a loan for her husband so that he can buy a new auto rickshaw with the contribution of savings.

Farkhanda hopes that now her husband would be able to generate more income. She is very happy after taking this loan. She thanks Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a new auto rickshaw for her husband's transportation services.

loans.name: Sosefina

texts.en: Sosefina is a 23 years old woman who is married with 2 children. She runs a business selling and sewing elei clothes in her community. She has 3 years of experience with this business. Sosefina has requested a loan to buy a sewing machine, scissors, thread, needles and unpicker. She plans to use her profits to support her family. She joined SPBD in 2010 gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine, materials, thread, scissors, needles etc.

loans.name: Asina

texts.en:
Asina is a wonderful young woman from Tajikistan. She always wanted to have a higher education and to be in service for the development of Tajikistan. Asina now is a student of the 5th course National University of Tajikistan. She studies Finance and Economy. Asina plans to work in the banking system after graduating university. Her dream is to have success in life.

Asina is single and she lives with her parents. She needs to financially support because she must pay for university tuition. She is asking for a loan with this aim. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to pay for her university tuition for a BA degree in Finance and Economics

loans.name: Vailepa

texts.en: Vailepa is 32 years old and married with 3 children. She runs a small business selling pancakes in her community and has been doing this for 3 years. Vailepa has requested a loan to buy sugar, flour, cooking oil, yeast, shopping bags etc. She joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Vailepa will use her profit to pay for her children's education and to support her family financially.

loans.use: to buy yeast, cornflour, sugar, cooking oil and shopping bags.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en: With her eagerness to help her husband, Marilyn successfully started her sari-sari store (general store) business. She is a 34-year-old woman from Baybay, Leyte. She is married and the mother of two children, ages 13 and 5 years old. Her husband is a driver and works hard to provide for the needs of their family. Thus, she is asking for a loan to buy more grocery items such as soft drinks, chips, bread, biscuits, eggs, spices, noodles, cooking oil, canned goods, sugar, coffee, toiletries, powdered milk and chocolate drinks. In the future, she wishes for business sustainability for her family.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, chips, bread, biscuits, eggs, spices, noodles, cooking oil, canned goods, sugar, coffee, toiletries, powdered milk and chocolate drinks.

loans.name: Renato Sr.

texts.en: Renato is a 41-year-old man from Baybay, Leyte. He is married and has two children, one adult and one school aged child. Renato and his wife are running a sari-sari store (general store) business to earn a living. They have been doing this for more than five years and have become proficient. Aside from a sari-sari store, they also buy and sell “tuba” (Filipino word for coconut wine). They raised their children through these businesses. They wish to improve these businesses to have a sustainable means of living in the future. Thus, Renato is asking for a loan to buy grocery items such as chips, candies, biscuits, coffee, powdered chocolate drinks, sugar, salt, canned goods, noodles and spices. He will also buy “tuba.”

loans.use: to buy chips, candies, biscuits, coffee, powdered chocolate drinks, sugar, salt, canned goods, noodles, spices and "tuba" (Filipino word for coconut wine).

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa is 69 years old and married with four children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, noodles, etc.

Rosa has been in this business for 23 years.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Akhia

texts.en:
Akhia's age is 43. She is married and lives with her husband and three children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.

Akhia owns a small clothing sale business at home. She purchases clothes from the market at low prices and sells them for high prices in her community. The ladies of town like her clothing collection and selection a lot. Her family members appreciate her efforts.

Now that the winter season is going to start, she wants to buy winter season clothes to sell, but she does not have the money due to household expenses.

Akhia requested a loan so that she can buy winter season clothes to fulfill demand.

Akhia wishes for a bright future for her children and dreams of providing them a better education. She is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy more seasonal clothing stock for her own clothing sale business.

loans.name: Hien

texts.en: Hien is 23 years old and married with a baby. She runs a general store and requested a loan through QBWDF to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, condiments, home care products, and other groceries. She has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as rice, sugar, soap, and other groceries. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, condiments, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Hai

texts.en: Hai is a 46-year-old mother with two children. She is a hardworking woman. She has been able to support her family thanks to the fact that she works in various occupations. She is requesting a loan to restart her own business, a small chicken farm. She will raise the chickens, feed them and subsequently sell them. She essentially took the initiative because of her family, as she wants to enjoy a better life with them. She wants her children to study and have a reason to smile every day.

loans.use: to restart her own business, a small chicken farm. She will raise the chickens, feed them and subsequently sell them.

loans.name: Nordelyn

texts.en:
Nordelyn is 32 years old and married with three children, three of whom in school, Nordelyn works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc..

Nordelyn has been in this business for 3 years. 

In the future Nordelyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc.

loans.name: Ramel

texts.en:
Ramel is a resident of Catigbian, Bohol, where rice farming is one of the main sources of income for most people in the community. Ramel is married and has four children; ages eight, five, three and a one-year-old. He raised them through this livelihood.

He has been rice farming for eight years and hoping to augment this livelihood because it is the only business from which he can get an income to provide for his family. Thus, he is asking for a loan to help him buy fertilizer to enhance the growth of their planting.

Aside from this, he wants to buy piglets. Perhaps he was thinking of other sources of income that will help them increase their livelihood. Ramel dreams of improving his business for his family in the future. He wants them to have a good life and a better means of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer & piglets

loans.name: Derrick

texts.en:
Derrick is a resident of Nono, Muduma in Mpigi district. The client is an agriculturalist majoring in the growing of tomatoes but also trades in fish to supplement the income. He is 28 years old and is married. He is requesting for a loan of Four Million shilling to increase on his working capital. He needs to buy tomato seeds, pesticides, mulch and to overcome the challenge of pest and diseases plus droughts.

Derrick appreciates the support he receives from UGAFODE Microfinance.
Pictured is Derrick and the UGAFODE Credit staff(right to left)

loans.use: to buy farm in puts in form of tomato seeds, pesticides and mulch.

loans.name: Mara

texts.en:
Mara is 34 years old and she lives in Kapan city of Syunik region. Mara is married and she has two nice daughters. Mara’s husband works at the Kapan city’s combine and at the same time being very artistic person after his work he paints and also makes different sculptures from wood. At the same time he helps his beloved wife in her agricultural works, which she manages in a nearby village Arajadzor.

Mara has very nice orchard where she planted apple, pear and persimmon trees. Mara also has vegetable garden where she cultivates potato, beans and onions. All these fruits and vegetables she sells at the city’s wholesale market and also cutely separates some part of these fresh and tasty harvest for her lovely family use.

Now Mara is waiting to receive this Kiva loan in an amount of 700.000 Armenian drams which will help her to settle a water tank for her watering activities and she also wants to organize land cultivation works getting prepared for winter months.

loans.use: to settle a water tank for her watering activities and she also wants to organize land cultivation works getting prepared for winter months

loans.name: Sreyphy

texts.en:
A resident in Kandal province, Sreyphy is 26 years old. She is married and blessed with two dependent children. The family’s income, which is about USD 11 per day, is earned from a rice growing business and working for others for a fee. She can manage to save about USD 6 per day.

This will be her first time with VisionFund. She is going to use her loan to buy a motorcycle to commute from home to her workplace. She hopes to save up to better sustain the family’s living and to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle to commute from home to her workplace.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
The gentleman in the photo is James. He is thirty two years old. He has undergone through Hand in Hand Eastern Africa training that has enabled him to manage his enterprises and finances.
James sells animal feeds and pesticides to earn a living. He is borrowing from Kiva to buy more stock of animal feeds and pesticide to boost his enterprise from improved sales.He will use the anticipated profits to start another enterprise.
He is grateful to Kiva and their borrower for the support.

loans.use: to buy more stock of animal feeds and pesticide to boost  enterprise thus more sales.

loans.name: Desideria

texts.en:
Desideria is a 45-year-old woman from Baybay, Leyte. She is married and has four children. Her oldest child is 21 years old while her youngest child are 17 years old twins. Her husband works hard as a farmer while Desideria is engaged in selling “tuba” (Filipino word for coconut wine). They earned a living for 23 years by doing this business.

Thus, she is asking for bigger amount of loans to buy more containers of tuba and “tungog” (is a tannin powder used to give color to the coconut wine). Desideria’s greatest dream is to improve her business to give her family a better means of living.

loans.use: to buy containers of tuba and “tungog” (is a tannin powder used to give color to the coconut wine)

loans.name: Loie

texts.en:
Loie, a 36-year-old, is married and lives in Gata Daku. He is earning an income from his hog raising business.

They are blessed with having 3 children, and they work for their daily needs. In order to improve the hog raising business, he is borrowing from GDMPC microcredit to add capital in order to buy feeding supplies.

Before long, he is hopeful of the possibility of expanding his business.

loans.use: To buy feeds for the pigs.

loans.name: Rutchelle

texts.en:
Rutchelle is 41 years old and has three children, who are in school, Rutchelle works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like noodles, spices, sugar, can goods, chips, etc.

Rutchelle has been in this business for 3 years.

In the future Rutchelle would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like noodles, spices, sugar, canned goods, chips, etc.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is 60 years old and married with four children. Delia works very hard to provide for them.

Delia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 3500 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, milk, coffee, drinks, bread, spices, juice and etc.

Delia has been in this business for 12 years. 

In the future Delia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, milk, coffee, drinks, bread, spices, juice and etc

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en: Jackline is a 36 year old single lady with 6 children living in Fort Portal Uganda. She has a business of selling second hand clothes,shoes and bags. She has been running this business for a period of 15 years, with a vision of employing herself. She is working very hard to make sure she builds a permanent house on her plot for her family and expand her business to new areas. Jackline is faced with a challenge of seasonality changes especially during the rainy season since she operates from an open place. Jackline is happy with her business which has made her make a lot of friends and increase her number of customers. She has asked for a loan to buy more second hand clothes for sell.

loans.use: to buy second hand clothes for selling

loans.name: Nelma

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Nelma works hard to support her family.

She has a rice retailing business in the Philippines, and also earns income from a general store. Nelma is borrowing PHP 9,000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell to her stall.

Nelma has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell in her stall.

loans.name: Diana

texts.en:
Diana is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Diana is 38 years old and has two children are still in school.

Diana has a food vending business in the Philippines. Diana requested a PHP 7000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients like meat, fish, spices, cooking oil and other materials for her food production business.

Diana has been in this business for 5 years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like meat, fish, spices, cooking oil and other materials for her food production business

loans.name: Zahida

texts.en:
Zahida is a 45-year-old married woman. She is living with her husband and six children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.

She is doing embroidery work with her hands at home and financially supporting her family. Zahida belongs to a poor family; her husband’s income is very poor, so that is why she decided to start embroidery work at home. She has been learning these arts since her childhood, and now she adopted it for her occupation. She enabled herself to be independent and is earning sufficient income.

Zahida requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase stock of threads, silk, fancy sequins, and pearls of various colors. She hopes that this loan will prove beneficial for her and for her family. Zahida is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase stock of threads, silk, fancy sequins, etc., for her own embroidery work.

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica has been involved in business activities since a few years ago. She started with her own working capital of $200.

Monica has a small kiosk in her house, and she has plans to open a bigger business, but her money is not enough. So now she is requesting a loan of $1,000 from Tuba Rai Metin to add with her working capital to buy more and additional supplies including cigarettes, noodles, eggs, milks, candies, note books, biscuits, soft drinks and other things to sell.

Monica hopes that with this loan she can be improving her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy cigarettes, noodles, eggs, milks, candies, note books, biscuits, soft drinks and other things to sell.

loans.name: Sokhim's Group

texts.en: Sokhim’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Sokhim works as farmer and she also does extra work as factory laborer and seller to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.	.

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema, who is in her early 30's, is married with three children, a baby, one of whom is still in school and the other one is grown up. She has been selling fruits, vegetables and started selling household appliance.She works from 06am to 08pm daily and is able to make a very good profit per monthly.

This will be Rehema's 12th credit from Tujijenge Tanzania.She used the previous loans to increase on her genge stock, which is now serving more people. She has paid back her loan successfully. She used the profit to reinvest in business, take care of her family, to pay school fees, to repay a loan and covered household expenses. She will use this loan to restock the items in her genge stock. She dreams of expanding her busines.
Rehema will be accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to restock the items in her genge stock

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is a 45-year-old woman. She lives with her family in the town of Mahaplag in Leyte, Philippines. She earns a living by running the sari-sari store (general store) business. She sells grocery items such as food, personal care items, and drinks. Aside from sari-sari store business, she is also engaged in raising pigs.

She is asking a loan of PHP 16,000 to buy additional grocery items such as soft drinks, eggs, spices, toiletries, canned goods, noodles, cooking oil, chips, candies, biscuits, laundry soap, sugar, coffee, powdered milk and chocolate milk; and to buy feed for her pigs. In the future, she wishes to expand her business and have her own capital to run her business.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, eggs, spices, toiletries, canned goods, noodles, cooking oil, chips, candies, biscuits, laundry soap, sugar, coffee, powdered milk and chocolate milk, and pig feed.

loans.name: Nelia

texts.en:
Nelia is a married woman with eight children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Nelia is 59 years old and one of her children is still in school.

Nelia has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Nelia requested a PHP 4,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy assorted fish to sell to her customers.

Nelia has been in this business for four years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy assorted fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
Elma is a married woman with one child. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Elma is 39 years old and has one child still in school.

Elma has a pottery making business in the Philippines. Elma requested a PHP 10000 loan amount through NWTF to to buy sand, clay and other materials for her pottery making business.

Elma has been in this business for 15 years. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to to buy sand, clay and other materials for her pottery making business

loans.name: Marat

texts.en:
Marat, from Kapan city of the Syunik region, is 47 years old and lives with his wife, smallest son and his retired mother.

Marat’s elder son is now in the army doing his military service, and his daughter is studying and living in Yerevan city now.

Nobody in Marat's family is employed except him. He used to work as a locksmith at the car repairing center. Now he has a truck of his own with which he offers cargo transfer services.

Marat also has a small fruit and vegetable garden which he cultivates mainly for his family's use.

Now Marat needs this partnership very much because his truck, which is the only way of earning money for his family, needs some repair work, This loan will be used for repairing his truck’s engine.

loans.use: to repair his truck’s engine, as this truck is the only way of earning money for his family's needs.

loans.name: Elmira

texts.en:
Elmira from Kapan city of Syunik region is a widow and she has three children. Her elder daughter is already married and she lives with her family. Her son lives and works in Kadjaran city and in this way he sustains his family's needs.

Elmira lives with her smallest daughter and has a cute fruit and vegetable garden in a nearby village, Bekhi. She also tries somehow to earn a living. In her garden she cultivates potatoes, beans, cucumbers and also apples, pears and grapes. Elmira organizes the sale of these goods right from her garden to her regular customers. Her nice daughter greatly helps her in her agricultural works and she already does it very skillfully and with great pleasure as well.

Elmira asks for this loan of 700,000 Armenian drams as she wants to buy vegetable seedlings and also young fruit trees of the types that she still does not have in her garden. In this way she hopes that in spring months she will have a bigger assortment of her fruits for sale.

loans.use: to buy vegetable seedlings and also young fruit trees of the types that she still does not have in her garden.

loans.name: Ravy's Group

texts.en:
Ravy, age 29, is a married woman who has three dependent children, two of whom are in school (the remaining one is too young to attend school). She resides in Battambang Province, where she has been running a rice growing business for years. To make additional income, she works for others for a fee. Together, the earnings are about USD 9 per day and she can save about USD 5 each day. The biggest challenge to her farming business is drought.

Ravy has been with VisionFund for three cycle loans, and she has improved the standard of living for her family. As the leader of a three-member group, she will use her loan to support her farming business by purchasing rice seeds, organic fertilizer and organic pesticide. The remaining loan portion will be used to pay for plowing and reaping fees. She hopes to earn more income to keep sending her children to school, to sustain family’s living and to expand her farming business.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer to boost crop yields to keep sending her children to school and to expand her farming business.

loans.name: Ny's Group

texts.en:
A 23-year-old married woman, Ny is a resident in Preah Vihear province. She has two dependent children under the school age.

She and her husband earn a living by growing rice and running a handicraft business. Together, they earn around USD13 per day and can save approximately around USD9 each day. Drought is the challenge to their rice growing business.

Ny learned that a solar system provides advantages in living. Thus, she is now leading a group of three members to request loans from VisionFund. She will use her loan portion to buy solar lighting. She hopes that this purchase will enable her to eliminate this cost of living and brighten her house.

loans.use: to buy solar lighting to brighten her house and eliminate this cost of living.

location.town: Preah Vihear Province, Chaom Ksan District

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is a 49-year-old woman and a resident of Tubigon, Bohol. Like the other people in the community, Virginia and her family are also engaged in a fishing business. Her husband is a fisherman and she helps her husband in doing this business. It has been their source of income for 10 years.

To uplift their livelihood, she dreams to buy new fishing net and fishing rope. She will also need money for boat repair. With this, she wishes to lend money to help them improve their livelihood. In addition, Virginia has five children; they are three adults and two school aged-children that need their support.

loans.use: to buy new fishing net and fishing rope for boat repair.

loans.name: Delosanto

texts.en: Delosanto is a resident of Catigbian, Bohol. He is married and has three sons; ages 13, 12 and 2 years old. To support them, he raises pigs. Delosanto and his wife has been doing this since they started their married life and hoping to have better earnings. The problem that always hindered them in raising pigs is that they don’t have enough money to finance for feed. With that, he is asking for a loan to buy feed and additional piglets to raise. In the future, he wishes to uplift his livelihood for sustainability.

loans.use: to buy feed and piglets

loans.name: Evengelina

texts.en:
Evengelina is 65 years old, married and has two children.

Evengelina is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Evengelina requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Evengelina has been in this business for 2 years now, and has borrowed 3 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Evengelina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 36 years old and has three children.  Josephine is married and has two children who are in school.

Josephine is in the agricultural business, raising pig in the Philippines. Josephine requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig.

Josephine has been in this business for 5 years now, and has borrowed 9 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Josephine would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig

loans.name: Tereza

texts.en:
Tereza is 48 years old, married, and has one child. She is a pedagogue with a higher education. She graduated from Yerevan State University with a degree in chemistry and biology. She was born in Tashir City of Lori region. Her husband is busy with fish breeding.

After graduation, Tereza started to work at the city school as a chemistry teacher. She is currently the deputy director as well as a teacher at the school where she started. Tereza also gives paid private courses of her subject to the pupils who are going to have entrance exams. She mentions her great love and devotion to her work and she does her best to help her pupils to overcome any hardships that may have in their learning process.

Tereza requested a loan for 500,000 Armenian drams, which she will use to buy a computer and professional literature for her self-development activities. She believes that for every person it is never late to learn and find something new.

loans.use: to purchase a computer and professional literature for her self-development activities.

loans.name: Muhamad

texts.en:
With the previous loan, Muhamad was able to buy sugar, soap and cooking oil to sell. The profits helped him to pay medical bills for the family,school fees and other scholastic materials plus saving some little money. Because of the increasing demand of his customers, Muhamad does not have enough money to purchase the required stock hence seeking for credit to buy cooking oil, salt,soft drinks and others to sell.

He is still operating the same businesses of retail, selling fire wood and banana growing, the business he started way back in 1992, with a hope of rising more income for his family. He is facing a challenge of low capital, which hinders his business growth. However, he has future prospects of constructing a good house for his family and expanding his business to new areas.

loans.use: to buy cooking oil, salt,soft drinks and others to sell.

loans.name: Veronica Del Carmen

texts.es:
Verónica administra una sala de belleza, su esposo también aporta para los gastos familiares, vive con su hija de 15 años de edad, ella desarrolla las actividades de maquillaje, cortes de cabello, faciales, etc., ya cuenta con mucha experiencia en el área.
Comprará tintes, uñas acrílicas, esmaltes, cosméticos., etc., tendrá un inventario surtido para fortalecer la sala de belleza, espera aprovechar la oportunidad de invertir en el negocio para atender mejor a sus clientes y generar más ingresos.
Los proyectos que Verónica tiene son crecer junto a su negocio y apoyar a su hija incondicionalmente para que siga estudiando.
texts.en:
Veronica runs a beauty parlor, her husband also contributes to family expenses.  She lives with her daughter who is 15 years old.

She is involved in the makeup, haircuts, facials, etc. business.  She has much experience in this area.

She will purchase dyes, acrylic nails, nail polish, cosmetics, etc., and she will have an assorted inventory to strengthen her beauty parlor.  She hopes to take advantage of the opportunity to invest in the business to better serve her customers and generate more revenue.

The projects that Veronica has are to grow with her business and support her daughter unconditionally to continue studying.

loans.use: to purchase dyes, acrylic nails, nail polish, cosmetics, etc., she will have an assorted inventory to strengthen her beauty salon

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en:
Parveen is 55 years old, a married woman and mother of six children. Her son is a driver by profession and provides transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw. He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family's expenses, but now it requires proper maintenance to keep it in its functional routine.

For this reason, Parveen has applied for a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan for her son. He wants to fix the rickshaw's engine and body. This will help him drive more smoothly and provide a better transport service to his passengers.

Parveen is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her son and will bring positive changes to his business. She gives thanks to Kiva and to its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: cover the repairs of a rickshaw's engine and body for her son's transportation services.

loans.name: Rosalia Group

texts.es: La Alcancía Comunal “Rosalía” está conformada por 06 socios entusiastas. Este es el caso de Ida  de 39 años de edad, conviviente con 03 hijos dependientes. La Sra. Ida es una madre empeñosa que con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación trata de sacar adelante a su familia. Actualmente se dedica  a la venta de muebles del hogar. En esta oportunidad solicitó el crédito para la compra de más sillas, mesas y stands. El deseo de ida es ampliar se negoció. El grupo “Rosalía” agradece a Kiva por la ayuda brindada. Ida es la segunda del lado derecho viste polo color negro.
texts.en:
The communal bank 'Rosalía' is made up of six enthusiastic members. This is the case of Ida, who is 39 years old and lives with her partner and three dependent children.

Señora Ida is a hard-working mother who, with a lot of effort and dedication, works to help her family get ahead. Her current job is selling household furniture. On this occasion, she has requested the loan for the purchase of more chairs, tables and stands. Ida's dream is to grow her business.

The 'Rosalía' group thanks Kiva for the help provided. Ida is second from the right and is wearing a black t-shirt.

loans.use: to purchase more chairs, tables and stands.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en: Elena and her family lives in the town of Tubigon in Bohol, Philippines.  She is 65 years old married woman and has five adult children that has already been grown up. Her husband works hard as a farmer while Elena is engaged in “buri” weaving. She has been doing this for how many years and become proficient. To earn a living and to help her husband in their daily expenses she has been working hard to improve this business. Thus, she is asking a loan to buy “buri” (the largest palm in the Philippines) leaves used in weaving.

loans.use: to buy "buri" leaves

loans.name: Titalyn

texts.en:
Titalyn is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Titalyn is 46 years old and has one child still in school.

Titalyn has a buy and sell rice grain business in the Philippines. Titalyn requested a PHP 29000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more sacks of rice grains to sell.

Titalyn has been in this business for 11 years. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of rice grains to sell

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann works hard to support her family. Mary Ann is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Mary Ann has been in this business for 8 years now.

In the future, Mary Ann would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Fe works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from general store. Fe is borrowing PHP 20000 through NWTF to buy more fish to sell to her stall.

Fe has been sustaining her business activities through her past 7 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to her stall

loans.name: Armine

texts.en:
Armine is 42 years old and she lives with her husband and two sons in Tashir city of Lori region. Armine graduated Vanadzor State Pedagogical University the faculty of Education of Elementary Classes and Methodology. Armine is very happy and greatly enjoys of working of her profession. She has only 8 years of experience in pedagogical sphere but she is already beloved and very much respected teacher in the school where she now works as a teacher of elementary classes. She also organizes private courses at her house helping some pupils to overcome their hardships in their studying and get prepared for their lessons.

Armine is very happy to see her pupils active and interested in their lessons and she wants to give as much that is interesting and useful for them as possible. This loan will be great for Armine as she wants to furnish the room of her courses making it more comfortable both for her and for her pupils as well.

loans.use: to furnish the room of her courses making it more comfortable both for her and for her pupils as well.

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
Razia is a 52-year-old woman. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan, with her five children. Razia is also providing sewing services and earns income to contribute with her husband to manage the household.

She needs different kinds of goods, e.g., needles, threads, pieces of cloth, machine oil, etc., but due to insufficient financial means, she is unable to purchase these accessories.

Therefore, she has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her to purchase these above accessories and also will be helpful for her to increase monthly sales and profit by providing better sewing services.

Razia is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan

loans.use: to increase her tailoring business.

loans.name: Katikarungi Farmers Group

texts.en:
Lucy a 30 year old woman is married with five children living in Kyenjojo-Uganda. She sells agricultural produce like maize, beans and coffee as determined by seasonality for her income. She is a very hardworking lady geared towards development and her group members believe in her as she is the chairperson. She dreams of constructing a well furnished residential house and educating her children for a bright future.

She is ambitious of seeing her business grow but only limited by the small capital base yet she desires to diversify her business that needs enough capital. Lucy is requesting for a loan to buy more maize and beans for selling. She is a member of Katikarungi farmers where members guarantee each other to get a loan facility.

loans.use: to buy more maize and beans for selling.

loans.name: Baman Charan

texts.en:
Baman Charan is a 31-year-old differently abled unmarried man. He hails from the village of Anandpur, Odisha, India. He lives in a joint family having eight members in his house. Baman Charan is a man with sheer grit. He has never allowed his physical disability to act as a barrier in his life. He took all the hurdles and difficulties very sportively and always found ways to overcome those hurdles.He has been running a garment shop for the last five years near his house and has been supporting his family.

He is requesting a loan amount of 30,000 INR from Kiva's partner Peoples Forum to increase the stock of garments in his shop so as to match the demands of the customers with his supply. The loan amount will help him in generating an additional amount of revenue, which he will further reinvest in his business and renovate his shop in order to attract the premium segment of customers.

Baman Charan is eagerly awaiting your kind help.

loans.use: to increase the stock of garments in his shop

loans.name: Srim Group

texts.en:
Srim is a 36-year-old married rice farmer of three children who lives in the Tbong Khmum Province in Cambodia. She has been cultivating rice for over fifteen years. The two children attend school. Her husband is 32 years old and is also a rice farmer. Together, they can make an income of USD 10 per day.

Now Srim, who is a group leader, would like to apply for a group loan of two members and she will use her portion to buy the foundation and parts of a latrine. This loan will help her and her family live in hygienic living conditions. In the future, she is going to support all her children to finish high school.

loans.use: to buy the foundation and parts of a latrine.

loans.name: Jorge Antonio

texts.es: Jorge de 43 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, el se dedica a la agricultura desde hace 25 años su principal cultivo es el maiz y frijol inicio con capital propio, con las ventas que realiza de sus cultivos en los pueblos aledaños logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el esta solicitando un credito para la compra de abono, controles de plagas, herbicidas asi como muestra en la fotografia para poder obtener una buena cosecha y asi tener mejores ingresos economicos.
texts.en:
Jorge is 43 years old and lives in his own home with his family. He has made his living farming for 25 years. His main crops are corn and beans and he started up by using his own capital.

With the sales of his crops in nearby towns, he manages to cover some of the costs of his home. He is requesting a loan to purchase fertilizer, pesticides and herbicides (as shown in the picture) so he can have a good harvest and a better income.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, pesticides, and herbicides.

loans.name: Tupendane C Group

texts.en:
Halima,who is in her late 30's, is married with six kids. Three of them are grown up and the rest are still in school. For five years now, she has been supporting her family with mama lishe (food vending) business, serving breakfast and lunch foods.

Halima works from 08am to 06pm daily and is able to earn a good profit each month. This is her 15th loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania, to be apportioned among her four-member group called Tupendane C. The group members will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

She used the previous credits, since paid back successfully, to improve her business (she bought food and cooking ingredients for her mama lishe). Halima earned some extra income which she used to cover school fees for her three children, to repay a loan, saved some in her bank account and for household expenses. She is so thankful and really appreciates Kiva for its loan support to her group.

In the coming years, she would like to expand her business.

Halima will use this credit request to buy kilos of rice, cooking oil, maize, beans and sugar for her mama lishe.

loans.use: to buy kilos of rice, cooking oil, maize, beans and sugar for her mama lishe (food vending).

loans.name: Sofia

texts.en:
Sofia is very industrious woman residing in the rural town of Tolosa, Leyte. She engages in making concrete blocks and sold it to the locals in her place. Aside from manufacturing concrete blocks, she also runs a sari-sari (variety ) store, selling basic household commodities like eggs, powdered milk, seasonings, sugar, edible oil and toiletries.

She is 47 years of age, widow woman and has three children, all of them are still attending school.

She wants to continue improving her quality of life, which is why she is requesting a loan with CEVI to purchase materials like cement and stocks for the store. These are vital in augmenting her daily earnings. She could have an abundant supply of concrete blocks and her store is full of merchandise as well. Causing more customers to shop and enabling Sofia to pay her obligation.

In the future, Sofia is determined that she will doing her best for the welfare of her growing children and for the improvement of the family;s living condition.

loans.use: to purchase materials like cement and stocks for the store

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en: Rebecca lives a simple life with her family in a town of Tubigon, Bohol. She is married and has four children; ages 20, 19, 15 and 13 years old. Rebecca is engaged in buying and selling beauty products, personal care products, cosmetics and apparels. She and her husband are also running a sari-sari store and merchandize. They have been doing this for 11 years to earn a living and to provide the needs of their family. Thus, she is asking for a bigger amount loan to for additional capital to buy shirts, shoes, sandals, under wears, lotion, fragrances, cosmetics and other products for their store in order to increase their sales as to her profit. 45 years old Rebecca dreams to improve their livelihood to be able to have enough money to send their children to school and finished their degrees.

loans.use: to buy shirts, shoes, sandals, under wears, lotion, fragrances, cosmetics and other products for their store

loans.name: Rubie

texts.en: Rubie is a 36-year old married  with 2 children living in Dela Paz, Clarin  . She has been in her sari-sari store business for 4 years. ,To sustain the daily needs, she has to earn and be fervent like any others. So then, she borrows amount from GDMPC microfinance for additional capital in her business to buy more good items for store to sell. She still hopes that someday she can expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more goods for her store to sell.

loans.name: Benito

texts.en:
Benito is a man from Valencia, Bohol. He is married with two children ages one and seven. Benito works hard to provide for them. He owns a tailoring business. When there is no demand for this, he raise hogs and farms rice for supplemental income. Benito is asking a loan to expand his business. He will use it to buy clothing, piglets and feed.

Benito aims at making his business sustainable so he can provide his family their basic needs.

loans.use: to buy clothing, piglets and feed

loans.name: Stewart

texts.en: Stewart aged 47, is a hardworking father of two children who lives in Hoima, Uganda used the previous loan to buy coffee to sell which season was very successful. He deals in produce, primarily buying and selling of beans and rice. He dreams of expanding and diversifying his business more to include farming to make ends meet only to be challenged by high transportation costs. He will use the loan facility to buy maize to sell.

loans.use: to buy maize to sell.

loans.name: Lucio

texts.es:
Lucio con la facilidad que le han dado los créditos mantiene su fuente de ingresos estable, vendió a mejor precio los animales y sus cultivos le dieron cosechas abundantes, con las ganancias compro una vaca.
Está solicitando un nuevo crédito para comprar cerdos, ganado e insumos agrícolas fortalecerá su negocio y se mantendrá trabajando en el campo, espera continuar atendiendo a sus clientes y cubriendo las necesidades familiares.
texts.en:
With the ease that Lucio has been granted the loans, his source of income remains stable.  He sold  his animals at a better price, and his crops provided an abundant harvest.  With the profits he bought a cow. 

He is requesting a new loan to purchase pigs, cattle and agricultural inputs to strengthen his business and to continue working in the field.  

He hopes to continue serving customers and meeting the family's needs.

loans.use: to purchase pigs, cattle and agricultural inputs to strengthen his business and to continue working in the field

loans.name: Ashok

texts.en:
Ashok is a 36-year-old differntly abled married man with two children in his care. He is from a village in Anandpur, Odisha, India. He has been running a grocery store for the past 10 years. He is the sole earner in his family. Ashok is a very hardworking man who works 12 hours a day in order to earn a living for his family.The income that he earns is used to meet the daily expenses of his family and to pay the fees of his two school-going children.

He is requesting a loan amount of 20,000 INR in order to diversify his product line by adding more products to it like beverages, snack items, pickles, jams, jellies and other semi-processed food items. Diversification of his product line will help in generating higher returns to him and he can upgrade his living standards.

Ashok aspires to build a new house for his family in the near future and lead a happy life with them.

loans.use: to diversify his product line by adding more products to his shop

loans.name: Kalpalata's Group

texts.en:
Kalpalata, standing on the extreme right-hand side in the photograph, is a mother of two children. She, her husband, and her children reside in the Mayurbhanj district of Odisha, India. Kalpalata and her husband have a monthly income of 5,000 INR. Every month she is forced to fork out around Rs 400 towards her family’s medical expenses as a result of the sanitation crisis they face. Like many Indians, Kalpalata and her family still do not have access to modern sanitation, and are forced to defecate in the open. Open defecation is disastrous as it is impossible to keep human feces away from crops, wells, food, and children. According to studies, hundreds of children die every year due to preventable sanitary-related diseases. Lack of sanitation facilities also means trekking at-least a kilometer to relieve themselves. And women like Kalpalata bear the brunt, as they are mostly attacked and assaulted when they step out early in the morning or late in the evening.

In order to improve their sanitation facilities, Kalpalata has approached Peoples Forum, Kiva’s partner, seeking a loan of 45,000 INR. She intends to use the loan towards construction of a toilet at home. Your loan will help Kalpalata and her family to improve the quality of their lives.

She is eagerly awaiting for your kind help.

loans.use: to build a clean and hygienic toilet at her home

loans.name: Sokan's Group

texts.en:
Sokan, aged 50 years, is married with two children. Living in Preah Vihear province, Sokan is making rice wine and growing rice to support family’s living. These businesses earn her about USD14 per day and can save about USD11 per day for future needs. 
Now, Sokan is leading a group member to request loans from VisionFund. She will use her loan to build a decent latrine for her family. She hopes that this latrine will keep her and her family healthy and prevent from infectious diseases.

loans.use: to build a decent latrine for her family. .

loans.name: Ghanashyam

texts.en:
Ghanashyam is a 35-year-old differently abled married man with three children in his care. He is a resident of a village in Anandpur, Odisha, India. Don't count your chickens before they hatch, goes an old proverb. But for Ghanashyam, it's a way of life and means of sustenance. He has been in this poultry business for last two years now. He runs a poultry business from the premises of his home. Over the last two years, Ghanashyam has acquired the skills of animal husbandry and developed a loyal clientèle. But as with most small-scale businesses, gathering the financial resources to expand his venture remains a major challenge.

He has, therefore, applied for a loan of 20,000 INR, which will allow him to invest in more than four dozen chickens and provide for their fodder, transportation and necessary medication. Healthy chicken equals healthy produce and increased profits.

loans.use: to invest in more than four dozen chickens and provide for their fodder, transportation and necessary medication.

loans.name: Shazia

texts.en:
Shazia is a 38-year old woman. She lives in the city of Lahore, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of two sons and two daughters.

Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession. He has been running an auto rickshaw for the last six years. For the past few days his rickshaw has not been working properly because of so much use. He feels that most of its parts are worn out, so he is unable to generate any amount of income. He wants to buy a new auto rickshaw. However, due to the lack of money he finds it difficult to cover the cost of a new rickshaw.

Therefore she has requested for a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband to cover the cost of a new rickshaw. This will help him to continue his business. Shazia is so thankful to Kiva and Brac Pakistan

loans.use: to buy a new auto rickshaw for her husband's transportation services.

loans.name: Fahari Yetu Group

texts.en:
Neema, who is in her early 30s, is married with two school-going children. For the past three years, she has been selling charcoal and fruits and vegetables. She works from 08 am to 08 pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Neema's fifth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. The previous loan she paid very well and she used the previous loan to increase the stock of charcoal and fruits and vegetable items.

She will use this loan to buy more stock of charcoal and fruits and vegetables for her business.

She dreams of expanding her business and opening a tailoring shop.

She will share this loan with her loan group "Fahari Yetu," which has two members who will hold each other accountable for repaying the loan.

loans.use: to buy more stock of charcoal and fruits and vegetables for her business.

loans.name: Panha's Group

texts.en:
Panha is a 35-year-old widowed rice farmer with two children who resides in the Tbong Khmum Province in Cambodia. She has been a farmer for over 14 years so far. Two of her children attend school. Panha can make approximately $3 per day.

She is requesting a group loan for three members and she will use her portion to buy construction materials to build a latrine.

This loan will provide her and her family with hygienic living conditions.

For her future goals, she wants to buy more farmland to cultivate rice, renovate her house and help her children finish high school.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to build a latrine.

loans.name: Asenal Group

texts.en:
Prisca is a mother of one boy school-aged child. She is not married. Prisca makes her family living by managing a a cosmetics shop. She starts doing business from 08 am to 4pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit. This will be her 7th loan request from Kiva's partner, Tujijenge Tanzania.

Prisca will use this loan to increase stock of cosmetics in her shop. She dreams of expanding her business and building her own house. She will share this loan with her loan group" Asenal", which totals two members, who will hold each other accountable for repaying the loan.

loans.use: to increase stock of cosmetics in her shop.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali now owns a school which has been running for the last 15 years. There are 186 students in the school and in order to provide them with the necessary furniture and maintain their building, Ali has taken a loan of PKR 100,000.

The school is situated in a rural area and normally these children have no access to education, due to their geography and parents had been particularly resistant to girls' education. However, Ali has worked hard to provide the right environment to encourage the community to accept the school.

He aims to register the school as a secondary school in the near future.

loans.use: to provide his students with the necessary furniture and to maintain their school building.

loans.name: Rukhsana

texts.en: Rukhsana is 31 years old. She opened a school in 2005 because she wanted to teach and promote education. Ten years later, she has 114 students, 52% of which are girls and 48% are boys. Currently, she has taken a loan of PKR 75,000 in order to buy furniture and fund other small improvements. Rukhsana aims to increase the status of her school and her capacity to teach even more children.

loans.use: to buy furniture and fund other small improvements.

loans.name: Diosdada

texts.en:
Diosdada comes from Segatic Daku, Clarin. She cultivates cassava on her plantation. She is 36 and has 8 children. Diosdada wants to give her family good living conditions so she requested a microcredit load from GDMPC to buy fertilizer for her cassava farm in order to improve her farm.

Diosdada's plan for the future to buy a 4 wheel vehicle to use for delivery of cassava to her customers.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her cassava farm.

loans.name: Dara

texts.en:
Dara, 48, a lovely father of two children who are enrolled in high school, lives in Prey Chhor District, Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia.

So far, it has been more than 15 years that he has been involved in a small business, which can earn a net profit of USD 2.5 per day. During this time, Dara has been faced with a financial issue in his family, which he still can’t afford.

He decided to apply for a Kiva loan through HKL to buy more goods to expand his business to get more income. He would like to thank all the lenders for their generosity.

loans.use: to buy more goods to expand his business to get more income

loans.name: Sughran

texts.en:
Sughran is a 50-years old married woman and lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of nine-children. Her one son owns an artificial jewellery shop which is the only source of income for the family. Her son wants to purchase variety of jewellery for the shop that includes bangles, necklace, rings, bracelets etc.

Therefore Sughran has requested for a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase artificial jewellery for her son's shop. She is hopeful that the loan will be productive one for the business.

loans.use: to buy bangles, necklace, rings, bracelets etc for her son's artificial jewellery shop.

loans.name: Shahzadi

texts.en:
SHAHZADI is 48 years old, married, and the mother of four children.

Her son is a driver by profession and provides transportation services using his rickshaw, which is in bad condition. He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family expenses, but now it requires proper maintenance to keep it in its functional form.

For this reason, SHAHZADI has contacted Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so that her son can repair his rickshaw. He wants to maintain the engine’s piston, one wheel and wants to pay the labor cost for it. This will help him drive more smoothly and provide better transportation services to his passengers.

SHAHZADI is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her son and will bring positive changes to his business. SHAHZADI thanks Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to repair a rickshaw for her son's transportation services.

loans.name: Ghada

texts.en: Ghada, 46, is an enterprising woman. She is a mother of five sons who depend on her and they need much support in their studies. Her husband is working in another area called Gaza. She is a tailor; this business gives her an opportunity to work and helps her to survive. She has applied for a loan in order to buy fabric cutter, thread, accessories to increase her production then she hopes to have better income, and help her sons in improving their standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fabric cutter, thread, accessories to have greater sales and increase production and to generate better income for her sons.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to build a water source at their home to improve access to clean water and sanitation  for their family. .

loans.name: Amigos De La Zona Q Group

texts.es: MILA de 39 años de edad es conviviente y tiene 4 hijos. Ella Pertenece a la Alcancía Comunal “AMIGOS DE LA ZONA Q” la cual lo conforman 06 socios con deseos de  trabajar honradamente y progresar. Ella hace más de 5 años que puso una bodega en su casa donde vende todo tipo de abarrotes y bebidas. Su mayor deseo es de poder ampliar su negocio. Solicitó el crédito para la compra de gaseosas arroz y azúcar. La Alcancía “amigos de la zona q” agradece a los Inversionistas de Kiva por el apoyo y se comprometen a seguir trabajando. Mila es la segunda del lado derecho viste polo floreado.
texts.en:
Mila is 39 years old, and she lives with her partner and has four children. She is part of the communal bank "Los Amigos de la Zona Q" [Friends from Zone Q], comprised of 6 partners with the desire to make an honest living and move forward. More than five years ago, she started a small grocery store at her house, where she sells all types of groceries and drinks. Her greatest wish is to be able to expand her business. She requested the loan to buy sodas, rice and sugar.

The communal bank,  "Amigos de la Zona Q" thanks the Kiva investors for the support and commits to continue working. Mila is the second from the right wearing a floral print shirt.

loans.use: to buy sodas, rice and sugar.

loans.name: Rosel

texts.en:
Rosel is 31 years old and runs a small business selling local snacks like popsicles, rice cakes, pop corn, roasted peanuts and steamed muffins. She also sell home-cooked dish such as noodles, adobo (Filipino dish of chicken or pork stewed in vinegar, garlic, soy sauce, bay leaves, and peppercorns) and sauteed vegetables.  Rosel has sold food in this area for more than ten years.

Rosel has requested a loan from CEVI to buy flour, peanuts, pop corn, sugar, noodles, pork and chicken.
Rosel and her husband have 5 children ages four to sixteen. She and her family lives in Duero, Bohol.

loans.use: to buy flour, peanuts, pop corn, sugar, noodles, pork and chicken

loans.name: Zohra

texts.en:
Zohra is a 60-year-old married woman living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of four children.

Her son provides whitewash and oil paint services to his customers in the community; sometimes he has to go out of the city also. He has gotten a new contract to whitewash and paint a newly constructed house, but he has no paint brush or rollers for providing those services.

Zohra has requested a loan so that her son can buy new paint brushes, rollers, kerosene oil, etc. His savings is very small, which is why he is unable to buy new tools for his business. She wants to change this condition of her family and hopes that this loan will prove beneficial for her son as well as for the entire family.

She is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy new paint brushes, rollers, kerosene oil, etc. for her son's whitewash services.

loans.name: Chandraka's Group

texts.en:
Forty-three-year-old Chandraka is a rural housewife in a small village in Mayurbhanj district of Odisha, India. The lady standing in the middle in the photograph is Chandraka, a lady with sheer grit and confidence. She lives there with her husband and three children (a son and two daughters).

Chandraka is a homemaker and her husband works in a garment showroom as a salesman, but the family income is insufficient to cover the household expenses of the family of five. A toilet is one of the most basic necessities but Chandraka uses a toilet where the roof and walls are without plaster and have started leaking. Due to long years of wear and tear, they may collapse and turn into a life hazard.
