This is why Chandraka, along with her group members, is seeking a loan of 45,000 INR from Kiva's partner, Peoples Forum. She will use her portion of the loan amount to repair her toilet. She will use the loan money to plaster the walls and the roof of her toilet, which will be a big step towards a better standard of living for the family.

Chandraka is extending her heartiest thanks to her generous lenders.

loans.use: to repair her toilet

loans.name: Biccha's Group

texts.en:
Biccha is a 32-year-old married woman standing in the middle of the photograph. She hails from Mayurbhanj district in Odisha, India. She, along with her group members, is seeking a loan of 45,000 INR. She will use her portion of the loan amount to construct a toilet in her home. Biccha lives in a home with no access to a toilet, thereby forcing the family members to go outdoors to relieve themselves. They have to travel long distances at odd hours of the night and they are vulnerable to crimes and molestation. Building a private toilet in the house will help prevent diseases that are caused from open defecation and promote a healthier lifestyle. Plus, having a toilet will save them the money every month that they are spending on diseases caused by open defecation. This loan will give them access to a better, safer, healthier quality of life.

Biccha is in dire need of your kind help.

loans.use: to construct a toilet in her home

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
For more than 20 years Susan has operated her small business in the town of Duero in Bohol. She farms rice for an income.

Susan also has a second business where she sells barbecued meat and dried fish. This second business provides a supplemental income which Susan needs to support her family.

Susan has asked for a loan from CEVI to expand her business. She would like to buy fertilizer, pesticides and seedlings. This will allow her to plant on-time and fertilizer will keep her crops lush and healthy.

Susan is 49 years old and the mother of 4 children, all of whom are currently studying in school. She also dreamed of having a beautiful and concrete house in the future.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, pesticides and seedlings

loans.name: Roquena

texts.en:
Roquena, a thirty-four year old married woman and has three children. She owns a sari-sari(variety) store, selling basic commodities ranging from biscuits, cooking oil, candies, shampoo, toothpaste, canned goods and condiments.
Aside from operating a sari-sari(variety) store, she also sold clothing like pants, shirts, blouses and jeans.
Her husband has an income that could help defray the family's daily expenses.

She would like to buy additional rtw(ready-to-wear) and assorted stocks for the store. With these, her store will be filled with variety of goods, enabling potential customers to shop. She could able to meet the demand on clothing as she could have sufficient supply too.

Roquena hopes that she will be able to handle her both sources of income successfully to continue support the needs of her growing children.

loans.use: to buy additional  rtw(ready-to-wear) and assorted stocks for the store

loans.name: Maria Lucena

texts.en:
Maria Lucena is already 45 years old, a married woman and blessed with 2 children; a member of Gata Daku MPC since June 2008, the coop classified her as a MIGS member (MEMBER IN GOOD STANDING).

She has a good reputation in Poblacion, Sinacaban Misamis Occidental. Her husband is a fisherman and it is hard to earn a regular income for this kind of job because it requires a good weather in order to catch big fishes. For this, Maria Lucena decided to help her husband to look for a business that can help her family survive the financial crisis. She made a garden & planted it with vegetables. She has to buy additional seedlings & fertilizer, in order to realize the plan, she went to Gata Daku MPC to borrow money amounting to P 16,000.00 and luckily she got the funds she needed.
In the near future, Maria Lucena and her husband plans to have a new pump boat to be used as a “rent a boat”.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and fertilizer

loans.name: Saul

texts.en:
As a previous member of Gata Daku Multi-Purpose Cooperative (GDMPC), Saul is planning to expand his business by being funded again.

Saul is 47 years old, married, and blessed with two beautiful daughters, both of whom are in school. His wife is the one who managed the 'boarding house for rent' business. Because of the increasing tuition fees of his children, he was obliged to look for additional income that can help to support them.

Saul engages in gardening. He plants vegetables, such as amplaya, okra, and ginger. He has been doing this for ten years.

At this time, Saul needs to buy fertilizer and additional seedlings for his garden in order to earn a good profit. He went to Gata Daku to borrow money amounting to PHP 5,000.

He was asked by one of the staff of his future plans and then he replied “If God will permit, I would like to have another boarding house for rent and build my grocery store in it.”

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seedlings for his vegetable garden.

loans.name: Amalvy Esther

texts.es: Amalvy de 30 años es habitante de un barrio popular ubicado en Barranquilla en donde reside en compañía de su cónyuge, sus tres pequeños hijos y suegra, de quien aprendió el oficio de las confecciones.  Su suegra es una experta en este arte y en su taller de confecciones le permitió realizar sus primeras creaciones. Hoy en día elabora todo tipo de prendas de vestir masculina; camisillas, suéteres, polos y ropa interior, y distribuye a colmenas ubicadas en el centro de Barranquilla, conocidos y vecinos.  Amalvy cuenta con tres años de experiencia en esta labor y ha logrado consolidar a su clientela, en la actualidad está aplicando una solicitud de crédito,  su primer credikiva financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para comprar telas y confeccionar ropa masculina para aprovechar la temporada que se avecina de fin de año, de este modo podrá ofertar más surtido y sus clientes estarán más satisfechos. Su meta a futuro es aperturar un almacén que le proporcione mayores ingresos para poder ofrecer estudios profesionales a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Amalvy is 30 years old and lives in a popular neighborhood in Barranquilla where she lives with her spouse, her three young children and mother in law, from whom she learned the trade of sewing. 

Her mother in law is an expert in this art and allowed her to make her first creations in her clothing shop. Today, she creates all kinds of garments for men, tank tops, sweaters, shirts and underwear, and distributes to stores located in downtown Barranquilla, to acquaintances and to neighbors. 

Amalvy has three years of experience in this work and has consolidated her clientele.  She is currently requesting a loan, her first credikiva, though the  Mario Santo Domingo Foundation to purchase fabrics and make menswear to harness the year end season coming up.  Thus she may offer more variety and her customers will be more satisfied. 

Her future goal is to open a store that will provide higher income so that she will be able to offer a professional education to her children.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics

loans.name: Yeny Del Carmen

texts.es: Yeny es una microempresaria de 47 años que emprendió su propio negocio luego de haberse trasladado de Buenaventura un municipio del departamento del Valle del Cauca hasta la ciudad de Barranquilla en compañía de su cónyuge y sus tres hijas.  Ella accedió a tomar unas capacitaciones en mercadeo y ventas que una amiga le había sugerido, y al poco tiempo se incorporó a una forma masiva de comercialización a través de las ventas de productos por intermedio de catálogos. En la actualidad cuenta con cuatro años en la labor ofreciendo colonias, bisutería, cremas corporales, cosméticos y todo artículo del catálogo en vigencia a conocidos, vecinos y familiares. Ella les ofrece facilidades de pago, sin embargo su capital no le está abasteciendo para cumplir con todos los pedidos, es por ello que está aplicando una solicitud de crédito,  su primer credikiva financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para invertir en los productos del catálogo y cumplir con los requerimientos de los clientes.  Su meta  a futuro es incrementar sus ingresos y ayudar a su familia.
texts.en:
Yeni is a micro-businesswoman who is 47 years old. She began her own business after having moved from Buenaventura, a town in the department of Valle del Cauca, to the city of Barranquilla, accompanied by her partner and their three daughters. She agreed to take some courses in marketing and sales that a friend had suggested, and in a short time she got into mass marketing through the sales of products via catalogs.

Currently she has four years in this business, offering colognes, jewelry, body lotions, cosmetics, and all items in the latest catalog, to acquaintances, neighbors and family members. She offers them payment plans, however, her capital isn't sufficient to fill all the orders. For that reason, she is applying for a loan, her first Kiva loan through the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation, to invest in products from the catalog and fulfill her customers' requests. Her future goal is to increase her income and help her family.

loans.use: to buy products from a catalog.

loans.name: Martha Cecilia

texts.es: Martha tiene 47 años de edad, es de estado civil casada, vive con su esposo que se dedica a la agricultura y sus hijos, Edison de 16 años y Rubén de 7 años, su actividad diaria es la crianza y venta de chanchos, es un trabajo que requiere de dedicación y mucha responsabilidad, a pesar de su avanzada edad de Doña Martha lo realiza. Solicita el crédito para comprar mas crías así su negocio aumentaría y su actividad económica también.
texts.en: Marta is 47 years old and married. She lives with her husband, who works in agriculture, and their children, Edison, 16, and Ruben, 7. Her daily occupation is the raising and selling of pigs. It is work that requires dedication and much responsibility; despite her advanced age, Doña Marta performs the work. She is requesting a loan to buy more piglets; thus her business will increase and its economic activity as well.

loans.use: buy and sell pigs.

loans.name: Tulasi's Group

texts.en:
Tulasi, 32, standing in the middle in the photograph, is a hardworking lady from Mayurbhanj district of Odisha, India. She has a family of five and is a blessed mother of two sons and one daughter who are currently in school and continuing their studies.

Tulasi hails from a low-income household and has access to very limited resources. For this reason, she was never able to build a suitable toilet for her family. Without access to a toilet, she faces a lot of problems as she has to travel a long distance to relieve herself and she can sense the risk associated with open defecation and urination. She no longer finds it feasible enough to depend on an open field for defecation.

Therefore, Tulasi, along with her other group members, is requesting a loan amount of 45,000 INR. She will use her portion of the loan amount to build a hygienic toilet and install a commode in it. Access to basic sanitation will consequently result in safety, improved health, medical savings, and improved productivity.

loans.use: to build a hygienic toilet

loans.name: Byron Andres

texts.es: Byron tiene 22 años de edad, es de estado civil casado, vive con su esposa y su pequeña hija Meredid de 8 meses de edad, vive en el sector rural, su principal actividad económica es la venta de leche, aunque es un trabajo muy duro todos los días los realiza con mucha responsabilidad y constancia, el  solicita el crédito para la compra de una vaca lechera, así incrementara la producción  de leche y por ende sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Byron is 22 years old. He is in a common law marriage and lives with his wife and his young daughter, Meredid, who is 8 months old. He lives in a rural sector. His works selling milk. Although it's a very hard job every day, he works at it with great responsibility and resolve.

He seeks a loan to buy a dairy cow, in order to increase his production of milk, and therefore his earnings.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Kiran

texts.en:
Kiran is a 29-years-old married woman; she is a responsible mother and living happily in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.
Her husband is involved in scrap dealing business and deals with the scrap goods such as iron, ,plastic accessories and waste papers. He has been purchasing scrap goods and selling it to the recycling factories. Nowadays due to household expenses he does not have amount to buy scrap goods and does not have scrap even in stock to sell for generating income.

Therefore, KIRAN has requested a loan for her husband, so he can buy scrap goods, establish his enterprise, and make some savings to meet sudden needs or incidents.
She is very impressed with this honorable support and shows her wish to take more loans after the payment of this loan. She thanks to the Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy scrap goods for her husband's recycle material sale and purchase business.

loans.name: Seina's Group

texts.en: Seina’s group live in a rural village in Phnom Penh province in Cambodia. Seina makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as factory laborer and construction worker to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these woman and men to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.	.

loans.name: Zakia

texts.en:
Zakia is a 40-year old married woman living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She has requested a loan for her husband's fruit selling business. He owns a fruit selling business in a nearby fruit market. With the increase in the household expenses, she wants to grow the business also.

Therefore, Zakia has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan so that her husband will be able to buy fresh fruit. She wants to save the profit amount so that she can face any sudden incidents or for medical treatment for her children.

Zakia hopes that this loan will prove productive for her and she will save a reasonable amount soon. Zakia is very thankful to Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy fresh fruits for her husband's fruit selling business.

loans.name: Marjona

texts.en:
Marjona was born in the year 1994. She is a smart and clever girl. Marjona since childhood has read a lot of books. Her parents are educated people. Marjona is a student of the 4th course in Tajikistan State University. She studies in the accountancy unit.

After graduating university she plans to work in any state organization as an accountant. Marjona reads a lot of books from the library of her university.

Marjona is asking for a loan of 4,600 Somoni to pay for the university tuition. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to pay for the university tuition.

loans.name: Sonia  Del Carmen

texts.es: Sonia de 38 años de edad vive en casa propia con su hijo, ella es una mujer muy trabajadora que siempre ha buscado la manera de poder salir adelante, por esa razon desde hace 7 años se dedica a la elaboracion y venta de tamales pisques (tamales elaborados de maiz, frijoles fritos y sasonadores)los cuales vende de manera ambulante por las diferentes colonias que se encuentran cerca de su casa y tiene muchos clientes por los buenos precios, ella esta solicitando un credito para la compra de ingredientes maiz, frijoles, sasonadores, manteca, hojas de huerta para cubrirlos entre otras cosas y asi poder tener mejores ingresos economicos.
texts.en:
Sonia is 38 years old, lives in her own house and has a son. She is a very hard-worker woman and is always seeking a way to progress. This is why she has been working producing and selling "tamales pisques" (tamales made from corn, fried beans, and seasoning) for seven years. She sells them as a street vendor in different neighborhoods that are found close to her home.  She has many customers because she offers good prices. 

She is requesting a loan to buy ingredients like corn, beans, seasoning, oil and green leaves to wrap the tamales among other things, so that she can increase her income.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like corn, beans, seasoning, oil, and green leaves to wrap tamales.

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es:
Manuel es un hombre de 38 años de edad, es casado con una linda familia con el que vive. Manuel con mucho esfuerzo todos los días sale a trabajar en sus tierras bajo el radiante sol. Él cuenta que gracias a su crédito pudo realizar la inversión en su cultivo de arveja china, afortunadamente pudo venderlos a un buen precio en su mercado regional.  Manuel nuevamente solicita un préstamo para su cultivo de zanahoria compra de semillas y abono orgánico pues la época ya se acerca y es necesario cultivar pronto para obtener una buena cosecha.
Sus esperanzas de vida es fortalecer sus cultivo, mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia y contar con un local para instalar un negocio.
texts.en:
Manuel is a 38 year old man. He is married and has a lovely family with whom he lives. With great effort, Manuel goes to work every day in his fields under the bright sun. He states that thanks to a prior loan he was able to invest in his snow pea crop. Fortunately he was able to sell them at a good price in the regional market.

Manuel seeks a new loan for his carrot crop, to buy seeds and organic fertilizer, as the season is approaching, and he needs to plant soon in order to obtain a good harvest. His dream in life is to strengthen his crops, improve the quality of life for his family, and have a locale in which to put a business.

loans.use: to buy seeds and organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Gertrudis Del Socorro

texts.es:
El sonido de la aguja atravesar la tela, hasta llegar al metal forma una canción que produce Gertrudis, una costurera con más de diez años de experiencia, que con sus ahorros decidió incursionar en este mundo colorido y lleno de creatividad. A sus 54 años, esta comerciante es sueña con mejorar su nivel de vida y continuar trabajando porque quiere ver a su hija de 10 años de edad como toda una profesional en un futuro.
La motivación de sus otros cuatro hijos, ya independientes, más el apoyo de su esposo, ha hecho que Gertrudis se sienta bien haciendo lo que hace. En estos momentos ella solicita un préstamo para comprar telas, sabanas y ropa escolar para poder cumplir con unos pedidos que le solicitaron. Esta inversión le traerá muchos ingresos y podrá ahorrar para cumplir con la meta de ver a su hija convertirse en una profesional.
texts.en:
The sound of the needle piercing fabric until it reaches metal is the song composed by Gertrudis, a seamstress with over ten years of experience. With her savings she decided to venture into this colorful and creative world. At the age of 54 this businesswoman dreams of improving her standard of living and continuing her work because she wants to see her 10 year old daughter become a professional in the future.

The motivation provided by her four children, already independent, in addition to her husband's support has made Gertrudis feel comfortable doing what she's doing. She's now applying for a loan to purchase fabrics, sheets, and school clothes to be able to fulfill some orders that she received. This investment will bring her lots of income and she'll be able to save up with the goal of seeing her daughter become a professional.

loans.use: To buy fabrics, sheets, and school clothes.

loans.name: Warningsih

texts.en:
Good day lenders! Meet one of KPP UMKM’s clients, Warningsih, who is a 52 year-old married with two daughters. Warningsih is a housewife and her husband has been a teacher for thirty seven years. She has asked for a loan of IDR 7.000,000 from KPP-UMKM Syariah. This loan will be used to build a water source at their home to improve access to clean water and sanitation for their family. Her family income is insufficient to build toilets and water sources but Warningsih will be able to repay the loan received.
She and her family want to live a healthy life with healthy sanitation and clean water. She is very grateful for the opportunity and wants to thank to all lenders.

loans.use: to build water source at their home to improve access to clean water and sanitation  for their family.

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en:
Naseem, aged 52, is a responsible mother of five children and living happily in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is a long term member, taking loans according to the needs of her family.
She belongs to a poor family and it is very difficult for her to fulfill all the household expenses from the poor earnings. Her husband is a hawker by profession and sells kinds of hair oils from his bicycle. He sells mustard oil, avocado oil, castor oil, coconut oil, olive oil, rosemary oil, safflower oil, etc. He calls in the streets to the consumers to offer all these hair oils. He is famous for protecting hair from falling out. He wants to buy a large quantity of hair oil to sell to grow his business and to overcome their poverty. Therefore, Naseem requested a loan for her husband, so he can buy more hair oil. Naseem is very impressed with this honorable support. She thanks Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy different kinds of hair oils such as mustard oil, avocado oil, castor oil, coconut oil, olive oil, rosemary oil, safflower oil, etc for her husband's oil selling business.

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en: Marlyn lives in Garcia Hernandez, Bohol. She has run a Sari-sari (general) store for nine years. She is selling vinegar, soy sauce, corn starch, sugar, milk, milo sachets, powdered detergent, coffee, matches,  canned corned beef, beef loaf, sardines, creamer and shampoo.  With the money that she applied for a loan, she plans to use it for the purchase of canned sardines, corned beef, sausages, seasoning, condiments and toiletries. The additional income will go towards healthy meals and savings for herself and her husband.

loans.use: to buy canned sardines, corned beef, sausages, seasoning, condiments and toiletries.

loans.name: Savet

texts.en:
SAVET, 32, is a married woman who lives in a small community in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She has only one dependent child who is currently in school. To make a living and support her family she manages and operates a farming business on a small farm, which is located near her house. On her farmland she grows rice and sells her agricultural products to the local dealers. On average she can generate earnings of USD 3.00 per day.

The current farmland that she owns is small and it can only provide a small benefit to her. SAVET wants to enlarge her farmland area but she cannot afford this. Therefore, now she would like to get a Kiva loan to buy a plot of farmland for growing more rice. She hopes this additional farmland will help to improve her living conditions. She is thankful to all lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: to buy a plot of farmland for growing rice

loans.name: Rodolfo

texts.es: Rodolfo es un joven que se dedica a la venta de alimentos. Para realizar su trabajo de una forma más eficiente solicita un préstamo de un millón de colones (₡ 1 000 000),para la compra de una motocicleta. De esta forma mejorará sus ingresos y su calidad de vida.
texts.en: Rodolfo is a young man who makes a living by selling food. In order to work more efficiently, he is requesting a loan of one million colones (1,000,000 CRC) so he can buy a motorcycle. In this way, he will improve his income and his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Ivy Marie Rose

texts.en:
Ivy Marie Rose is a single woman from Garcia Hernandez, Bohol. She is a future-oriented person who thinks of having a business to be independent. She raise hogs, sell bags, blankets and clothes for an income. She even includes ticketing services. She is asking for a loan to buy feed, piglets and clothes to sell.

With an increase in her inventory and much stock to choose from she is confident that her business will attract more customers. Her income will be for food and business expansion and help support her parents.

loans.use: to buy feed, piglets and trendy clothes.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter used the previous loan to buy herbicides for the tomatoes he is growing. He is a farmer growing onions, bananas and tomatoes on a large scale along side offering tailoring services to his community, which has generated more income. He faces challenges of unpredictable weather changes, price fluctuations and inflation, which have resulted into reduced profits and delayed growth. However, he has future prospects of educating all his children up to the university and modernizing his farming activities. Peter needs a loan to buy herbicides for spraying his onions and tomatoes.

loans.use: to buy herbicides for spraying onions and tomatoes .

loans.name: Ingrid Paola

texts.es: Ingrid es una mujer emprendedora, madre de dos hijas menores de edad que residen en su compañía y la de su cónyuge en un barrio de Soledad, un municipio que por su acelerado desarrollo es considerado como la segunda ciudad del departamento Atlántico y desde su vivienda decidió iniciar su sueño de prosperidad. En una vitrina mostradora ubicada en la terraza de su casa, diariamente vecinos, amigos y transeúntes, compran productos de aseo personal, productos de peluquería, ropa interior y maquillajes, los cuales son cancelados al momento de la compra de o con facilidades de pago.  Como su capital es muy escaso para ampliar la línea de productos que ofrece, está aplicando una solicitud de crédito,  su primer credikiva financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo que invertirá en prendas de vestir y calzado, a fin de aprovechar la temporada decembrina en la que la demanda de estos productos es muy alta. Su meta a futuro es tener una miscelánea más grande y mejor surtida, y con las utilidades ofrecer estudios profesionales a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Ingrid is an enterprising woman. She is the mother of two daughters under the age of 18 who live with her and her husband in Soledad. This is a municipality that is considered to be the second largest city in the department of Atlántico due to its accelerated development.

Ingrid decided to start realizing her dream of prosperity by starting a business in her home. Every day neighbors, friends and pedestrians come to a display cabinet located on the terrace of her house to buy personal hygiene products, hair products, underwear, and makeup. These are paid for in cash or on credit terms. As her capital is very limited, she is applying for a loan in order to expand the line of products that she offers. This is her first Kiva loan through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and she will invest it in the purchase of garments and shoes so she can take advantage of the holiday season, which is when the demand for these products is very high. Her goal for the future is to have a larger and better stocked corner store and use the profits to pay for her children to pursue higher education.

loans.use: to buy garments and shoes

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a forty-year-old married woman and a mother of two children living in the town of Masindi, Uganda. She sells used clothes at different markets on different days so as to be able to support her family needs. She started the business after realizing that her husband's income was low and could hardly sustain her growing family.

A good mother, she desires to educate her children up to the university and develop her home to become a model family in the village. Her business dream is to own a boutique in one of the major streets of Masindi despite challenges of inadequate capital and price fluctuation. Grace intends to use the loan to buy clothes to sell ahead of the festive season.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Gerald

texts.en:
Gerald lives in Hoima, Uganda. He is aged 30, a married man charged with the responsibility of taking care of 5 children who all attend school.

He operates a retail shop mainly buying and selling of general merchandise, sugar, soap, bread among other items. In order to supplement his income, he rides a motorcycle for transport.

He hopes to grow and expand his business more but complains of price fluctuations. He will use the loan facility to buy more stock items like salt, sugar and soap to sell.

loans.use: to buy more stock items like salt, sugar and soap to sell.

loans.name: Mimin

texts.en:
Good day lenders! Meet one of KPP UMKM’s clients, Mimin, who is a 51-year-old married woman with one son. Mimin is an employee in a printing business and her husband has been a notary for five years.

She has asked for a loan of IDR 7,000,000 from KPP-UMKM Syariah. This loan will be used to build a water source in their home to improve access to clean water and sanitation for their family. Her family income is insufficient to build toilets and water sources but Mimin will be able to repay the loan received.

She and her family want to live a healthy life with healthy sanitation and clean water. She is very grateful for the opportunity and wants to thank all lenders.

loans.use: to build a water source in their home to improve access to clean water and sanitation for their family.

loans.name: Punta's Group

texts.en:
Punta is a humble and charming lady standing in the middle in the photograph. She hails from an interior village of Mayurbhanj district, Odisha, India. She has a nuclear family consisting of her husband and two children. Punta is a farmer by profession and works very hard in order to sustain her livelihood.

The major problem that concerns her is that she does not have an appropriate toilet in her house and has to depend upon the open field to attend nature's call. This makes her more vulnerable to crime and molestation.

So in order to restore her privacy and increase her safety and hygiene, along with her other group members, she is requesting a loan amount of 45,000 INR. She will use her portion of the loan amount to build a hygienic toilet in her home and safeguard her family's health so as to reduce the medical expenses.

loans.use: to build a hygienic toilet in her home and safeguard her family's health.

loans.name: Samer

texts.en:
Samer is a 30-year-old single Palestinian man who lives in a Palestinian refugee camp. Due to the low social and financial situations of Palestinians in Lebanon, especially those who live in camps, he started long ago working in transporting students and employees to cover his needs and expenses. He is a hard worker who has a good reputation among his region.
Samer is working hard and trying desperately to develop his business and improve his living conditions.

Today, he is acquiring a YOUTH loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to maintain his taxi car engine which is his only source of income, as he wants to renovate his house to make it a better place inside the camp.
Samer hopes to expand his business more in the future to increase his income and improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to maintain his taxi car engine and renovate his house inside the camp

loans.name: Dynalyn

texts.en:
Dynalyn is a native from the town of Tolosa, Leyte. She owns a sari-sari (variety) store, selling biscuits, chips, coffee, edible oil, sugar, shampoo, soap and condiments. She is a married woman and has three children.

For the past 5 years, she has catered for mostly neighbors and local settlers in the place where she lives.

Dynalyn needs the loan to buy assorted stock for the store like biscuits, soft drinks and beverages in order to make some profits. With these, she will be able to display a variety of goods to meet the demands. Slowly, she will be able to pay her obligation and continue to provide for the needs of her growing children.

For the future, she hopes to expand her project by maintaining the liquidity of capital to become sustainable and to invest in other sources of income.

Dynalyn thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy assorted stock for the store like biscuits, soft drinks and beverages.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase more stock of fish.

loans.name: Vigae Group

texts.en:
Ebeneza, who is in his late 40s, is married with three children. He has been running a water business for five years now. He works from 7 am to 9 pm daily and is able to make a very good monthly profit. This will be Ebeneza’s eighth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loan to expand his business and has paid back his loan successfully. He is happy with the loan and appreciates Kiva for their support of his group, which has made all the members laugh. He used the profit to pay school fees and covered household expenses.

He will use this loan to increase his water supply business. He dreams of building his house for lodge. He will share this loan with his loan group "vigae ", which has four members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: he will use this loan to increase his water supply business.

loans.name: Majdoleen

texts.en:
Majdoleen, 20, lives with her family in Nablus. She is a bachelor student in the university. She is in her fourth and last year, but she needs $1,000 to pay the costs of her higher education in the BA program.

It is well known that a good education leads a person to success and good opportunities. Majdoleen’s parents don’t have a good income nor enough income to pay her costs. That’s why she has requested a loan from Alibdaa.

Majdoleen hopes to finish her university successfully and find a good job to help her family and improve their standard of living.

loans.use: to pay the costs of her higher education BA program.

loans.name: Souy

texts.en:
Souy, 35 years old, is a married homemaker with two children in her care. She resides in a village in the Kandal Province in Cambodia. One of her two children is a factory worker and another one attends school. Her husband is 54 years old and works in construction as a house painter. Together, they can earn approximately $ 20 per day.

Souy wants to earn more income to improve her family’s living standards, so she has decided to request a loan to buy paint in bulk to get special discount from seller. In the future, she is going to build a bigger house and support her young child to earn higher education.

loans.use: to buy paint in bulk to get special discount from seller

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en:
Hussein is a 20-year-old single man. Due to the low financial situations of his family, he left school at an early age and started working in the construction field specialized in vertical concrete stamping to cover his needs and expenses. He is a hard worker and ambitious man who is working hard to open his own business and work independently.

Today, Hussein is acquiring a YOUTH loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to start his own concrete stamping business and buy a small pickup which will facilitate his business. This loan is very important to him for it is considered his first step toward an independent future.

Hussein hopes to succeeded in this business and expand it more in the future to increase his income and better satisfy his needs.

loans.use: to start his own concrete stamping business and buy a small pickup which will facilitate his business.

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en: Marivic and her family lives in a town of Tubigon, Bohol. She is 55 years old single woman and earns a living by retailing purified water. She has been doing this for five years and earns about PHP4800 per month.  She is asking a loan to buy purified water for retailed. Aside from this, she will also plan to buy rice. Thus, she starts other business opportunities like selling rice. In the future, Marivic wants to improve her business for sustainability. She will also save money for future needs.

loans.use: to buy purified water and rice

loans.name: Yirleys Paola

texts.es: Yirleys de 19 años es una joven emprendedora que inició su negocio de venta de pasabocas luego de haber participado en un evento del barrio donde reside en el municipio de Soledad; su propósito en aquel lugar era tener unos ingresos a razón de que el evento congregaba a tantas personas, de este modo elaboró pasabocas típicos de la región Caribe, los cuales fueron comercializados con éxito.  Sus vecinos quedaron encantados con su buena sazón y le propusieron continuar en el negocio, sin embargo ella no presto mucha atención, pero a la semana empezó a anunciarles a los vecinos en cada una de sus viviendas que iba a iniciar su negocio  y promocionó sus productos.  Hoy en día a partir de las 5 a.m. hasta las 10 a.m., Yirleys tiene listos en la terraza de su vivienda a disposición de sus clientes empanadas, carimañolas, patacones, deditos e incluso adicionó a su oferta helados, postres y mercancías por catálogos. Yirleys se encuentra soltera aún y tiene metas definidas para su vida, entre ellas agrandar su negocio y continuar trabajando para que a su familia no le falte nada, y con la finalidad de acercase a sus propósitos está aplicando una solicitud de crédito,  su primer credikiva financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para comprar una estufa y materias primas. Esta inversión es muy importante para el buen funcionamiento de su negocio.
texts.en:
Yirleys is 19 years old and an enterprising young woman who started her snack business after participating in a neighborhood event in her home county of Soledad; her objective in that event was to earn some income since it attracted so many people. So this is how she ended up making traditional snacks from the Caribe region, and they sold successfully. 

Her neighbors were swept off their feet by her good cooking and they proposed that she keep the business going, but she didn't pay them too much mind. However, a week later she went door-to-door and announced to her neighbors that she was going to start a business and advertised her products. Nowadays from 5:00 AM to 10:00 AM she has stuffed pastries, meat pies, fried plaintain slices, cheese fingers and in addition she has expanded her inventory to include ice cream, desserts, and catalogue merchandise.

Yirleys is still single and has defined her goals in life, among them to expand her business and continue working so that her family won't lack for anything, and with the aim of striving towards her goals she has applied for a loan. It's her first Credikiva financing that she has sought from the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation, to buy a stove and ingredients. This investment is very important for the functioning of her business.

loans.use: comprar una estufa y materias primas

loans.name: Ana Dolores

texts.es: Ana es una comerciante por vocación que emprendió su propio negocio para mejorar la economía de su hogar; ella lleva diez años en esta labor y ha logrado mejorara la calidad de vida de su familia. Es muy conocida en el sector donde reside en el municipio de Soledad en donde cuenta con una gran clientela conformada por amigos, vecinos y referidos, sin embargo sus familiares también le brindan apoyo y  les ofrece la variedad de productos que comercializa. Diariamente dedica seis horas a esta actividad y vende de contado o con facilidad de pago, de este modo garantiza una mayor utilidad, pero como su capital es muy escaso está aplicando una solicitud de crédito,  su primer credikiva financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para invertir en pedidos de su clientela; prendas de vestir, accesorios, calzado, perfumes, cosméticos y demás.  Su meta a futuro es fortalecer su capital de trabajo y cumplirle a sus clientes con sus demandas.
texts.en: Ana has a vocation for business. She started her own business to improve the financial situation of her household. She has been doing this work for ten years and she has managed to improve her family’s quality of life. She is very well known in the area where she lives, which is in the municipality of Soledad. She has a large clientele, which includes friends, neighbors, and referred clients. Her relatives also give her their support. She sells a variety of products. She spends six hours a day doing this work and she sells her products for cash or on credit terms. In this way she gets a greater profit, but she is applying for a loan because her capital is very limited. This is her first Kiva loan through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and she will use it to invest in the purchase of products in order to fill the orders of her clients. She will buy garments, accessories, shoes, perfumes, cosmetics, and other products. Her goal for the future is to strengthen her working capital and meet the demand from her clients.

loans.use: to fill the orders of her clients by buying garments, accessories, shoes, perfumes, cosmetics, and other products

loans.name: Peninah

texts.en:
Peninah is a 64 year old green grocer at Voi Kenya. She is a widow who supports seven biological children and has been in this business for the last fifteen years earning a good income. 

This is her sixth borrowing from VisionFund Kenya to finance her business, she will use the loan to purchase crates of tomatoes for resale and the anticipated profit to educate her children who are in college. She hopes to see all her children get a good education in future.

loans.use: to purchase crates of tomatoes for resale

loans.name: Christopher

texts.en:
Christopher is a hardworking married man who owns a retail shop and a salon to make ends meet. He ventured into business in 2009 with an aim of earning a living and supporting his family. His greatest desire is educating his two children to a level of self dependency despite the difficulty of competition from people with similar businesses and debtors.

That is why he is seeking for credit to buy curry powder, cooking oil, soda and other general merchandise for selling.

loans.use: to buy curry powder, cooking oil, soda and other general merchandise for selling..

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is a very wonderful woman aged forty and married to a very enterprising man and they live in Hoima, Uganda. During our interaction with her she was very zealous with her work and she works all through the week.

She started her restaurant and bar mainly selling sodas and beers as well as food in 2011 and since then she has reaped profits which facilitate her in providing basics to her family and together with her husband build a modest residential house. She also does farming to supplement her income.

She aspires to become on of the leading hotel owners in Hoima and also to ensure that her children have the best education and have a better future. Joyce is requesting for a loan facility to buy crates of sodas to sell now that the festive season is approaching and the demand for drinks will more than double.

loans.use: to buy crates of sodas to sell.

loans.name: Mamuka

texts.en:
Mamuka is 34 years old. He lives with his pensioner parents in Batumi district. There is high unemployment rate in the region, but self-employment helps people to generate income. Mamuka decided to start his business and requested a loan.

The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo enables him to get a loan. With the received credit Mamuka will purchase a car and will serve people as a taxi driver. This will give him a chance to generate income and improve the living conditions of his family. Mamuka awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase a car and start a taxi business.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en: Robert is a married man with 35 years of age,a father of 4 children and only one attends school in Hoima Uganda. He operates a retail shop mainly selling of general merchandise like salt, sugar, soap among other items. He also owns a motorcycle for transport business in order to supplement his incomes. He expects to grow and fulfill the increasing demands of his customers only to be limited by capital inadequacy. He will use the loan to buy more retail items like powdered soap,sugar and others to sell.

loans.use: to buy more retail items like powdered soap,sugar and others to sell.

loans.name: Atlehang Group

texts.en:
Malehlohonolo is a 56-year-old mother of 3 children aged between 16-24 years. She not only takes care of her children but has to take care of her three young grandchildren aged 7 and 5 and 4 who have lost both their parents. Malehlohonolo lives in a traditional hut that is not well ventilated, nor warms up well in winter. She works long hours to ensure there is enough food for her children and grandchildren, some of whom are going to school and only help her in the field on Saturdays and Sundays. She has to wake up very early, between 3am and 4am, during the week to start preparing the fire for cooking breakfast, heating water and warming the house for all the children before they go to school.

Collecting firewood, setting up the fire and doing the actual cooking demands a lot of her time. Temperatures in the Lesotho highlands are never really high; winters can get very cold and often Malehlohonolo has to start the fire inside her hut. Starting a fire releases smog and smoke which when inhaled in large quantities over a period of time can lead to lung diseases, eye problems and in the worst case to death. In these circumstances, life for women like Malehlohonolo has been very difficult. Malehlohonolo has requested a loan from Kiva lenders, in order to be able to purchase clean cook stoves which provide Malehlohonolo and 9 other people from her village, who are living in the same circumstances, the chance of cooking in a way that does not harm them and their families, and that does not require a lot of wood, which is hard to find in Lesotho, nor expensive paraffin and gas.

This stove can be started with the use of very little, readily available biomass like dry twigs and dry cow dung that do not require lengths of time to collect. It does not produce smoke while burning, thus making it safe to be used inside the homes. This stove comes with a solar panel for charging the battery which runs the fan in the stove, a USB port for charging phones and a mini LED lamp. A life improving package for these women. This stove saves them time to be with their family, saves energy, eliminates the element of toxic inhalation, house burning and has given them the freedom to have a better lit home to see better in the evening while cooking and enables children to do their homework. For stove info please check www.africancleanenergy.com

loans.use: to be able to pay for the ACE cook stove which will improve her life in terms of health, cost of fuel and the time she spends collecting firewood.

loans.name: Sofia

texts.en:
Sofia is a 32-year-old married woman, living with her spouse and four children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession and drives a rickshaw in Lahore city which is a very populated area.

A few days ago he had a road accident. When he was looking for a passenger standing beside the road, a speeding car hit the rickshaw from behind. He did not get any injury but the rickshaw’s body was seriously damaged and needed replacement with a new one. He wants to replace the rickshaw body with a new one, but does not have enough cash in hand to fix it.

Therefore, Sofia has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband will be able to buy an auto rickshaw body and he can drive smoothly again.

She is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan, for this support.

loans.use: to buy a rickshaw body for her husband's transportation services, so he can repair it after accidental damage.

loans.name: Shehla

texts.en:
22 years ago, Shehla opened a school in order to provide a high quality, and competitive level of education services in her community. Shehla borrowed a loan of PKR 100,000 in order to increase her student body from 94 students by improving the school's supplies including furniture, stationery and blackboards etc. and make school more affordable for her students.

Despite the hesitation from parents in her rural neighborhood to send children, especially girls, to school Shehla hopes to continue to build her establishment and keep educating.

loans.use: to purchase school's supplies including furniture, stationery and blackboards. Her school is in a rural area and attracts female students.

loans.name: Rohimah

texts.en:
Rohimah, who a 54-year-old married with one daughter and three sons. Rohimah is a housewife and her husband is an interpreneur for eight years. She has asked for a loan of IDR 5.000,000 from KPP-UMKM Syariah. This loan will be used to build water source at their home to improve access to clean water and sanitation for their family. Her family income is insufficient to build toilets and water sources but Rohimah will be able to repay the loan received.

She and her family want to live a healthy life with healthy sanitation and clean water. She is very grateful for the opportunity and wants to thank to all lenders.

loans.use: This loan will be used to build water source at their home to improve access to clean water and sanitation  for their family.

loans.name: Sulafa

texts.en:
Sulafa is 44 years old married women and lives in a house that she owns. She has had a beauty salon in her home for few months. Sulafa has many customers as she does a very good job. With profits, Sulafa is able to move forward with her family. She is applying for a loan in order to buy products for her beauty salon, such as creams, shampoo, scissors, hair pins and other things that she needs. With these items, Sulafa can earn higher profits, thus giving her greater financial stability
Sulafa appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy products for her beauty salon, such as creams, shampoo, scissors, hair pins and other things that she needs

loans.name: Francis Isabel

texts.es: Francis es una joven muy trabajadora que se dedica a la ganadería. Solicita un préstamo de un millón treinta y cinco mil colones (₡ 1 035 000), para la compra de novillas, esto con el propósito de aumentar el número de animales y poder incrementar sus ingresos familiares.
texts.en:
Francis is a very hard-working young woman, who earns a living raising cattle.

She is requesting a loan of one million and thirty-five thousand Costa Rica colones (1,035,000 CRC) to buy heifers. With this purchase, she will increase her herd size and, in this way, generate more income for her family.

loans.use: to buy heifers.

loans.name: Lim

texts.en:
As a farmer from Prey Chhor District, Kampong Cham Province, Lim, 51 years old, is working very hard on the rice field near her house. She is a hard-working mother of six children; two of them are married. She can earn approximately 2.5 USD a day. Being a farmer is the main work that she has done for more than twenty years.

In this farming season, she is lacking money to buy some farm supplies. To continue her farming, Lim is borrowing some money from Kiva to buy farm supplies like fertilizers, seeds, insecticides, and other related materials.

So she hopes that this requirement will help to improve her living conditions. She is thankful to all lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies like fertilizers.

loans.name: James

texts.en: James is a 46 year-old hard working married man with children living in Kyenjojo-Uganda. He started from small savings from farming where he saved money for the retail shop selling the general merchandise to help him look after his family needs. James has experience of six years and the business is growing steadily. However, he has a challenge of inadequate capital to meet people’s demands. James is requesting for the loan to buy stock of sugar, soap, rice, salt and sodas for the retail shop.

loans.use: to buy stock of sugar, soap, rice, salt and sodas for the retail shop.

loans.name: Angella

texts.en:
Angella operates a mini depot of sodas and beers as her major source of income and has done this since the year 2013. She is a 32-year-old single lady who started a business with a purpose of earning; she also supplements her business with farming.

Angella lives in Kagadi, Uganda. She dreams of growing the business to a bigger depot and major supplier of soft drinks in her home town. She is very hard working and says competition is her major challenge. She wants credit to buy more stock of beers and sodas to sell.

loans.use: to buy more stock of beers and sodas to sell.

loans.name: Mab's Group

texts.en:
A 44-year-old married woman from Battambang province, Mab has five children, three of whom depend on her. A child of her is in school and needs her support. To make a living, she and her husband are growing rice, fishing, raising pigs and working for others for a fee.

Mab has been with VisionFund for a cycle loan already and this time she is leading a group of two members to take out loans. As the leader of two members group, she is going to use her loan to purchase organic fertilizer, rice seeds and to pay for plowing fees. She dreams of earning more income from her rice growing business so that she can keep sending her children to school and expand her business bigger.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer to boost crop yields so that she can keep sending children to school.   .

loans.name: Zarina's Group

texts.en:
Zarina is a 47-year old married woman, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of six children.

She has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan for her husband. He is a shoe maker and very expert in his profession. He has been sewing shoes for many years. This is the reason he has a lot of experience about his profession. He sews shoes made of leather and rexene through sewing machine, after that attached its sole through stitching by his hands.

In this way he is generating income for his family. But his current income is insufficient. He has been making shoes at home, now he set up a shop to turn his business to a higher level so he can generate additional income. But he does not have cash in hand to buy initial raw material for making shoes.

Therefore, Zarina has requested a loan for her husband so he can buy sewing machine and initial raw material such as rexene, leather, thread, nails and rubber sole for making shoes.
She thanks Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan for this honorable support.

loans.use: to buy initial raw materials for her husband's shoe making shop. .

loans.name: Gustavo

texts.es: Gustavo es un emprendedor de 35 años que se capacitó como técnico en electricidad en una institución del estado y ante la imposibilidad para ubicarse laboralmente, decidió ser trabajador independiente y aperturar su propio taller.  Hoy en día cuenta con seis años de ofrecer servicios de instalación, reparación y mantenimiento de redes eléctricas como contratista de empresas de servicios públicos y constructoras de la región, a quienes les ofrece de sus servicios a todo costo.  El labora de lunes a sábado a partir de las 8 a.m. hasta las 6 p.m., horario en el que realiza sus servicios y promociona a nuevos clientes.  En la actualidad está aplicando una solicitud de crédito,  su primer credikiva financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo que invertirá en materiales eléctricos tales como cables, bombillas y cámaras de seguridad para no tener inconvenientes en sus contratos.  Gustavo se encuentra separado de su cónyuge y es padre de una niña de nueve años de edad a quien ofrece bienestar con el fruto de su trabajo. Su meta a futuro es tener una empresa reconocida y continuar ayudando a su familia.
texts.en:
Gustavo is a 35 year old entrepreneur who trained to be an electrical technician in a state institution. When it became impossible to find a job, he decided to be an independent worker and open his own shop. Today he has six years experience offering services such as installation, repair and maintenance of electrical systems. He works as a contractor for public services and construction businesses in the area, to whom he offers his services with everything included. He works from Monday to Saturday from 8:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m., hours in which he provides his services and seeks new customers.

Currently he is applying for a loan, his first Kiva loan made through the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation, that he will invest in electric materials such as cables, bulbs and security cameras, to avoid problems with his contracts. Gustavo is separated from his partner, and is the father of a 9 year old girl, whom he supports economically with the fruits of his labor. His future goal is to have a well known business and to continue supporting his family.

loans.use: to buy electric materials like cables, bulbs and security cameras.

loans.name: Jose Inocente

texts.es:
José, tiene como negocio la compra y venta de semilla de marañón, ya cuenta con mucha experiencia, tiene clientes recurrentes y en su comunidad ya es reconocido por ser emprendedor, tiene diez años de estar practicando está actividad, es acompañado y no tiene familiares en el extranjero.
Comprará semilla de marañón al por mayor, así tendrá materia prima suficiente para atender los pedidos de sus clientes y generar más ganancias,  ya que ahorrara mucho si lo adquiere en esta temporada que tiene un precio bajo.
Sus aspiraciones son ser una persona responsable con sus obligaciones y ayudar a otras personas para que se superen.
texts.en:
José's business is the buying and selling of cashews, a vocation he has a lot of experience in. He has recurring clients, and in his community he is recognized for his entrepreneurial spirit. José has been in this business for ten years. He's married, and doesn't have any family outside of the country.

José will buy cashew seeds wholesale. That way, he'll have sufficient raw materials to meet the needs of his clients, as well as generate more profits, since he will save much of what he acquires this season, with its low prices.

His aspirations are to be a responsible person regarding his obligations, and to help others to better themselves.

loans.use: to purchase cashews wholesale. That way, he'll have sufficient raw materials to meet the needs of his clients.

loans.name: Nhung

texts.en: Mrs. Nhung, 38 years old, is married and has two children; she works very hard to provide for them. Husbandry and cultivation are the family's main sources of income. This loan will enable Nhung to build a hygienic latrine to improve her family's living standards and to protect the environment.

loans.use: to build a latrine to improve her family's health.

loans.name: Nuru

texts.en:
Nuru, in her early 30’s, has been running a food business commonly known as mama lishe (open air café or restaurant). She works from 5 AM to 8 PM every day and is able to make a good profit each month. Through hard work, Nuru has managed to earn enough to pay for household expenses. In the coming years, Nuru would like to own a big business.

Nuru will use this loan to buy cooking ingredients for her mama lishe business. She will be accountable for paying back the loan. This is her seventh loan cycle with Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans, all of which she repaid successfully, to buy food items such as rice, sugar, cooking oil and charcoal.

loans.use: to buy cooking ingredients for her mama lishe (café) business.

loans.name: Ernest

texts.en:
Ernest is in his early 30s and is married with two school-going children. He has been a blacksmith for seven years now. He works from 8 a.m. to 7 p.m. daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Ernest's ninth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans to buy metal pipes, flat bars, and a decorator machine, and he has paid back his loans successfully.

He is happy with the loan experience. He used the profit to pay school fees, repay the loan, buy two plots of land, take care of his family, and cover household expenses. He dreams of building his own house.

Ernest will use this loan to increase his welding equipment to make more gates and iron doors and windows. He will be accountable for paying back his loan.

loans.use: to increase his welding equipment to make more gates and iron doors and windows.

loans.name: Bonifacia

texts.en:
Bonifacia is a mother of four children at the age of 74. She wants to earn a living so that she can provide for her family's needs and that's why she engaged in a transport business. She manages it while her son is the one who drives the motorcycle to cater for passengers. Bonifacia wants to increase her income and can continue to cater for more passengers so she borrowed a loan to pay for labor costs for repairing the motorcycle.

Bonifacia plans to buy a new motorcycle in the future to expand her business and can improve her living conditions through her business.

loans.use: to pay for labor costs for repairing her motorcycle.

loans.name: Edna Yaqueline

texts.es: Edna es una microempresaria residenciada en un barrio ubicado en Madrid, un municipio de Cundinamarca en donde esta tendera de víveres y abarrotes emprendió su negocio luego de nacer su primer hijo, quien fue su principal motivación para que desde su vivienda realizar alguna actividad que le permitirá estar al pendiente de su cuidado, así como generar recursos para su hogar. Todos los días de la semana sus clientes llegan hasta su negocio para realizar sus comprar de productos que hacen parte de la canasta familiar a los cuales recibe a partir de las 7 a.m. en jornada continua hasta las 9 p.m. Edna es una mujer muy dedicada y su sueño de prosperidad es que su negocio sea más amplio y mejor surtido, de este modo sus ingresos serán mucho mayores en beneficio de su familia.  En la actualidad está aplicando una solicitud de crédito,  su primer credikiva financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo con el que realizará adecuaciones a su local con el fin de ir acercándose a su meta y poder adquirir su casa propia.
texts.en:
Edna is a small business owner who lives in a neighborhood of Madrid, a town in the Cundinamarca district. She runs a grocery store, which she started after the birth of her first child when she was looking for a job which would allow her to be able to care for her child while earning an income.

Her customers come daily to buy their groceries, and her store is open from 7am to 9pm. Edna is a very dedicated woman, and her dream is to be able to enlarge her store and provide a wider range of stock so that she can increase her earnings.

She is currently applying for her first Kiva loan from the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, and will use it to make improvements to her store, in order to achieve her dream and be able to buy her own home.

loans.use: to make improvements to her store.

loans.name: Twekambe Rweega Group

texts.en:
Jaliat, who deals in selling liquor, is a hardworking married woman living in Kagadi, Uganda. She supplements her income with farming, having engaged in the business since 2005. She started to look after her family, especially by paying school fees for her children. In her business, Jaliat faces a challenge of bad weather, mainly in the rainy season, when roads are so bad that she has to spend a lot on transportation costs. Despite this difficulty, Jaliat is working hard towards achieving her dream of educating her nine children.

Jaliat is seeking a loan to buy more local brew to sell. She is a member of Twekambe Rweega group, whose members guarantee each other to get loans as they don’t pledge securities.

loans.use: to buy more local brew to sell.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es: Pedro es un hombre que lucha todos los días para ofrécele a su familia un mejor hogar. Cuenta que gracias al crédito pudo realizar su inversión en la construcción de su casa, ahora una parte de su casa ya está terminada, pero falta la otra  parte, por esa razón acude a un nuevo préstamo para la compra de materiales tales como: cemento, hierro, arena. Su esperanza de vida es terminar la construcción de su casa para poder habitarlo pronto.
texts.en:
Pedro works hard every day to be able to give his family the best home possible. He says that, thanks to the loan, he has been able to begin the construction of his home. One section of his house has now been completed, but he still needs to finish the rest.

For this reason, he has asked for a new loan in order to buy construction materials such as cement, iron and sand. His great dream is to finish building the house in order to be able to live in it soon.

loans.use: to buy materials such as cement, iron and sand for constructing his home.

loans.name: Chau

texts.en:
Chau, 31 years old, is a hardworking woman. She is married and has two children.

Husbandry is the main income source of her family. Additionally, she is also a hired laborer and earns about 120,000 VND per day.

With this loan, she can build a hygienic latrine to improve the living conditions and health of her family.

loans.use: to build a latrine to improve the health of her family.

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es:
Miguel es un padre de familia perseverante, amable y muy solidaria, tiene grandes aspiraciones en la vida, él cuenta que gracias al crédito su negocio de sandalias pudo surtir y sus ventas incrementaron, por lo que sus ingresos fueron mayores que antes y su calidad de vida cambio. 
Miguel con la inversión anterior pudo llamar la atención de más clientes de los cuales necesita abastecer mejor sus pedidos, por esa razón solicita un nuevo préstamo para la compra de materiales como; cuero, clavos, suelas. Con esta inversión el espera fortalecer su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Miguel is a determined father who's friendly and very loyal with big goals in life. He states that thanks to a loan he was able to stock his sandal business and his sales increased, which boosted his income higher than ever and his standard of living changed. With the previous loan Miguel was able to attract more customers and so he needs to expand his merchandise orders. 

That's the reason why he's applying for a new loan to purchase materials such as: leather, nails, and soles. With this investment he hopes to strengthen his business and improve his standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase materials such as: leather, nails, and soles.

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en:
Rosemary is a young, ambitious woman, 28 years old, with one child living in Hoima, Uganda. She operates a drug shop, mainly selling drugs for animals.

She started the business after assessing the need of most farmers to have access to drugs for their animals and also because she loves to care for animals. In addition, she farms cassava, maize, and many other crops that she grows in order to supplement her income.

She desires to expand and grow her business more and become a consultant in agricultural issues so as to help other farmers have better results from their farm. Rosemary is seeking a loan facility to buy veterinary drugs to sell.

loans.use: to buy veterinary drugs  to sell.

loans.name: Sahondranirina

texts.fr:
55 ans, Sahondranirina est une femme travailleuse et débrouillarde. Elle est très active. Elle est commerçante depuis 1980. A cette époque jusqu'en 2002, elle était marchand de légumes, puis elle travaillait dans une entreprise de zone franche jusqu'au 2009. L'entreprise devait fermer ses portes à cause de la crise donc elle devait trouve d'autre activité, et elle choisissait la fabrication des caca-pigeons et cuisses dames.
Sahondranirina voudrait développer son activité, renforcer le fonds de roulement, c'est elle même qui effectue les livraisons et elle profite de chercher des nouveaux clients.
Elle est mariée et son mari travaille dans une entreprise de fabrication de ciment. Le couple a trois enfants, tous déjà mariés.
texts.en:
Sahondranirina is a 55 year-old hard-working and resourceful woman. She is very active. She became a merchant in 1980. She sold vegetables from that time until 2002, then worked in a free-zone company until 2009. When that company went out of business, she had to find another activity. That's when she chose to make caca-pigeons (a crispy fried snack food) and cuisses dames (a type of beignet).

Sahondranirina would like to expand her activity and bolster her working capital. She makes all deliveries herself, and she benefits from finding new customers.

She is married with three children who are now married as well. Her husband works for a concrete manufacturer.

loans.use: to buy flour and sugar.

loans.name: Rutooma Tukurakurane Women Group

texts.en:
Mollen, a member of Rutooma Tukurakurane Women Group, lives in Kagadi, Uganda. She is a produce businesswoman, trading in maize since 2003. She started her business in order to generate income for her family, She supplements her income with farming, especially through growing maize.

She is 35 years old, married, and has four children. She has dreams of educating her children and expanding her business. The major challenge she faces is price fluctuation, which greatly affects her cash flows. She wants credit to buy maize produce for selling.

loans.use: to buy maize produce for selling.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is a sari-sari store owner from Tubigon, Bohol. She is 59 years old and the mother of five adult children. She raised and provided for her family through this sari-sari store business for 12 years.

Elena is asking for a loan to buy grocery items such as canned goods, noodles, spices, diapers, eggs, cooking oil, laundry soap, coffee, sugar, powdered milk and juice, chocolate drink, chips, biscuits and candies. In the future, she wants to uplift her livelihood for sustainability.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, noodles, spices, diapers, eggs, cooking oil, laundry soap, coffee, sugar, powdered milk and juice, chocolate drink, chips, biscuits and candies

loans.name: Yasmin

texts.en:
Yasmin is 30 years old and lives in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of two children.

She owns a beauty parlor and is an expert in makeover services. Most of her clients are from the neighborhood and appreciate her services. With the passage of time, her inventory of beauty products has been diminishing, and at this time she wants to buy more beauty products for her beauty salon.

Therefore, she has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that she will be able to buy new cosmetics products such as facial cream, bleach cream, nail polish, hair color, lotion, etc.

She wants to establish a parlor in the main market of town because she wants to enhance her income. Yasmin thanks Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy new cosmetics products such as facial cream, bleach cream, nail polish, hair color, and lotion for her beauty parlor.

loans.name: Bernidia

texts.en:
Bernidia is 67 years old and married with eight children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell, like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, bread, shampoo, snack foods, and personal care products.

Bernidia has been in this business for 15 years. In the future she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell, like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, bread, shampoo, snack foods, and personal care products.

loans.name: Oscar Danilo

texts.es:
La psicología fue la primera carrera universitaria que le llamó la atención a Oscar, un joven de 30 años de edad que desde hace seis años trabaja como admisionista, no fue hasta hace dos años que decidió estudiar la licenciatura, pues ya tenía sus ahorros y quería ser parte de esta profesión que describe como una forma de ayudar a las personas en la salud mental.
Oscar cuenta con el apoyo de su madre, quien también es asalariada. Él siente que a medida que va aprendiendo, le gustaría más poner en práctica todos sus conocimientos, lo que sirve mucho para que en cuanto culminé estará listo para servir a la población. Mientras tanto da lo mejor de sí en la universidad, por lo que solicita un préstamo para comprar una computadora, herramienta que servirá mucho para su desempeño en la universidad. En sus planes está culminar su carrera y buscar un empleo acorde a la psicología.
texts.en:
Oscar is pursuing a college degree in Psychology. He is thirty years old, and has been working as a receptionist for the past six years. Two years ago, having saved up enough money, he decided to go back to school in order to be a part of the mental-health profession and help people.

Oscar has his mother's support. She also has a job and earns a salary. The more he learns, the more Oscar feels a desire to put his knowledge into practice, and as soon as he finishes studying he will be ready to serve the public. In the meantime, he works as hard as he can at school.

He is requesting this loan to buy a computer, which will be a very helpful tool for him to perform well in college. His goal is to earn his degree and find a job in his field.

loans.use: to buy a computer.

loans.name: Linda

texts.en: Linda is a 30-year-old, Lebanese divorced woman. She lives with her parents who represent the main source income. To help her parents, she works as an employee in a company. She is very tender and cares a lot about all of her family members. Today, she is eager to borrow a loan from Kiva partner, Vitas. s.a.l., to pay her university educational fees. She said that she is very happy with the loan that will allowed her to pursue her education.

loans.use: to pay her university educational fees

loans.name: Laure

texts.en: Laure is a 40 year old Lebanese married woman living with her husband and mother of three children still attending school. Her husband is the main income source and works as a taxi driver and she also works from home in selling cosmetics and perfumes to satisfy the necessities of life and till now they earns a fair revenue. Now she is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l to pay her children’s educational fees. She said that the loan will surely help her to register them with the coming school year and that makes her very happy and eager to borrow loan from kiva.

loans.use: to pay her children’s educational fees.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is 30 years old and single. She has two children; one child is still in school.

She is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig.

Rowena has been in this business for five years now and has borrowed from NWTF two times in the past to sustain it. In the future, she would like to save enough to provide financial security for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en:
Nilda is 70 years old, married, and has two children. She is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Nilda has been in this business for two years now and has borrowed from NWTF three times in the past to sustain it. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Maximino

texts.es:
Maximino, es un hombre de cuarenta y tres años de edad, que sabe lo que cuesta el trabajo, pero también lo dichoso que se siente obtener ganancias. El inicio trabajando en el campo con su papá, cultivando maíz, frijoles y trigo, con solo veinte años contaba con tres vacas lecheras y cinco manzanas de tierra,  en la actualidad tiene muchas vacas y ha aumentado sus tierras. También sale a ofertar productos como mosquitero y hamacas a otros pueblos del pais. Lo que lo convierte en un hombre multifacético y audaz.
El desea crecer como agricultor por eso ha tocado las puertas de Kiva junto a MiCrédito para que se le otorgue un préstamo que le permita comprar media manzana de tierra, para poder expandir su zona de cultivo y mejorar el espacio de sus potreros. En el futuro desea poder incursionar en otros negocios afines a la ganadería.
texts.en:
Maximino is a 43 year-old man who knows what it takes to work, but also how lucky it feels to obtain profits. He started working in the field with his dad, growing corn, beans, and wheat. With just 20 years of age, he had three dairy cows and five acres of land. He currently has many cows and has increased his land. He also goes out to offer products such as mosquito nets and hammocks to other towns of the country, which makes him a multifaceted and bold man.

Maximino wants to grow as a farmer. That is why he has knocked on the doors of Kiva with MiCrédito to be granted a loan that allows him to buy half an acre of land to be able to expand his crop area and improve his cattle ranch space. In the future, he wishes to be able to venture into other businesses related to cattle raising.

loans.use: to buy half an acre of land.

loans.name: Kaleema

texts.en:
Kaleema is a 52-year-old woman living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of six children.

Her husband is a turner by profession. He works over a lathe machine and manufactures and renews spare parts for vehicles such as motorbikes, motorcars and auto rickshaws. He renews the interior parts of the engines of vehicles and renews the turbine and radiators.

He has been doing this business for many years and up until now his business has been stable. Due to continuously working over his lathe machine, some important parts have torn off and urgently need to be replaced. Without the replacement of the affected parts, the whole mechanism of the lathe machine will be affected.

Her husband does not have sufficient funds to buy spare parts to fix the lathe machine and buy cutting tools. Therefore, she requested a loan for her husband so that he could buy spare parts for his lathe machine.

Kaleema hopes that this loan will prove productive for the business, as well as the family.

loans.use: to buy cast iron for her husband's lathe machine shop so he can manufacture more spare parts.

loans.name: Mach

texts.en: Mach is 39 years old and married. She lives in Takeo province and has three dependent children who are all in school. To make a living, she is growing rice and she has been doing this business for 15 years. Drought is the obstacle to her rice growing business recently.This is the first cycle loan for her with VisionFund and she will use her loan to pay for tuition fees of her son, who is studying for a bachelor degree in Information Technology (IT) at ROYAL UNIVERSITY OF PHNOM PENH. She dreams of seeing her son graduate from university and have a good paid job to uplift the family’s living condition.

loans.use: To pay for tuition fees of her son to complete bachelor degree in Information Technology (IT) to get a good job in the future.

loans.name: Qusai

texts.en: Qusai is a 19-year-old single young man from the city of Khan Younis city. His father is employed in the public sector and earns a low and unstable income. This income is barely enough to cover all family's needs.Qusai is a mathematics student in the university.
