He wants to earn a BA degree and find a job to help his family with their expenses.Qusai took a USD loan from FATEN to buy a new laptop for his studies. By taking this loan, Qusai will be able to do his homework and reports easily.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop.

loans.name: Floribeth

texts.es: Floribeth se dedica a la venta de ropa y diversos artículos de uso personal, esto lo realiza desde su casa, sin embargo, algunas veces realiza ventas a domicilio. Solicita un préstamo de un millón cincuenta mil colones (₡ 1 050 000), para la compra de ropa y productos de uso personal, esto con el fin de ofrecer mayor variedad de productos a sus clientes.
texts.en: Floribeth works selling clothing and a variety of personal care articles.  She does this from her home; however, sometimes she makes her sales at other houses.  She is requesting a loan of 1,050,000 CRC to buy clothing and personal care products with the goal of offering a better variety of products to her customers.

loans.use: to buy clothing and personal care products to sell

loans.name: Zahida

texts.en:
Zahida is a 44-year-old woman residing in Lahore, Pakistan. She has four children, and her husband has run a general store for nine years. Her husband is responsible for fulfilling the needs of his entire family.

Zahida's husband wants to purchase rice, sugar, tea bags, milk, and other items for his business, but does not have the funds. Zahida has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan to buy all these commodities and help her husband to earn an income to manage his household and business.

Zahida is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy inventory such as rice, sugar, tea bags, milk, and other items for her husband's general store business.

loans.name: Danelia Del Carmen

texts.es:
La sonrisa cálida de Danelia hace que cualquiera se sienta cómoda hablando con ella. Esta licenciada en Administración de Empresas lleva dos años trabajando en lo que la apasiona. A sus 28 años de edad, ella tiene muchas metas por delante, entre ellas finalizar la Maestría en Administración Funcional de Empresas, pues quiere prepararse más allá de lo aprendido en la universidad. 
Con este perfil profesional de mayor nivel, va a conseguir mejores opciones laborales y tendrá una mejor calidad profesional, por la cual solicita un préstamo para cancelar la maestría y así obtener ese título que le permitirá ampliar su desempeño en su actual trabajo y aprender más. En sus otros planes también está aplicar sus conocimientos en el campo de la docencia y culminar con éxito su maestría.
texts.en:
Danelia's warm smile makes anyone comfortable talking to her. This degree holder in Business Administration has been working for two years in what she is passionate about. At 28 years of age, she has many goals ahead, among them is to finish a Master's in Functional Business Administration. She wants to prepare herself with more than what she learned in the university.

With this higher level professional profile, she will have better work options and will have a better professional rank. For this reason, she is requesting a loan in order to pay for the Master's and obtain this degree which will permit her to expand her performance in her present job and learn more. In her other plans, she would also like to apply her learning in the field of teaching and successfully complete her Master's.

loans.use: to pay for a Master's degree.

loans.name: Amada

texts.en:
For 11 years, Amada has been running a small restaurant known to the locals as a “carinderia”. She lives in Tubigon, Bohol with her husband and children. They have two children to support, aged 19 and 14 years old.

Amada is a 48-year-old woman and dreams of improving her business to support the needs of her children and give them a better education. She dreams of succeeding in her business, in order to prepare and save money for the future.

To continue her business, she wants to borrow 15,000 PHP to buy food ingredients such as meat, vegetables, spices, cooking oil, and noodles. She will also use the loan to buy feed for a hog raising business.

loans.use: to buy food ingredients such as meat, vegetables, spices, cooking oil and noodles, as well as feed for raising hogs.

loans.name: Levy

texts.en:
Levy is married and has six children. She lives in Clarin, Philippines with her family.

Levy has been earning her living by providing transportation services to local community members for over six years. Her previous loan was used for vehicle repair.

Levy is requesting a loan to buy spare parts for motorcycle maintenance. Then her transport services can continue to cater to more passengers and she will be able to generate greater income.

In the future, Levy hopes to expand her business by buying a new motorcycle.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for motorcycle maintenance.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Hello, lenders. Meet Eunice. This lovely and exceptional lady is from Kapsowar, in the Rift valley region of Kenya. One thing you will notice when visiting Kapsowar is that the place is all green! Expansive maize and wheat plantations stretch 360 degrees to the horizon. Maize, wheat, and dairy farming are the most dominant activities in the area.

For five years, Eunice has been banking on dairy farming to provide for her three children. Her primary income source is milk, poultry, and crops.

Eunice is seeking a loan to purchase poultry. She is seeking a loan through Juhudi Kilimo because the microfinance institution has an exclusive focus on farmers. With the money, she will buy more poultry. This move not only increases her income, but also helps her to manage various risks that may befall dairy farming in the future.

Eunice is the type of mother who places greater premium on education than an average parent. She believes that if she does her part and lays a proper foundation for her children, through education, she will have afforded them a shot at being anything they want to be in the future.

Be kind to this mother who wants to create an impact!

loans.use: To buy poultry

loans.name: Obdulio Jose

texts.es:
Vacas de todos los colores adornan la finca de Obdulio, un agricultor y ganadero, que desde hace 40 años emprendió en este mundo con la ayuda de su madre, quien le regaló cinco vacas y con el apoyo del gobierno que le obsequió unos terrenos que le ayudaron a cumplir con este sueño. A sus 63 años de edad, se siente muy orgulloso de haber sacado adelante a sus nueve hijos y a su esposa, con el cultivo de maíz, frijoles, trigo y con la venta de leche. 
Como un ingreso más, Obdulio alquila el potrero para ganado, puesto que su finca es grande y como observó que era una buena oportunidad de generar más ingresos en su hogar decidió hacerlo. Por esta razón, él decide realizar un préstamo para comprar alambres para mejorar las cercas de la finca y así tener mejor control de su ganado. En sus planes está sacar otro crédito más adelante, con el cual pueda comprar tres vacas más.
texts.en:
Cows of all colors adorn Obdulio's farm. He is a farmer and rancher who started in this world 40 years ago with the help of his mother, who gave him five cows, and the help of the government which granted him some land to assist him to fulfill this dream. At 63 years of age, he is very proud to have forged ahead with his nine children and his wife through the cultivation of corn, beans and wheat and through the sale of milk.

With more income, Obdulio rented a pasture for cattle since his farm is big and, since he observed that this was a good opportunity to generate more income for the house, he decided to do it. For this reason, he made up his mind to get a loan in order to buy wire to improve the farm fences and thus have better control over his cattle. In his plans, he also wants to get another loan later with which he can buy three more cows.

loans.use: to buy wire.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.es:
Cecilia es una mujer de 47 años de edad, está muy contenta por su préstamo porque gracias a ello pudo comprar su toro y logro criarlo hasta venderlo, Cecilia cuenta que con esta ayuda a su familia pudo sacar adelante. Para Cecilia la crianza de toros es muy rentable, pues solo la cuida por ratos mientras se dedica a otras actividades, pero ahora con el afán de seguir mejorando esta actividad, solicita un nuevo préstamo para la compra de un nuevo toro para criarlo y luego venderlo.
Su esperanza de vida es contar con el préstamo para poder adquirir su toro, pero también anhela construir su casa de terraza.
texts.en:
Cecilia is a 47 year old woman who's very happy about her loan because thanks to the loan she was able to buy a bull to raise and then sell. She says that with this help she was able to pull her family through. For Cecilia raising bulls is very profitable, since she just takes care of them for short periods while she works on other things. But now with an eye towards improving this activity she's applying for a new loan to purchase a new bull to raise and then sell.

Her hope is to have a loan to be able to acquire a bull, but she also yearns to build her terraced home.

loans.use: To buy a bull to raise.

loans.name: Gaudioso Jr.

texts.en:
Gaudioso is a 39-year-old man who raises pigs to earn a living. He has been doing this for five years. Gaudioso is from Calape, Bohol. He is married and blessed with one child, who is 16 years old.

Gaudioso needs to work hard to provide for the needs of his family. Therefore, he is asking for a loan to buy additional piglets to raise and to buy feed. In the future, Gaudioso aspires to augment his livelihood to have a better means of living.

loans.use: to buy piglets and feed.

loans.name: Candido Eligio

texts.es:
El cacareo de las gallinas y el olor a leche de vaca dan la bienvenida a la finca de Candido, un ganadero y transportista de 51 años de edad, que trabaja desde hace más de quince años en el campo para salir adelante con su familia. De sus ocho hijos, ahora solo está  a cargo de una, que está a punto de graduarse como administradora de empresas, lo que lo hace sentirse muy orgulloso, ya que él solo pudo terminar su primaria.
Si bien el inicio de Candido fue apoyando a su madre y a su hermano, tuvo la visión de ahorrar para comprar el carro que utiliza como acarreo y para extender el ganado que ya tenía con su familia. Ahora solo está él y su sobrino dando lo mejor de ellos en la finca, por lo que solicita un préstamo para comprar alambre, grapas y para pagar a varios trabajadores para reparar las cercas del potrero y poder limpiarlo, para que pueda crecer el zacate que alimenta el ganado. En sus planes está obtener más adelante otro crédito para comprar un auto nuevo para transporte selectivo.
texts.en:
The cackle of hens and the odor of cows' milk welcomes you to Candido's farm. He is 51-year-old rancher and trucker who has been working for more than 15 years in the fields to get ahead with his family. Of his eight children, he only cares for one now who is about to graduate as a business administrator, which makes him feel very proud since he was only able to finish primary school.

In the beginning, when Candido was supporting his mother and brother, he had the vision to save in order to purchase the vehicle that he uses for hauling and to enlarge the cattle that he has with his family. Now there is only himself and his nephew giving their all on the farm for which reason he is requesting a loan to buy wire, staples, and to pay the various workers to repair the pasture fences and clean it so he can grow fodder to feed the cattle, In his plans, he want to obtain another loan to buy a new vehicle for selective transport.

loans.use: to buy wire, staples, and to pay the workers.

loans.name: Juan Jose

texts.es:
Juan José es un agricultor de 25 años, soltero,  Juan José se dedica a la producción de miel de abejas Apis melíferas Certificada Orgánica, Juan José depende de la producción de miel, Juan José sueña con formar una familia pero antes trabajar para tener lo necesario a la hora de formar su hogar.
Juan José trabaja con las colmenas hace más de 5 años de las cuales produce miel de una altísima calidad la cual comercializa atreves de COCAFCAL. La producción de miel es una actividad novedosa y muy exitosa en la región ya que la buena densidad de plantas en la región favorece para una producción abundante, además las abejas colaboran a que la producción de otros alimentos sea más alta y las buenas condiciones climáticas ayudan a conservar la salud de las abejas.
En la actualidad Juan José necesita un préstamo para comprar materiales para hacer labores de mantenimiento a sus colmenas ya que las cajas en malas condiciones pueden provocar que las abejas mueran, para lo que es necesario construir más cajas y reparar otras, disponer de más espacio preparado y comprar alimentos orgánicos de calidad para las colmenas.
Un crédito ayudara a Juan José a mejorar la calidad de su miel y a conservar la salud de sus colmenas, con las ganancias de la miel vendida Juan José ayudara a sus padres e iniciara a construir su casa.
texts.en:
Juan Jose is a farmer who is 25 years old and single. He works at producing Certified Organic honey from "Apis melifera" bees. Juan Jose depends on the production of honey. He dreams of having a family, but before that he needs to work to have what is necessary for when it is time to form his own household.

Juan Jose has worked with the hives for more than 5 years, in which time he has produced honey of the highest quality which is sold through COCAFCAL. The production of honey is a new and very successful occupation in the region since the great density of plants in the region favors an abundant production. Besides, the bees contribute to the higher production of other foods and the good climatic conditions help to maintain the health of the bees.

Now, Juan Jose needs a loan to buy materials in order to do the work to maintain his hives since the boxes in poor condition can cause the bees to die. Thus, he needs to build more boxes and repair others, prepare more space and buy organic food of good quality for the hives.

A loan will help Juan Jose to improve the quality of the honey and to maintain the health of his hives. With the earnings from the honey he sells, he will help his parents and begin to build his house.

loans.use: to buy food for the hives and material to make repairs to his apiary.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes has been involved in business activities for a few years. She started with her own working capital of $350. She is applying for a loan of $1,000 from Tuba Rai Metin because she wants to improve the management of her business. She has a kiosk in front of her house and she is taking this loan from Tuba Rai Metin. She will buy additional supplies to keep in her kiosk including biscuits, candies, lighters, cigarettes, aqua, cooking oils, candles, eggs, coffee, soft drinks, hard drinks and other things to sell. She is happy with the loan that was offered to her by Tuba Rai Metin because with this loan, she can improve her management of her business and her income can increase.

loans.use: to buy biscuits, candies, lighters, cigarettes, aqua, cooking oils, candles, eggs, coffee, soft drinks, hard drinks and other things to sell.

loans.name: Maria Julia

texts.es:
María Julia tiene 70 años, es viuda y tiene 11 hijos de los cuales 2 aún están bajo su cargo y un nieto, Su principal actividad económica es la agricultura, produce café certificado bajo los sellos Orgánico y Comercio Justo que vende en COCAFCAL de la cual es socia además María Julia es miembro activa de un grupo de mujeres donde procesan productos derivados del café, María Julia sueña con que el grupo sea una oportunidad no para sí misma sino para las futuras generaciones de mujeres de la comunidad.
María Julia es apasionada por los temas que se refieren a producir alimentos 100% naturales es por eso que quiere construir un invernadero para producir tomates, Chile dulce y Pepinos que comercializara con el apoyo de su grupo de mujeres, la producción de alimentos en invernadero es una novedad en la región por que facilita la producción orgánica y mejora la calidad del alimento producido.
En estos momentos María Julia solicita un préstamo para comprar materiales para construir su invernadero en el cual producirá con el apoyo técnico de COCAFCAL tomates 100% orgánicos para venta en los mercados locales, con las ganancias obtenidas por el producto vendido María Julia espera mejorar las oportunidades de su familia y hacer crecer su grupo de mujeres.
texts.en:
María Julia, age 70, is a widow. She has 11 children, two of them and one grandson are still under her care. Her main economic activity is agriculture. She produces coffee that is labeled organic and Fair Trade, which she sells to COCAFAL, where she is a member. María Julia is also an active member of a group of women that process products derived from coffee.

María Julia dreams that the group will be an opportunity, not for herself, but for the future generations of women in the community. María Julia is passionate about the themes that have to do with producing food that is 100% natural. That is why she wants to build a greenhouse to produce tomatoes, sweet peppers, and cucumbers. She will sell them with the support of her group of women. The production of food in greenhouses is a novelty to the area because it facilitates organic production and improves the quality of the food produced.

María Julia is now requesting a loan to buy materials to build her greenhouse in which, with the technical support of COCAFAL, she will produce 100% organic tomatoes. She will sell them at the local markets. With the earnings she gets from the product she sells, María Julia hopes to improve her families opportunies and to make her group of women grow.

loans.use: to buy wood, antiviral material, tomato plants, and other materials need to build a greenhouse.

loans.name: Jose Fernando

texts.es: Jose es un hombre de 41 años de edad, es casado con una linda familia de tres hijos de las edades entre 2 y 5 años, esta humilde familia vive en una comunidad de Suchitepéquez. Jose para generar sus ingresos y sacar adelante a su familia se dedica a la compra y venta de zapatos, este negocio lo realiza ella desde hace  15 años.  Jose gracias a la amabilidad con la que atiende a sus clientes ahora su negocio tiene mucha demanda por esa razón solicita un préstamo para la compra de una variedad de estilos y colores de zapatos. Con esta inversión Jose espera satisfacer mejor las necesidades de sus clientes. Su gran sueño es contar con un local propio y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Jose, age 41, is married and has a lovely family with three children between the ages of two and five. This humble family lives in a community in Suchitepéquez.

In order to generate income and get his family ahead, Jose buys and sells shoes. He has been engaged in this business for 15 years. Thanks to the kindness with which he tends to his customers, his business in now much in demand.

For this reason he is requesting a loan to buy a variety of styles and colors of shoes. With this investment Jose hopes to better satisfy his customers' needs.

His big dream is to have his own place and to improve his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy and sell shoes.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca is 49 years old, married, and has four children. Two of them are still attending school; they are ages 11 and 13 years old respectively. Her income mostly goes for food and school fees.

She opened a barbecue shop, selling chicken and meat barbecue. Her husband is a driver.

Francisca decided to join CEVI to access loans and boost her business. She wants to buy additional ingredients like meat, chicken, pork, condiments, and bamboo skewers. With these, she would be able to slowly improve her daily earnings. She could now start to set aside some of the profit for emergency use.

She hopes that she will become productive in the years to come.

She is very thankful to Kiva and CEVI.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients such as meat, chicken, pork, condiments, and bamboo skewers.

loans.name: Mayla

texts.en:
Mayla is a married woman from Tubigon, Bohol. She is 43 years old and earns a living by running a sari-sari store business to help her husband in their basic needs. Although her husband has a job, there are times in their life that having no capital to run a business is their problem.

That is why Mayla has come to a decision to borrow money to operate their business continuously. She is asking for a loan for additional capital to buy grocery items such as noodles, canned goods, eggs, cooking oil, coffee, sugar, toiletries, candies, chips, and biscuits.

In the future, she wants to uplift their livelihood and become profitable.

loans.use: to buy noodles, canned goods, eggs, cooking oil, coffee, sugar, toiletries, candies, chips, and biscuits.

loans.name: Abemerana Group

texts.fr:
Jean  fait partie du groupe  Abemerana et  habite à  Bujumbura. Il  a 61 ans et est marié à Léa, une cultivatrice. Ensemble ils ont 8 enfants âgés de 10 à 28 ans, dont  4 étudient. 

Il fait le commerce de  riz, de haricot, des  cahiers ...   depuis  27 ans. 

Il est à son  deuxième   crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  une grande quantité de riz, et  de haricot  à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, Il voudrait  ouvrir un restaurant, et voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en: Jean is part of the Abemerana group and lives in Bujumbura. He is 61 years old and is married to Léa, a farmer. Together they have 8 children, between the ages of 10 and 28, of which 4 are studying. He has been conducting a business of rice, beans, and notebooks for 27 years. He is on his second loan with Turame. With the Kiva loan that he obtains, he is going to increase his capital and buy a large quantity of rice and beans to resell in order to earn more. In the coming years, he would like to open a restaurant and see his children study.

loans.use: to increase his capital and buy a large quantity of rice and beans to resell in order to earn more.

loans.name: Heang

texts.en:
Heang, 30 years old, is an automobile repairer who lives in Prey Chhor District, Kampong Cham Province. He is a hardworking father of two children who are enrolled in the primary school. His wife is a farmer. This couple can make a net profit of approximately USD 15 a day.

During this time, Heang is faced with a financial issue in his family. He needs some money to buy some automobile accessories for his career, but he cannot afford to. Therefore, now he would like to get a Kiva loan, and he has decided to apply for a Kiva loan to help them.

He is thankful to all lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: to buy some automobile accessories.

loans.name: Beata

texts.en: Beata is a married woman who lives in Tubigon, Bohol.  She is a mother of seven children; four adults and three school-aged children who need her support.  Beata is 45 years old and earns a living by selling fish to the community, while her husband works hard as a farmer.  Beata has been successfully conducting this fish-selling business since two years ago.  She is asking for a loan to buy more fish to sell to help her augment their livelihood. She wants to improve the business in the future for sustainability.

loans.use: to buy more fish

loans.name: Rina

texts.en:
Rina has been a fish vendor for quite a period of time now. She caters fresh fish to local settlers in her place. She lives in the rural area of Tolosa, Leyte with her husband and a nine-year-old son.

She decided to increase her current business, but the main issue is an insufficient supply of fish. Rina is applying for a Kiva loan from Kiva's field partner CEVI because she has to purchase additional stock of a new variety of fresh fish. In this way she will be able to cope with demands. She can use the profit as savings to fulfill future needs as well.

Rina is very thankful to Kiva.

loans.use: to buy assorted fresh  fish

loans.name: Irakoze Ii Group

texts.fr:
Jean  fait partie du groupe IrakozeII et  habite à Bujumbura. Il a 38 ans et est marié à Diane, une commerçante. Ensemble ils ont 1 enfant âgé de 3ans 

Il fait le commerce de  riz, de haricot, de savons, des unités téléphoniques,…  depuis  5ans. 

Il est à son quatorzième   crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il va  augmenter son capital et acheter une grande quantité d’unités  téléphoniques à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, il voudrait  acheter une parcelle pour ses activités commerciales.
texts.en: Jean is part of the Irakozell group and lives in Bujumbura. He is 38 years old and is married to Diane, a storekeeper. Together they have one 3-year-old child. He has been conducting business in rice, beans, soap, and telephones for 5 years. He is on his fourth loan with Turame. With the Kiva loan that he obtains, he is going to increase his capital and buy a large quantity of telephones to resell in order to earn more. In the coming years, he would like to buy a plot of land for his business activities.

loans.use: to increase his capital to buy a large quantity of telephones to resell in order to earn more.

loans.name: Famille Aime Group

texts.fr: Les frais scolaires, l'alimentation et l'activité culturale ont été renforcés grâce à la production réalisée par le crédit précédent. Avec ce présent crédit, Aimé projette entretenir son champ dans le souhait d'améliorer sa vie de famille.
texts.en: School fees, food, and cultural activities have been reinforced thanks to the production realized by the previous loan. With this present loan, Aimé plans to maintain her field with the hope of improving the life of her family.

loans.use: to maintain a coffee field.

loans.name: Sokin

texts.en:
Sokin, 33 years old, is a farmer who lives in Prey Chhor District, Kampong Cham Province. She is a hard-working mother of three children who are enrolled in primary school. Her husband is a fisherman. This couple can make a net profit of approximately USD 10 a day.

During this time, Sokin is facing a financial issue in her family. She needs some money to buy a pump for pumping water for her farmland and to buy a boat for fishing for her husband, but she cannot afford to do so. Therefore, she has decided to apply for a Kiva loan to help them. She is thankful to all lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: to buy a pump for pumping water and to buy a boat for fishing.

loans.name: Annabelle

texts.en:
A widow woman name Anabelle, who is 45 years old, has a contractual job in her town Panaon Misamis Occidental, but unfortunately her salary is not enough to provide for the needs of her 2 children. She sends both of them to school. In order to support the financial needs of her family she has to engage in a “rent a motorcycle” business. She purchased a motorcycle 5 years ago and this allows her to earn extra income. Unluckily, the motorcycle needs to be repaired at this time, so she applied to Gata Daku MPC for a loan of PHP 16,000.

The money she borrowed was used to repair the motorcycle and buy its spare parts. She has a dream of becoming a motorcycle operator in her town. In the near future she plans to buy a new motorcycle in addition to her old one.

loans.use: to repair and maintain a motorcycle and to buy spare parts.

loans.name: Felomina

texts.en:
Felomina is a 45-year-old married woman from Jagna, Bohol. She has five dependents ages 10-17. She has been in the hog-raising business for four years. She plans to use the loan to buy piglets, feed and supplements. Her husband, a carpenter, helps finance their daily needs.

Felomina earns 3,000 PHP a month by doing the hog-raising business. Felomina would like to expand her business to support her family and to send her children to school to have a bright future.

loans.use: to buy piglets, feed and supplements

loans.name: Separ

texts.en: Separ is from Jagna, Bohol. She is 63 years old and relies on farming rice to live. This has been her source of income for 40 years now. From time to time, she also cooks snacks for additional income. Separ is requesting a loan to buy farm inputs such as fertilizer, seeds and pesticides. She is optimistic that with the loan, she will boost her business and increase her yield in four month's time. Separ hopes to save and be more successful in the years to come.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seeds and pesticides

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.es: Gregoria es una más de las muchas personas que sus vidas sean visto muy beneficiado con los créditos de kiva, ella cuenta que gracias a su crédito pudo realizar la remodelación de su casa y un buen aspecto ahora tiene, Gregoria está contenta con este avance mas no conforme, ella solicita un nuevo crédito para la remodelación de su baño pues es el único rincón que le hace falta remodelar, con el crédito ella comprara: cemento, cal y arena.  Su gran sueño es tener una vivienda con una mejor presentación.
texts.en:
Gregoria is one more of the many people whose lives are seen to have benefited very much from the Kiva loans. She relates that thanks to her loan, she was able to do the remodeling of her house, and it now has a good appearance. Gregoria is happy with this progress, but, not satisfied, she is applying for a new loan for the remodeling of her bathroom, since it is the only corner that has not been remodeled.

With the loan she will buy cement, lime, and sand. Her great dream is to have a home with a better appearance.

loans.use: to buy materials such as cement, lime, and sand

loans.name: Anibal

texts.es:
Anibal con 49 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente,vive en casa propia de material rústico, junto a su cónyuge e hijos, en el distrito de Santo Tomás, provincia de Cutervo,departamento de Cajamarca,país Perú.Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura,cultivo de café, cría-engorde de ganado vacuno, cría de animales menores y cultivo de producto de pan llevar.

Anibal se dedica a la agricultura, al cultivo de café, variedad Catimor, plantación tiene 4 años de edad, cultivo realiza en terreno propio, con 05 años de experiencia en el rubro. Su producto lo vende en el distrito Santo tomas a compradores de la zona. Adicionalmente se dedica a la cría animales menores (cuyes, gallinas y cerdos), cultiva productos de pan llevar (yuca, menestras, vitucas y otos) siendo estos dos últimos para su consumo y en ocasiones para la venta. Solicita préstamo para mantenimiento de su cultivo de café, con ello obtendrá buena producción y mayores ingresos para así poder mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.

Anibal es socio recurrente en Edpyme Alternativa. Anibal firmará con cónyuge.
texts.en:
Anibal, 49, lives with his partner and children in their own rustic home in Santo Tomás district, Cutervo province, Cajamarca department, Perú. Area residents work primarily in agriculture, coffee farming, cattle ranching, raising smaller animals, and growing basic food crops.

Anibal works in agriculture, growing Catimor coffee. His plantation, which is on his own land, is four years old, and he has five years of industry experience. He sells his product in Santo Tomás district to area buyers.

In addition, he raises smaller animals (guinea pigs, chickens, and pigs) and grows basic food crops (yucca, legumes, taro, and others) for his own use and sometimes for sale.

He is requesting a loan to maintain his coffee crop. It will bring him good production and greater income for a better quality of life for himself and his family.

Anibal is a repeat client of Edpyme Alternativa. He will sign with his spouse.

loans.use: to maintain his coffee crop.

loans.name: Zulia

texts.en: Zulia lives in Kagad, Uganda. She is 25 years old and married with 3 children. She owns a boutique as her major source of income, a business she started in 2010. She works on a busy street in town and this makes her want to grow her business to meet the required standards. She started up the business with a purpose of generating income. Zulia has a dream of educating her children. She therefore needs more income and to add to her stock of clothes for selling. Zulia's major challenge is competition from others doing the same business.

loans.use: to add to her stock of clothes for selling.

loans.name: Bushra

texts.en:
Bushra is a 45-year-old lady who is married and passing her life with her two sons and a daughter in the area of Lahore, Pakistan
.
She is receiving this loan for her husband's embroidery business; he runs a shop with a few planted embroidery machines. He wants to sell embroidery raw materials as well such as sequins, pearls, threads, precious stones, silk, needles and wooden frames for embroidery. He already invested all of his savings into his current enterprise and does not have money left for purchasing the described inventory.

Therefore, Bushra requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan so that her husband can buy the desired inventories such as stocks of threads, fancy cloths, sequins, precious stones and pearls of various colors.

Bushra is very thankful to Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy stock of threads, fancy cloths, sequins, precious stones and pearls for her husband's business.

loans.name: Samina's Group

texts.en:
Samina is 35 years old, married and the mother of a daughter. Her husband is a driver by profession and provides transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw. He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family's expenses, but now it requires proper maintenance to keep it in its functional routine.

For this reason, Samina has applied for a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan for her husband. He wants to buy new tires and do a little bit of engine maintenance on his vehicle. This will help him drive more smoothly and provide a better transport service to his passengers. She is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business.

Samina gives thanks to Kiva and to its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to fix her husband's rickshaw so he can drive and generate income for his family.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
Carlos es de la ciudad de Concepción, tiene una despensa en la que todos los días trabaja desde muy tempranas horas del día, hasta muy entrada la noche.
Él es una persona muy sacrificada que se esfuerza para poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de sus seres queridos, comenta que pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de insumos para poder surtir su despensa con comestibles, verduras, frutas, carnes, y otros, y de esa forma seguir ofreciendo a sus clientes la buena variedad a la que están acostumbrados.
texts.en:
Carlos is from the city of Concepción. He has a grocery store where he works every day from early morning until late at night.

He is a very self-sacrificing person who works hard in order to be able to improve his quality of life and that of his loved ones. He comments that he is asking for this loan in order to invest in the purchase of consumable goods in order to stock his grocery store with food such as vegetables, fruits, meats, and other items and in this way continue offering a good variety to his customers like they are accustomed.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of consumable goods in order to stock his grocery store with food such as vegetables, fruits, meats, and other items

loans.name: Benard

texts.en: Benard is a produce business man trading in maize, beans, and cassava. He started his business in 2009 with a goal of self sustainability and family development. He is married and has four children. He is 42 years old. Benard also earns from farming, especially from growing coffee. He has a dream of starting a wholesale shop and buying a vehicle for transportation. However, poor business seasons are his major challenges. He needs money to increase his stock. He will use this loan to buy beans and maize to resell.

loans.use: to buy beans and maize to resell

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es:
Manuel es un hombre de 28 años de edad, con grandes aspiraciones en la vida su gran sueño de comprar un terreno fue posible gracias al apoyo del crédito, él ahora tiene un lugar donde poder  construir en un futuro. Ahora su mayor prioridad es fortalecer su negocio, por esa razón solicita un nuevo préstamo para la compra de mercaderías de abarrotes tales como: golosinas,  gaseosas, arroz y azúcar.
 Con esta inversión el espera satisfacer mejor las necesidades de los clientes y ampliar su tienda.
texts.en:
Manuel, 28, has big aspirations in life. His big dream to buy a piece of land was made possible thanks to support from a loan. Now he has a place where he can build in the future. Now his biggest priority is to develop his business, so he is requesting a new loan to buy grocery merchandise such as: candy, soft drinks, rice, and sugar.

With this investment, he hopes to better satisfy his clients' needs and expand his store.

loans.use: to buy grocery products such as: candy, soft drinks, rice, and sugar.

loans.name: Marciana

texts.en: Marciana is one woman who is very interested in the business. She is not overly dependent on her husband to be responsible for the household. So now she is requesting a loan of $1,000 from Tuba Rai Metin to add to her capital to buy more goods such as rice, noodles, biscuits, cooking oils, cigarettes, candies, milk, slippers, candles, sardines, sugar and other things to sell. Because she lives near many people, she has plans to open a bigger business for everybody and she wants to keep the items that people like. The first time she opened her business was a few years ago with a capital base.

loans.use: to buy rice, noodles, biscuits, cooking oils, cigarettes, candies, milk, slippers, candles, sardines, sugar and other things to sell.

loans.name: San Expedito Group

texts.es:
Este grupo está dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza esforzándose por mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de sus seres queridos.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Iris, quien se dedica a las confecciones, es modista, y por medio de su humilde trabajo se gana la vida de una manera digna y honesta. Iris comenta que se ha hecho de muy buena clientela, y gracias a ello ha podido mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de sus seres queridos.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar telas, hilos, gomas, botones y otros productos para poder seguir con sus confecciones, y de esa forma poder continuar ayudando a sus seres queridos. Agradece por la oportunidad que está recibiendo de poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
This group is part of the poverty elimination program, striving for improved quality of life for themselves and their loved ones.

One of its members is Iris, who works sewing garments. Through her humble work as a seamstress, she earns an honest, respectable living. Iris says that she has developed a very good clientele, and this has allowed her to improve her quality of life and that of her loved ones.

She is asking for this loan in order to be able to buy fabric, thread, elastic, buttons, and other products. This will enable her to keep making garments and helping her loved ones. She is grateful for this opportunity to be able to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, elastic, buttons, and other products for sewing garments.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy clothing for resale.

loans.name: Las Merceditas Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Las Merceditas integrado por 17 mujeres, está en  el ciclo 12 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan para superar la línea de pobreza, y por medio del trabajo unido quieren ayudar a sus familias.
Una de las integrantes es la Señora Heliodora, ella es peluquera, se esfuerza todos los días desde muy temprano ya que tiene muy buena clientela, y quiere poder cumplir siempre con ellos. Comenta que poco a poco ha podido mejorar ya se esfuerza mucho por poder dar a su familia una mejor condición y que no tengan que pasar por necesidades como las que ella paso.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar shampoo, enjuagues, tintes, cremas y otros productos, para que de esa forma pueda seguir con su buen servicio a sus clientes. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder crecer y mejorar en su pequeño emprendimiento.
texts.en:
The group called "Las Merceditas" is made up of 17 women who are in their 12th loan cycle with the Committee on Women. All of them work and help each other in order to move out of poverty. Through unified work they want to help their families.

One of the group members is named Heliodora. She is a hair dresser. She works every day from early morning since she has a very good client base. She wants to be able to meet all of their needs. She comments that little by little she has been able to improve her quality of life and to give her family better living conditions so that they won't have to live through such great need as she herself experienced in the past.

She is asking for a loan in order to buy shampoo, conditioners, dyes, cremes, and other products so that she will be able to continue offering good service to her customers. She is thankful for the opportunity that she has received to be able to grow and improve in her small enterprise.

loans.use: to buy shampoo, conditioners, dyes, cremes, and other products so that she will be able to continue offering good salon services to her customers.

loans.name: Cinthya

texts.es: Cinthya se desempeña en su propio salón de belleza. Solicita un préstamo de quinientos mil colones (₡ 500 000), para la compra de productos de belleza los cuales utiliza en su negocio. Este dinero le permitirá atender más clientes y lograr aumentar sus ingresos.
texts.en: Cinthya runs her own beauty salon.  She is asking for a loan of 500,000 colones (Costa Rican currency) in order to purchase beauty products to use in her business.  This money will allow her to help serve her customers and raise her income.

loans.use: to buy beauty products for her salon.

loans.name: Nueva Esperanza Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama Nueva Esperanza, ellas son  de la ciudad de San Ignacio, son unidas y solidarias entre ellas, trabajan juntas en actividades, manifiestan que quieren capacitarse para poder seguir ayudando a sus familias.
La señora Claudia, es miembro del comité, ella es peluquera, está casada, pero aún no tiene hijos, vive en casa propia con su marido, y con esfuerzo están saliendo adelante. Claudia comenta que tiene ya una muy buena clientela que siempre se acerca hasta su negocio para hacer uso del servicio que da. Esta contenta por esta oportunidad que recibe de poder capacitarse y crecer en su humilde emprendimiento.
Ella pide este préstamo para poder comprar shampoo, enjuagues, cremas, tintes, y otros, y de esa forma poder seguir ofreciendo un buen servicio a sus clientes. Todas las integrantes del grupo participan de manera muy activa de todas las actividades que les proporciona la fundación paraguaya.
texts.en:
This group is called "Nueva Esperanza" or "New Hope". It is made up of women from the city of San Ignacio. They are unified and supportive of each other. They work together on activities and note that they want to train themselves in order to continue helping their families.

Claudia is a member of this group. She is a hair-dresser. She is married but does not have children yet. She lives in her own home with her husband, and through hard work she is getting ahead. Claudia comments that she has a good customer base that always comes to her for her good service. She is happy for this chance to receive training and to grow in her humble enterprise.

She is asking for a loan in order to buy shampoo, conditioner, creme, dye, and other items and in this way continue offering good services to her clients. All the group members participate in an active manner in all activities that Kiva's partner Fundación Paraguaya offers.

loans.use: to buy shampoo, conditioner, creme, dye, and other items and in this way continue offering good services to her clients.

loans.name: Marlin Raquel

texts.es:
Marlín es casada, vive junto a su familia, estudio cosmetología y abrió su negocio propio hace 4 años, así puede generar recursos económicos para aportar en los gastos familiares, comenta no tener respaldo de parientes en el extranjero.
Requiere de un nuevo crédito para comprar labiales, rubores, tintes, mascarillas, etc., de esta manera atenderá mejor a sus clientes y fortalecerá su negocio.
Su sueño es tener una sala de belleza más grande y rentable.
texts.en:
Marlín is married and lives with her family. She studies cosmetology and opened her own business four years ago. She is able to generate economic income in order to support household expenses. She comments that she does not receive any assistance from relatives abroad.

She needs a new loan in order to buy lip stick, rouge, dyes, facial masks, etc. and in this way offer her clients better services and strengthen her business.

Her dream is to have a beauty salon that is larger and more lucrative.

loans.use: to buy lip stick, rouge, dyes, facial masks, etc. and in this way offer her clients better services and strengthen her business.

loans.name: Jorge Luis

texts.es: Jorge es un emprendedor de 47 años de edad que durante muchos años estuvo empleado en una comercializadora de artículos, desempeñándose en el cargo de ayudante y posteriormente como cobrador, experiencia que le permitió conocer muy a fondo este negocio y con un pequeño capital inició su proyecto de negocio en el año 1995.  Jorge es un comerciante que recorre los diferentes barrios del municipio de Barranquilla, ofertando una variada gama de electrométricos menores, prendas de vestir y calzado, su cadena de comercialización es puerta a puerta y por pedidos, sus ventas las realiza semanalmente a partir de las 9 a.m. hasta las 12 meridiano, él brinda facilidad de pago su margen de ganancia es mucho mayor, sin embargo algunos clientes prefieren cancelar inmediatamente. En la actualidad está aplicando una solicitud de crédito,  su primer credikiva financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo que invertirá pedidos de sus clientes los cuales no alcanza a cubrir con su capital.  Aunque se encuentra separado de su cónyuge es padre de una hija de 22 años a quien siempre ha ofrecido bienestar y su meta la incluye, puesto que desea engrandecer su negocio y con las utilidades continuar apoyándole en sus necesidades.
texts.en:
Jorge is a 47-year old entrepreneur who, for many years, worked for a retailer as an assistant, and later as a bill collector. This experience gave him in-depth knowledge of this business, and with a little capital, he started his business project in 1995.

Jorge is a businessman who works in the various neighborhoods of the municipality of Barranquilla, selling a range of small appliances, clothing, and footwear. He sells from door to door and also takes orders. He makes his sales weekly from 9 a.m. to 12 noon. He offers a payment plan with which his profit margin is much higher, although some customers prefer to pay immediately.

Jorge is currently applying for a loan, his first Kiva loan through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. He will invest it in filling his customers orders, which he is not able to cover with the capital that he has.

Although he is separated from his wife, he is the father of a 22-year old daughter, and he has always looked out for her wellbeing and his goal also includes her. He would like to expand his business and with the profits, continue supporting her in what she needs.

loans.use: to invest in his customers' orders.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more medicinal products.

loans.name: Liduvina Raquel

texts.es:
Liduvina es una trabajadora social que lleva más de seis años apoyando a los niños y a los adolescentes para que salgan de las calles y no sean víctimas del peligro. A sus 38 años de edad se siente plena por estar contribuyendo en el cambio de vida de estos menores de edad. Tras trabajar por tanto tiempo ayudando a los demás, siente que ahora debe trabajar también en pro de su salud y de la de su familia. 
Liduvina es madre de tres hijos menores de 22 años de edad, a quienes les desea darles una mejor calidad de vida, por lo que solicita un préstamo para construir un servicio sanitario, ya que actualmente tiene una letrina. De manera que lo cambiará por un inodoro y así evitar que haya enfermedades, que exista mayor seguridad e higiene.  En sus planes está seguir mejorando junto con su esposo la salud de su familia y mejorar las condiciones de su hogar.
texts.en:
Liduvina is a social worker who has been working for more than six years to get children and adolescents off the streets and out of danger. At 38 years of age, she feels fulfilled for contributing to changing the lives of these minors. After working for so long helping others, she feels that she should now work for her own health and that of her family.

Liduvina is the mother of three children under the age of 22, to whom she hopes to give a better quality of life. That is why she is applying for a loan in order to build a bathroom, since she currently has a latrine. This way she can have a toilet, thus avoiding illnesses and having greater security and hygiene.

Among her plans are to continue improving her family's health and improving their living conditions, alongside her husband.

loans.use: to build a bathroom.

loans.name: Jairo

texts.es:
Jairo es un agricultor de 22 años de edad dedicado especialmente a la producción de café el cual forma principal fuente de subsistencia, Jairo Tiene un hijo bajo su cargo, Él se dedica a la caficultura desde que tenía 16 años de edad. Jairo comercializa su café con el apoyo de COCAFCAL de la cual es socio, con las ganancias de su café el sostiene las necesidades de su familia, él quiere poder formar un pequeño patrimonio para el futuro de su hijo.
Jairo tiene mucha pasión por la producción de café de calidad y ligado a esa pasión es que ha obtenido ya varios sello se certificación para sus cafetales como ser: Comercio Justo, Rainforest y UTZ ahora está interesado en entrar al programa de manejo y producción orgánica, primeramente porque de esta manera asegura un mejor mercado para su café y además hace de su cafetal un cultivo más sostenible y amigable con el ambiente. 
Jairo solicita un crédito para poder llevar a cabo los trabajos necesarios en la conversión a orgánico de su cafetal el nuevo certificado de calidad le dará a su café más posibilidades de mercado lo que le aumentara los ingresos y como el menciona “Lo más importante no es el precio del café si no que protegemos la tierra que es la herencia de nuestros hijos”, 
Un préstamo ayudara a Jairo a tener mejores mercados por su café por lo tanto a obtener mejores ganancias lo que le permitirá una mejor calidad de vida para su familia, además de brindarle una oportunidad para ofrecer mejores oportunidades educativas a su hijo, con las ganancias obtenidas por su café Jairo tendrá más posibilidades de brindarle una educación de calidad a su hijo.
texts.en:
Jairo is a 22-year-old farmer who works primarily in the production of coffee, which is his main source of income. Jairo has a son under his responsibility. He has been growing coffee since he was 16 years old. Jairo sells coffee with the help of COCAFCAL, of which he is a member. With the profits from his coffee he meets the needs of his family. He wants to be able to build a small legacy for his son's future.

Jairo has a great deal of passion for growing quality coffee, and linked to this passion he has already obtained several certification seals for his coffee plantations, such as Fair Trade, Rainforest and UTZ. Now he is interested in entering the program of organic management and production, primarily because in this way, he ensures a better market for his coffee, and also makes his coffee plantation more sustainable and environmentally friendly.

Jairo is requesting a loan to be able to carry out the work necessary to be able to carry out the work necessary to convert his coffee plantation to organic. The new quality certification will make his coffee more marketable, which will increase his income and as he says, "The most important thing isn't the price of the coffee, but rather that we protect the land that is the inheritance of our children."

A loan will help Jairo to have better markets for his coffee, and therefore obtain better profits, which will allow him and his family to have a better quality of life, and enable him to offer his son a quality education.

loans.use: to buy organic coffee plants, organic fertilizers, and to do everything necessary to convert his coffee plantation to organic.

loans.name: Las Divinas Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Las Divinas está en su ciclo número 8 del programa de Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras, están además haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de la pobreza para poder conocer la situación de vida de cada una de las integrantes de este grupo.
Una de ellas es la Sra. Pabla, una persona muy trabajadora y luchadora que se esmera para poder ayudar a sus seres queridos por medio de su trabajo de manera unida a través del comité. Ella se dedica a hacer comidas, empieza su trabajo todos los días desde muy tempranas horas, ya que ella misma se encarga de hacer la comidas, comenta que tiene muchos clientes que siempre le hacen muchos pedidos, es por eso que le va muy bien.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar insumos para hacer sus comidas, como ser verduras, condimentos, carne, pollo y otros, y de esa forma poder seguir con su emprendimiento. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder crecer y mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
The group known as "Las Divinas" is in its eighth loan cycle in the program of the Women Entrepreneurs Committee. They are also doing the survey on the elimination of poverty in order to be able to understand the living situation of each one of the members of this group.

One of these women is Señora Pabla, a very hard-working and striving person who goes to great effort to be able to help her loved ones through her work in a united manner through the committee. Her work is making food. She begins her work every day at a very early hour, since she herself is responsible for making the dishes. She comments that she has many customers who always place many orders with her. It is for this reason that it [the business] is going very well for her.

She is requesting this loan to be able to buy supplies to make her dishes, such as vegetables, condiments, meat, chicken, and other items, and in this way be able to continue with her enterprise. She is grateful for the opportunity that she is receiving to be able to grow and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy supplies to prepare food, such as vegetables, condiments, meat, chicken, and other items.

loans.name: Feliciana

texts.en:
Feliciana lives in Ronda, Cebu with her family. She is 58 years old. Like most people her age, Feliciana is into raising hogs. This business is easier to manage due to the proximity of the barns to the her home. This has been her business for ten years now. Every four months, she usually earns 4,000 PHP. 

She is asking for a loan to buy piglets, feed and food for family consumption. This will assure her healthy and fattened hogs that will give her a better return on investment. In the future, she hopes to make expansions on the number of hogs to raise. Her income will be for food and savings.

loans.use: to buy piglets, feed and food for family consumption.

loans.name: Rezen

texts.en:
Rezen is a 27-year-old motorcycle transporter in Voi, Kenya. He is a single man who has been in this business for the last three years and is doing well.

This is his second borrowing from VisionFund Kenya to finance his business after repaying the previous loans successfully.

He will use the money requested to service his motorcycle and anticipate to pay back his loan. He hopes to own a taxi in the future.

loans.use: to service his motorcycle.

loans.name: Karina

texts.es: Karina de 44 años es una valerosa mujer que en medio de una situación difícil por la enfermedad de su cónyuge quien padeció una isquemia cerebral, tuvo que tomar las riendas en el hogar para sostener a sus cuatro hijos y los gastos médicos de su cónyuge.  Por fortuna los compañeros de su marido le suministraron un dinero para que emprendiera su propio negocio y así mitigar un poco su dolorosa situación. Ella decidió invertir en carnes frías, pescado y yogurt por ser productos de amplio consumo, los cuales vende a vecinos del barrio en donde reside ubicado en Barranquilla y a los compañeros de trabajo de su cónyuge. Hoy en día ella desea ampliar su inventario y la forma en la que los comercializa, es por ello que está aplicando una solicitud de crédito,  su primer credikiva financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para comprar un triciclo y así recorrer las calles de los barrios aledaños, así como surtir de pescado, carnes frías y yogurt, inversión que le permitirá incrementar sus ingresos y ofrecer un mejor nivel de vida a su familia.
texts.en: Karina, 44 years old, is a brave woman who, in the middle of a difficult situation because of her husband's illness--he suffered an ischemic stroke, had to take the reins to sustain her four children and her husband's medical bills. Fortunately, her husband's friends supplied her some money to help her open her own business to help mitigate her painful situation. Karina decided to invest in frozen meats, fish, and yogurt because they are widely consumed products. She sells them to her neighbors in Barranquilla and to her husbands coworkers. Today, Karina wishes to expand her inventory and the way she sells it. For this reason, she is applying for her first Kiva loan through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo to buy a tricycle so that she can travel neighboring roads to supply fish, frozen meat, and yogurt. This investment will allow her to increase her income and offer her family a higher quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a tricycle to ride through the neighboring streets to supply fish, frozen meats, and yogurt.

loans.name: Tahira

texts.en:
Tahira is at the age of 45, mother of four children, and living in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother. She has to look after her young baby, old parents, and the sibling of his husband. She wants to purchase a separate house for her family in which she can feel ease and relaxation, but her husband’s job is unsatisfactory for getting high income.

She wants to help her husband in the growth of the business. Her husband owns a medical store in which he sells types of medicines. His medical store is near a medical clinic and most of the customers are referred by the doctor of that clinic. 

Most of the medicines are unavailable due to high cost. Tahira knows that her husband can earn maximum profit if he offers these missing medicines,  therefore, she has requested a loan for her husband. She hopes that her husband would be able to buy medicine so that he can earn maximum profit.
 
Tahira hopes that through the profit amount she will be able to buy a new house soon.

loans.use: to buy various stocks of medicines for her husband's medical store.

loans.name: Ma. Ann

texts.en:
Ma. Ann is a 30-year-old married woman from Alcantara, Cebu. She has three grown-up children. Ma. Ann is engaged in tricycle transport business with her husband.

For the past six years, this business has provided the income that they need. Now, Ma. Ann wants to take out a loan to buy motor oil and tires, and pay for vulcanizing and school fees for her three children, ages 7, 9 and 11. With this, they will be able to transport more passengers, thus augmenting their daily earnings. 

Ma. Ann hopes of making their business profitable and sustainable in the future.

loans.use: to buy motor oil and tires, and pay for vulcanizing and school fees.

loans.name: Luis Fernando

texts.es:
Luis de 38 años de edad, vive con sus padres a quien les ayuda económicamente. El es un hombre que trabaja en la agricultura, sin horario alguno, el se dedica a este trabajo hace 6 años atrás, que requiere de mucha dedicación y esfuerzo. El dinero que genera esta actividad es su único ingreso.
Don Luis solicita el crédito para la compra de abono, así sus sembríos no se dañaran y podrá sacarlos al mercado y asi poder satisfacer las necesidades de su hogar.
texts.en:
38-year-old Luis lives with his parents, whom he helps economically. He is a man who works in agriculture, without any set schedule. For the past six years, he has made a living through this work, which requires a lot of dedication and effort. The money he makes through this job is his only income.

Luis is requesting this loan to purchase fertilizer, so that his seedlings won't be damaged and he will be able to take them to the market and provide his household's necessities.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for his plants

loans.name: Teddy

texts.en:
Teddy, aged 27, is a hardworking, married woman with two children living in Hoima, Uganda.

Teddy operates a restaurant mainly selling a variety of African dishes such as rice, potatoes and bananas among others. To her, cooking is a passion, and her customers are very proud of her.

In order to supplement her income, Teddy carries out farming, mainly cassava and beans. This also helps her to reduce her operational costs since sometimes she gets food from her farm to use in her restaurant.

Teddy's dream is to own a chain of restaurants across the country and to educate her children to university level. Teddy is seeking a loan to buy more utensils such as sauce pans, plates and cups for use in her restaurant business.

loans.use: to buy more utensils such as sauce pans, plates and cups for use in her restaurant business.

loans.name: Teopister

texts.en:
Teopister used the previous loan to buy tomato herbicides for her tomato garden. She is a farmer dealing in planting tomatoes and bananas on a large scale for commercial purpose. 

She is very thankful to kiva and kiva lenders who lent their support which allowed her to successfully develop her businesses. She gets good profits that she uses to pay for the loan, medical bills for her family, and school fees for her children. 

She is hoping to buy a lorry that will enable her to transport goods to the market very fast. However, weather changes and limited labor force are still a hindrance to her progress. Teopister is in need of another loan to buy land to grow more tomatoes and bananas.

loans.use: to buy land to grow more tomatoes and bananas.

loans.name: Grupo Los Comerciantes Del Caserio Los Morales Group

texts.es:
Antonio (el primero del lado derecho) es un gran hombre de 43 años de edad, él sabe que las cosas no vienen por si solas, si no uno tiene que buscarlas. Cuenta que está muy satisfecho con su crédito, pues a Dios gracias la inversión que realizo en su cultivo de verduras  fue de mucho beneficio para él y su familia. Antonio nuevamente tiene la necesidad de invertir en su cultivo pero en esta ocasión en la siembra de tomates por lo que requiere de un poco más de capital, el comprara con el préstamo semillas y fertilizantes.
Su gran sueño es fortalecer sus invernaderos de tomates para  mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Antonio (first from the right) is a wonderful, 43-year-old man. He knows that things don't happen by themselves -- a person has to work for them.

He says that he is very happy with his previous loan. Thanks to God, the investment that he made in his vegetable plants was a great help to him and his family.

Antonio again needs to invest in his crops, but this time in the sowing of tomatoes, which requires a little more capital. With the loan, he will buy seeds and fertilizers.

His big dream is to reinforce his greenhouses for the tomatoes, in order to improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy tomato seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Erick

texts.en:
Erick is a 32-year-old resident of Kagadi, Uganda, buying and selling produce and local brew. He also does farming for additional income, a business he started in 2001, with an aim of making money to be used to look after his family’s increasing demands.

He wishes to achieve his greatest desire of educating his children to university despite the hardship of heavy rains that hinder his service delivery. His other dream is to buy a vehicle to help ease the transportation of produce.

He will use the loan to buy stock of maize for selling.

loans.use: to buy stock of maize for selling.

loans.name: Ceferino

texts.es:
El Sr. Ceferino es de la ciudad de Encarnación, él se dedica a la producción y venta de bollos, churros, y otras masas dulces, que vende por las despensas de su barrio.
Él es una persona muy trabajadora que se esfuerza para poder crecer y ser alguien en la vida, hace más de 10 años que se dedica a este trabajo con la ayuda de su esposa.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en el arreglo de su vivienda, ya que allí hace sus masas dulces y necesita una mejor infraestructura para poder seguir cumpliendo con el pedido de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Ceferino is from the city Encarnación. He makes a living by making and selling rolls, churros, and other sweet breads, which he sells in his neighborhood's shops.

He is a very hardworking person who makes an effort to grow and to be someone in life. For more than 10 years, he has worked in this business with the help of his wife.

He is requesting this loan to invest in the renovation of his home, because he makes the baked goods there. He needs a better infrastructure to continue fulfilling his customers' requests.

loans.use: to fix up his house in order to continue making baked goods

loans.name: Yasinta

texts.en:
Yasinta is a 40-year-old hardworking, married lady charged with the responsibility of taking care of three children who all attend school in Hoima, Uganda.

Yasinta ventured into selling salt, cooking oil, and sugar among other items on a retail basis to raise her income to support her family. On realizing a need to increase her income further, Yasinta ventured into the farming of maize and this has yielded her extra income.

Yasinta is requesting a loan to buy more stock items such as sugar, salt and soap to sell.

Despite the challenges of limited capital, her dreams are to educate her children up to the degree level as well as to open up new retail outlets in the neighbouring trading centres.

loans.use: to buy more stock items such as sugar, salt and soap to sell.

loans.name: Nelson

texts.en:
At 48, Nelson has a transportation service as his main source of income. He has been in this business for approximately five years. His tireless endeavour continues because of his three kids.

Nelson asks assistance for an amount from GDMPC micro-finance needed to pay for the labour costs to repair his motorcycle. This will enable him to continue transporting his passengers and give them good service. He firmly hopes to improve his business soon.

loans.use: to pay for the labour cost for motorcycle repair.

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en:
Parveen is a 48-year-old woman, living with her two children and spouse in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.

Parveen's husband has been driving a rickshaw for many years. It has been depreciating with the passage of time, so he sold his old rickshaw and wants to buy a new rickshaw. He belongs to an ultra poor family and has to feed his children. Now his children are growing older and their needs have increased as well.

Parveen has been making savings to buy a new auto rickshaw for her husband, but at the time of purchase, she was short some money. Therefore, she has requested a loan for her husband so that he can buy a new auto rickshaw with the contribution of her savings.

Parveen hopes that now her husband will be able to generate more income. She has been very happy since taking this loan. She thanks Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy an auto rickshaw for her husband's transportation services.

loans.name: San Juan Group

texts.es:
El grupo de nombre San Juan, está en su ciclo 11 del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, son mujeres muy trabajadoras y luchadoras que se esfuerzan por poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de sus seres queridos.
Una de las que integra este grupo es la Sra. Lucinda, una persona muy trabajadora que se esfuerza todos los días desde muy tempranas horas del día, y hasta muy entrada la noche. Comenta que se ha podido formar muy Buena clientela, y es por ello que le esta yendo muy bien en su negocio. A través de las capacitaciones ha podido mejorar sus condiciones de vida y dar a su familia todo lo que ella no pudo tener.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar insumos para su despensa, como ser bebidas, carnes, frutas, lácteos, panificados y otros, y de esa forma seguir cumpliendo con los pedidos de sus clientes. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder ser alguien en la vida y mejorar su humilde emprendimiento.
texts.en:
The group called "San Juan' is in their 11th loan cycle with the Poverty Stoplight program. They are
hard-working women and fighters who strive to be able to improve their living conditions and that of their loved ones.

One of the members is Lucinda. She is a very hard-working person who makes an effort from very early in the morning until late at night. She comments that she has been able to form a good clientele and so her business is going well. Through the training she has improved her living conditions and provide her family with everything she could not have.

She is requesting this loan to buy supplies for her store such as drinks, meat, fruit, dairy products, bakery goods and others and in this way continue to fill her clients orders. She is grateful for the opportunity she is receiving to be someone in life and improve her humble undertaking.

loans.use: to buy drinks, meat, fruit, dairy products, bakery goods and other supplies to stock her store.

loans.name: Leydi Noemi

texts.en: Leydi Noemi is a single mother of a young boy. She has worked hard throughout her life and she has managed to build her own retail business where she sells clothing and footwear. She's an honest and hardworking individual.  She is requesting a credit to SGS for providing a decent household for her newborn and herself.

loans.use: To make house improvements to provide her child a better home.

loans.name: Anibal De Jesus

texts.es:
Aníbal es un hombre de 52 años de edad que se encuentra construyendo un sueño de tener un negocio propio. Inicio con un negocio de restaurante ya que quería prosperar con su familia y ofrecer a sus hijos un mejor futuro a sus hijos de 8 y 17 años de edad. Apuesta por el emprendimiento dado que su objetivo es dejarles una buena herencia a sus hijos y en el caso de que él llegue a faltar puedan tener un negocio para mantenerse.
Aníbal quiere solicitar un préstamo para mejorar su local comercial, invertiría  el dinero en la compra de sillas, mesas, enseres, aviso para el negocio, diseño e impresión de las cartas, surtido de comida y refrescos.
texts.en:
Aníbal is a 52 year old man that is building his dream of owning a business. He began his restaurant business because he wanted to prosper with his family, and to offer his 8 and 17-year-old children a better future.

He is betting on this venture, since the goal is to leave a good legacy for his children. And in the event that he passes away, they can have a business to run. 

Aníbal would like to request a loan to improve his shop. He will invest the money in the purchase of chairs, tables, utensils, business advice, design and printing of the menus, and an assortment of food and drinks.

loans.use: to buy chairs, tables, utensils and business advice.

loans.name: Bermet

texts.ru: Бермет, 70 лет, она мать-героиня 9 детей. У нее среднее образование, по характеру, ответственная, трудолюбивая, старательная. Бермет с молодости занимается сельским хозяйством. Благодаря упорному труду, ее деятельность приносит около 12,000 сом (KGS) в месяц. В хозяйстве есть 2 коровы, 2 лошади, 4 теленка, 20 овец. Дети во всем помогают Бермет по хозяйству. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Бермет обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дойной коровы для увеличения объемов реализации экологически-чистого молока. Доходы от кредита Бермет планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение своего бизнеса и хочет накопить на покупку приданного для младшей дочери.
texts.en:
Bermet is 70 and she has had nine children.  She is a Mother Heroine [honorary title awarded in the Soviet Union for bearing and raising a large family].  She has a secondary education and, by nature, she is responsible, hardworking and industrious.  She's been involved in animal husbandry since her youth.  Thanks to her very hard work, her farming business now brings about 12,000 som (KGS) per month.  She currently has two cows, two horses, four calves and 20 sheep on her farm.  Her children help her with all aspects of the farm work.

Eager to further grow her business, Bermet has turned to Kiva's partner, Bai Tushum, and requested a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) to buy a dairy cow.  Thanks to this purchase she will be able to sell larger volumes of organic milk.  She is planning to use the earnings from her loan to further grow her business.  She also wants to save some money to buy a dowry for her youngest daughter.

loans.use: to purchase one dairy cow in order to sell larger volumes of organic milk.

loans.name: Ganjina

texts.en:
Ganjina was born in 1996. She is single and lives with her parents. Ganjina studies at the university, which is located in the capital of Tajikistan. Ganjina is a student of the 2nd year. 

She is a very kind girl, and many of her classmates like her. She always helps her classmates. Ganjina is asking for a loan because her parents have no money to pay for her university tuition. She is asking for a loan of 7,500 TJS to pay for university tuition. In the future, she dreams to be a good specialist.

loans.use: to pay for university tuition

loans.name: Rozzette

texts.en:
Rozzette is a married woman with two children who operates a retail shop in Hoima-Uganda. For extra income, she carries out farming of cassava. 

On realizing the need of complementing her husband’s meager earnings, she ventured into business in 2013 to generate more income, and she is very happy with the results. 

High rental fees and price fluation affect her earnings, while her desire is to have a well-stocked business in town that will satisfy the demands of her customers. Rozzette is requesting a loan to buy stock items such as salt, sugar and soap to sell.

loans.use: to buy stock items such as salt, sugar and soap to sell.

loans.name: Maha

texts.en:
Maha was born in 1990. She has an elementary level of education and is a married mother of two children. Her husband is a mechanic, but his income is not good enough to cover all of their family’s needs, so she decided to stand beside him and work in order to provide her family a suitable life.

She opened two years ago her retail shop where she sells detergents, stationary, canned food, etc.. She is now well-known among her region. Today, she is acquiring a Youth loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to increase her business merchandise with stationary items to satisfy her customers' needs during school season.

Maha hopes to expand her business more in the future to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to increase her merchandise with stationary to satisfy her customers' needs during school season

loans.name: Shedrack

texts.en:
Shadrack is 37 years old and deals with African print and ready to wear clothes in Voi, Kenya. He is a father of one, and the spouse provides additional income. For the last six years, he has been in this business doing well.

This is his first time borrowing from VisionFund Kenya to finance his business. He will use the loan to purchase Africa print clothes for resale and the anticipated profit to repay his loan. He hopes to own a wholesale for the clothes in future.

loans.use: to purchase Africa print clothes for resale

loans.name: Karimu

texts.en:
Karimu aged 38 years is a father of 6 children of whom 3 attend school living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. He owns a cocoa plantation where he gets income to earn a living and support his family. 

He is hardworking and determined to become a leading cocoa trader in his area. He also buys started cocoa from other farmers to supplement his harvest to get additional income. 

Karimu is faced with a challenge of inadequate capital to finance his business. He has decided to ask for a loan so as to boost his business by buying more cocoa for resale.

loans.use: to buy cocoa for resale

loans.name: Valetino

texts.en:
Valetino is requesting another loan of 3,000,000 UGX to buy cocoa for selling. He is married with six children. He lives in Bundibugyo, Uganda, and has dealt in cocoa farming and selling to raise income for family support since 2000. 

He sells to cocoa companies who have agents in their area. His main challenge is limited capital to expand and own a bigger store as his business dream, but he hopes to improve his cocoa gardens and cocoa business in the future, and also to educate his children using the proceeds.  

He used the previous loan well to buy cocoa to sell, and this gives him the urge to continue the same line of business.

loans.use: to buy cocoa for selling.

loans.name: Elmira

texts.ru: Элмира, 52 года, замужем и имеет 3 детей. Семья с удовольствием помогает по хозяйству. В поисках источника дохода для своей семьи, в 1998 году Элмира начала заниматься полеводством и животноводством. Стартовав с 10,000 сомов (KGS), на сегодняшний день ее хозяйство приносит ежемесячную прибыль в сумме 11,000 сомов (KGS). В хозяйстве содержит: 8 коров, 21 овцу и 4 лошади. Также имеет 2,25 Га земельного надела, где в основном выращивает - люцерну, пшеницу, ячмень. Для дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Элмира обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 60,000 сом (KGS) на закупку овец для откорма и перепродажи. Доходы от кредита Элмира планирует использовать для развития бизнеса.
texts.en:
Elmira is 52, married, and the mother of three children.  The entire family gladly helps her with her farming business. As she was looking for a source of income for her family in 1998, Elmira became involved in agriculture and animal husbandry. Having started her business with an initial capital of 10,000 som (KGS), she now makes a monthly income of 11,000 som (KGS).  She has eight cows, 21 sheep and four horses, and she grows mostly alfalfa, wheat, and barley on 2.25 hectares of land.

In order to further develop her business, Elmira has turned to Kiva's partner, Bai Tushum Bank, and requested a loan of 60,000 som (KGS) to buy a few sheep for fattening and resale.  She is planning to use the earnings from her loan to grow her farming business.

loans.use: to purchase additional sheep for fattening and resale

loans.name: Maria Adelaida

texts.es:
Imponente sería la mejor característica que describe a María, una ganadera del sector de bello, la cual inició su profesión buscando su independencia económica y aprendió todo de su marido.
