Ella es madre de familia, tiene un pequeño de tres años de edad su principal objetivo es pagar su educación y comprar una vivienda para sus padres, una que sea con su esfuerzo y frutos de su negocio, por ello se empeña tanto en hacer las cosas bien y crecer en un mundo donde los hombres dominan el mercado.
María quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra de 3 terneras, ya que tiene un campo disponible que puede aprovechar con más animales para aumentar su producción.
texts.en:
Impressive is the best word to describe María, a rancher from the Del Bello area. She started in her profession seeking her financial independence and she learned from her husband.

She is a wife and mother and she has a three year old. Her main objective is to pay for her child's education and buy a house for her parents with her efforts and hard work. That is why she works so hard to do things well and grow in a world where men dominate the market.

María wants to ask for a loan to buy three heifers, because she has an available field that she can use and for more animals to increase production.

loans.use: to buy three heifers.

loans.name: Gulzhan

texts.ru: Гулжан, 53 года, замужем, есть 3 сыновей. У Гулжан средне-специальное образование, она занимается сельским хозяйством. У Гулжан есть 4 коровы, 18 овец и лошадь, также есть фруктовый сад. Ежемесячный доход составляет 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Гулжан обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 40,000 сом (KGS) на увеличение поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Гулжан планирует вложить в дальнейшее расширение ее бизнеса.
texts.en: Gulzhan is 53, married, and the mother of three sons.  She has a specialized secondary education and is involved in agriculture.  She has four cows and 18 sheep, as well as a fruit orchard.  She makes a monthly income of 10,000 som (KGS).  In order to further develop her farming business, she has turned to Kiva's Partner, Bai Tushum Bank, and requested a loan of 40,000 som (KGS) to increase her livestock headcount.  She is planning to use the earnings from her loan to further expand her business.

loans.use: to buy some livestock in order to increase the size of her herd.

loans.name: Dasmi's Group

texts.en:
Dasmi, 34, is standing to the right-hand side in the photograph. She is a differently abled lady.

She has been engaged in goat rearing for the last one year. She spends fours hours a day in goat rearing as part of her livelihood to supplement the earnings of her husband, who is a businessman. They have a 2-year-old daughter who means the world to both of them.

The family lives in a village of Mayurbhanj district, Odisha, India, with no access to closed toilets or a drinking water source in proximity.

With her experience and her determination, Dasmi has decided to scale up her business by buying more goats so that she can earn better and provide a better life to her family. For this reason, she, along with her fellow group member, is requesting a loan of 30,000 INR. She is looking for your kind hearts to help her buy goats so that she can scale up her business as well as her family’s standard of living and happiness.

loans.use: to scale up her business by buying more goats.

loans.name: Loan

texts.en:
Mrs. Loan is 27 years old and she is married. She has been operating a food stall selling fruit for five years.

Her family is a low-income household in the village; moreover, the market need is low in this region.

The main hardship that she faces is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase more fresh fruit to resell. She used the loan buy more kind of fruits and expand her business. Since then, her income has been increased significantly.

In the future, she hopes to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business, to travel for vacation within the country, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase more fresh fruit to resell.

loans.name: Rafeef

texts.en:
Rafeef is a married woman and a mother of four children. She lives in a village near Nablus city.

She is ill, and she needs support in order to get the treatment she needs to go about her daily life. She doesn’t have the costs of the surgery because her husband doesn't have enough money. She wants to get ahead and show that she can make it on her own, but in order to do so she needs to get healthy.

That’s why she has asked for a loan of $1,000 to cover her surgery, and then she can walk better.

Rafeef is very grateful for Kiva’s partner Alibdaa.

loans.use: to pay for treatment, knee surgery, and medicine.

loans.name: Alex

texts.en:
Alex is a 27-year-barber at Voi, Kenya. He is a father of one whose wife provides additional income. He has been in this business for the last one year, doing great.

This is Alex's first borrowing from VisionFund Kenya to finance his business. He will use the loan to purchase a shaving kit, cotton wool and disinfectants, and the anticipated profit to open a salon in his barber shop.

Alex hopes to be financially stable in the future.

loans.use: to purchase a shaving kit, cotton wool and disinfectants.

loans.name: Loi

texts.en:
Mrs. Loi is 55 years old. She lives in her own house with her husband and two children. She has had a business of selling meat patties for 20 years. She has a good customer base, so she sells her food at a good price. With her earnings she covers some of her living costs.

She is requesting a loan which will allow her to buy more meat, oil, and spices, among other ingredients. This way she will be able to continue with her work to have better earnings.

loans.use: to buy more meat, oil, and spices, among other ingredients.

loans.name: Japheth

texts.en:
Japhet is a 27-year-old retail shop proprietor in Voi, Kenya. He is a father of one and has been in this business for the last one year doing well.

This is the first time he is borrowing from VisionFund Kenya to finance his business. He will use the loan to purchase sugar, milk, tea leaves, loaves of bread and washing detergents for resale. The anticipated profit he will use to repay his loan and expand his milk parlor. He hopes to own a big milk depot in future.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, milk, tea leaves, loaves of bread and washing detergents

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margret is a repeat client from Namungo in Mityana, Uganda.  She’s an agriculturalist that has been growing cassava since 1994.  She is also a teacher.

Margret is applying for a loan of 400,000 UGX to improve her working capital and overcome the challenge of drought.  She will use the loan to increase her crop yields by buying improved cassava stems and hiring labor to assist with her banana plantation.

Margret appreciates the support of the Kiva funders in partnership with UGAFODE.  Pictured is Margret(right) her daughter(left) and the UGAFODE Credit staff.

loans.use: to buy improved cassava plants and hire labor.

loans.name: Maputo Vijibweni Group

texts.en:
Amina, in her early 50’s, has been running a food business commonly known as a mamalishe. She works from 8 am to 2 pm every day and is able to make a good profit each month. Through hard work, she managed to earn enough to pay school fees for children and household expenses.

This is Amina’s fist loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. Her dream is to own a big business. Amina will use this loan to buy food cooking ingredients for her mamalishe business. Amina will share this loan with her loan group "Maputo Vijibweni”, which consists of 11 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy food cooking ingredients for her mamalishe business.

loans.name: Jorge Isacc

texts.es:
Isaac es un joven de 33 años de edad, actualmente vive en compañía de su madre y su pequeño hijo de 6 años, estudia la carrera de arquitectura encontrándose por finalizar sus estudios con 16 clases aun restantes.
Trabaja de manera independiente como contratista de remodelaciones para oficinas, proveedor de mobiliario y todo lo referente al acondicionamiento laboral.
Su amor por el diseño y la arquitectura, van de la mano con sus cualidades mas destacadas, ya que le apasiona el diseño y la construcción.
Su motivación es seguir desempeñándose en su área de trabajo que esta sumamente relacionada a su carrera, que le ha permitido adquirir muchas experiencias en el campo técnico. 
Su principal meta en la vida es contribuir al desarrollo de su país y poder brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su madre y a su pequeño hijo de 6 años, dese ser el mejor ejemplo y un padre ejemplar.
Su mayor enseñanza de vida la ha adquirido en su empleo, ya que el poder trabajar para el mismo le ha generado oportunidades de trabajo con muchas personas empresarias que son emprendedoras, ya que el empeño y las ganas de luchar son su principal recomendación.
Desea graduarse y avanzar en sus conocimientos técnicos, poder diseñar sin ningún obstáculo de no tener un titulo universitario que lo respalde en cada trabajo a realizar, pero sobre todo seguirá manteniendo una imaginación creativa que de resultados e inspire a los demás.
texts.en:
Isaac is a young man of 33, and currently lives with his mother and his small six-year-old son. He is studying for a degree in architecture. He is about to complete his studies, with 16 classes still remaining.

He is self-employed as a renovation contractor for offices, supplying furniture and everything related to fitting up workplaces.

His love for design and architecture go hand in hand with his most prominent qualities, as he has a passionate interest in design and construction.

He is motivated to continue working in his occupation, which is highly related to his degree, and which has allowed him to acquire a great deal of experience in the technical field..

His main goal in life is to contribute to the development of his country and to be able to provide a better quality of life for his mother and his small 6-year-old son. He wants to be an exemplary father.

His greatest learning in life he has acquired through his employment, as being able to work for himself has generated work opportunities with many entrepreneurs. His effort and desire to strive for success are his main recommendation.

He wants to graduate, advance in his technical knowledge, and be able to design without obstacles due to not having a university diploma that will support him in each job he does. But above all he will continue maintaining a creative imagination that provides results and inspires others.

loans.use: to complete his university degree in architecture.

loans.name: Juan Ramiro

texts.es:
Juan es un hombre de 32 años de edad, soltero, sin hijos, y su negocio es la zapatería.
Él es emprendedor, decidido y constante. Su negocio lo realiza en la localidad ‘batallas’ distante a 60 km de la ciudad, área rural cercana al lago Titicaca.
Juan es morena de cabello gris y físico delgado. Su lengua materna es el Aymará y habla español, su vida la realiza en su casa de adobe que cuenta con energía eléctrica y agua de pozo. Su negocio es la zapatería, él se ocupa de arreglar zapatos como, cambio de taco, cambio de suela, arreglo de roturas y otros, “tengo 2 actividades una es a venta de ganado y mi zapatería…” comenta. la ventaja de sus actividades es que ambas son independientes, la desventaja es la falta de dinero para comprar herramientas de zapatería. Su sueño es mejorar sus negocios, el desea comprar una máquina de coser industrial y compra de ganado. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 6 años que se dedica a ambas actividades.
Es por esos motivos que Juan solicita un préstamo para comprar ganado y una máquina de coser industrial para sus 2 negocios.
texts.en:
Juan is 32 years old, single and has no children. He has a business making shoes.

Juan is enterprising, determined, and persevering. He works in Batallas, 60 kilometres from the city. Batallas is a rural area near Lake Titicaca.

Juan is thin, dark-skinned and has grey hair. His native language is Aymara but he also speaks Spanish. Juan lives in a house of adobe bricks that has electricity and water taken from a well.

Juan is a cobbler: he repairs shoes by, for example, changing the heel or sole, fixing rips, and more.

Juan says, "I have two jobs - one is raising cattle, the other is my cobbler's workshop."

The strong-point of Juan's trades is that he is independent. The disadvantage, however, is the lack of capital to buy tools for his cobbler's workshop.

Juan's dreams are to make improvements to his businesses: he wants to buy an industrial sewing machine and to buy cattle. This is Juan's first loan with Emprender in the six years that he has had both businesses.

For the above reasons, Juan is applying for a loan in order to buy an industrial sewing machine and to buy cattle for his two businesses.

loans.use: to buy cattle and an industrial sewing machine for two businesses.

loans.name: Abel

texts.fr:
45 ans, Abel est un père de famille très débrouillard et responsable. Sa priorité est le bien-être de sa femme et ses  deux enfants. Ces derniers sont tous scolarisés dans une école privée. 
Le couple travaille ensemble. Abel a commencé dans la vente des légumes et puis il n'a cessé de faire de l'extension, varier les marchandises à vendre. Il trouvait des marchés de charbons  de bois en 2013 et démarrait la vente. C'est sa femme qui tient le commerce de légumes et des volailles.
L' objectif est de commencer à construire sa maison l'année prochaine avec ses épargnes déjà constituées.
texts.en: Abel is 45 years, married and has children. He is a very resourceful and responsible family man. The well-being of his wife and two children is his priority. His children attend a private school. Abel and his wife work together. Abel started out by selling vegetables and then kept adding and diversifying his merchandise. In 2013, he found some charcoal markets and started selling charcoal. His wife is the one who sells vegetables and poultry now. Their goal is to start buidling a home next year using their savings so far.

loans.use: to buy bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Husniy

texts.ru: Хусния доброжелательная и молодая женщина, ей 39 лет. Она замужем и  у неё двое детей. Хусния живет вместе со своей семьёй в городе Истаравшан, она занята в малом бизнесе, фактически она покупает материал и вышивает из него национальные платья, которую продает на рынке. Всё что она зарабатывает, расходуется на содержание семьи. У неё нет возможности накопить денег для другие более перспективные цели. Хусния хочет увеличить свой оборот, так как  спрос на её продукцию повышается. Но у неё не хватает денежных средств, для этого она обратилась в ООО МДО Арванд за получением кредита  с целью расширения бизнеса. Она очень благодарна  ООО МДО "Арванд" за поддержку и доверие оказанную ей.
texts.en:
Husniy is a kindhearted young woman of 39. She is married and has two children. Husniy lives with her family in the city of Istaravshan.  She is involved in a small business.  She buys fabric and sews traditional Tajik dresses which she then resells at the market. Everything she earns goes toward looking after her family. She isn't able to save toward other, longer-term goals.

Husniy wants to increase her working capital since demand for her products is growing. But she doesn't have enough money for this so she has approached Arvand for a loan with which to grow her business. She is very thankful to Arvand for the support and for believing in her.

loans.use: for expanding the business

loans.name: Turgunbu

texts.ru: Тургунбу, 47 лет, в разводе, мать 2 детей. Тургунбу вот уже 11 лет работает в войсковой части, получая ежемесячную заработную плату в размере около 16,000 сом (KGS). Тургунбу обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 80,000 сом (KGS) на покупку строительных материалов для завершения строительства дома. На кредитные средства Тургунбу приобретет цемент, пескоблок, арматуры и прочие материалы. Свои доходы она планирует и дальше вкладывать в улучшение условий проживания ее семьи и свадьбу дочери.
texts.en:
Turgunbu is 47 years old, divorced, and has two children. Turgunbu has been working in a military unit for 11 years, receiving a monthly salary of about 16,000 som (KGS). 

Turgunbu has applied to Bai-Tushum Bank for a loan of 80,000 som (KGS) in order to buy building materials to finish her house constructions. Upon receiving the loan, Turgunbu will purchase cement, sand blocks, armatures, and other materials. 

She plans to channel her funds into further improving her family's living conditions, and also into her daughter's wedding.

loans.use: to purchase cement, sand blocks, armatures and other materials for her house building.

loans.name: Aimolmol

texts.ru: Аймолмол, 24 года, замужем, детей нет. Аймолмол в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи занимается животноводством и полеводством, супруг помогает по хозяйству. Благодаря упорному труду Аймолмол, на сегодняшний день у нее есть 5 коров, лошадь и 6 овец. На 2,0 Га земли выращивает подсолнечник и клевер. Ежемесячный доход составляет до 22,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Аймолмол обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 2 коров и 10 овец. Доходы от кредита Аймолмол планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие своего бизнеса.
texts.en: Aimolmol is 24 years old, married, and has no children. Aimolmol rears animals and grows crops as the main source of income for her family. Her husband helps her on the farm. Thanks to Aimolmol's hard work, today she has five cows, a horse and six sheep. She grows sunflowers and clover on 2.0 hectares of land. Her monthly income is up to 22,000 som (KGS). In order to develop her business further, Aimolmol has applied to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 150,000 som (KGS) to buy two cows and ten sheep. Aimolmol plans to invest the proceeds of the loan in the further development of her business.

loans.use: to purchase two cows and ten sheep in order to increase the size of her herd.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en: Emmanuel is 35 years old and a father of five children who lives in Bundibugyo, Uganda. He deals in buying and selling of cocoa and gets additional income from cocoa growing. Emmanuel also grows and sells foodstuffs like maize, cassava, and beans among others to get more income for the family. He works hard and has plans of educating his children, buying land and expanding his cocoa growing to increase his income. His main challenges are price changes, expensive labor, theft and inadequate capital for business expansion. With the requested loan, Emmanuel will be able to hire cocoa gardens to harvest and sell to cocoa companies.

loans.use: to rent cocoa gardens to harvest and sell to cocoa companies.

loans.name: Nur

texts.en:
Good day lenders! Meet one of KPP UMKM’s clients, Nur, who is 49 years old and married with two sons. Nur is a merchant and her husband has been a driver for 10 years. She has asked for a loan of IDR 7,200,000 from KPP-UMKM Syariah. This loan will be used to build sanitation at their home to improve access to sanitation and water sources for their family. Her family income is insufficient to build toilets and water sources but Nur will be able to repay the loan received.
She and her family want to live a healthy life with healthy sanitation and clean water. She is very grateful for the opportunity and wants to thank to all lenders.

loans.use: to build a toilet at her home to improve access to sanitation and water sources for her family.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
As a single parent of six children, Edna works hard to support her family.

She has a pottery-making business in the Philippines and earns additional income from pig fattening. Edna is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy clay, sand and other materials for her business.

Edna has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy clay, sand and other materials for her business

loans.name: Urmatbek

texts.ru: Урматбек, 39 лет, женат, отец 2 сыновей и дочери. У Урматбека средне-специальное образование, работает учителем в школе, также, в качестве дополнительного дохода для своей семьи занимается сельским хозяйством. У Урматбека в хозяйстве есть 2 дойные коровы и теленок. На сегодняшний день деятельность приносит ежемесячную прибыль в сумме 10,000 сом (KGS). Для дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Урматбек обратился в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 35,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 5 овец для разведения и увеличение поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Урматбек планирует использовать для покупки коровы и ремонт дома.
texts.en: Urmatbek is 39, married, and has two sons and a daughter. He has a vocational education and is a teacher at the school. He also has a farm as a source of additional income. He has two dairy cows and a calf and earns 10,000 som (KGS) per month. In order to expand his business, Urmatbek applied for a loan of 35,000 som (KGS) with Bai Tushum Bank to buy five sheep for breeding and increasing his livestock headcount. Urmatbek plans to use the income from the loan to buy cows and repair his house.

loans.use: to buy sheep and increase his livestock headcount

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
Ana is a woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Ana is 20 years old now.

Ana has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 6,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy a variety of fish to sell.

Ana has been in this business for four years. In the future, Ana would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy a variety of fish to sell.

loans.name: Belmarie

texts.en:
Belmarie is 60 years old and married with five children. Belmarie works very hard to provide for them.

Belmarie runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, bread, shampoo, snack foods and other personal care products.

Belmarie has been in this business for four years.

In the future, Belmarie would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, bread, shampoo, snack foods and other personal care products

loans.name: Gamira

texts.ru: Гамира, упешно погасила свой кредит, использовав его по назначению. Она благодарна Фонду Кива и всем, кто помог ей в финансировании. В хозяйстве Гамиры на сегодняшний день есть 3 коровы, 8 овец. Ежемесячный доход составляет 22,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Гамира обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 130,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 5 бычков для откорма и перепродажи. Доходы от кредита Гамира хочет вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины и оплату обучения дочери в университете.
texts.en: Gamira successfully repaid her loan after using it for the intended purpose. She is grateful to Kiva and everyone who helped her with the financing. Gamira currently has three cows and eight sheep and earns 22,000 som (KGS) per month. In order to develop her farm, Gamira applied for a loan of 130,000 som (KGS) with Bai Tushum Bank to buy five young bulls for fattening and resale. She wants to use the income from the loan to invest in additional livestock and to pay for her daughter's university tuition.

loans.use: to purchase five steers for fattening and resale

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en:
Angelita is 38 years old and widowed with five children. With three of her children in school, Angelita works very hard to provide for them.

Angelita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like sugar, canned goods, beverages, home care products, and other groceries.

Angelita has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items.

In the future, Angelita would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like sugar, canned goods, beverages, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita is 50 years old, with one child. Anita works very hard to provide for them.

Anita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 23,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, junk foods, rice, beverages, etc.

Anita has been in this business for four years and sells a variety of items.

In the future, Anita would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, junk food, rice, and beverages

loans.name: Nargiza

texts.ru: Наргиза, 33 года, не замужем, мать 2 детей. У Наргизы среднее образование, она на пенсии, в качестве дохода для своей семьи на протяжении 13 лет занимается животноводством. Благодаря упорному труду и целеустремленности Наргизы, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется 3 коровы. дополнительно Наргиза летом подрабатывает на полях. Ежемесячная прибыль - 6,500 сом (KGS), этих средств не хватает на содержание семьи и воспитание детей. Поэтому в целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 40,000 сом (KGS) на покупку сена и корма для скота. Кредитные средства позволят инвестировать в бизнес и сохранить поголовье скота, приумножив доходы семьи.
texts.en: Nargiza is 33, not married, and a mother of two. She has a high school education, receives a pension, and has been raising livestock for the past 13 years to earn additional income for her family. Thanks to her hard work and dedication, she currently has three cows on her farm and earns 6,500 som (KGS) per month. This amount of money is not enough to support a family or raise children. Therefore, in order to expand her farm, she applied for a loan of 40,000 som (KGS) with Bai Tushum Bank to buy hay and feed for her livestock. The loan will help her invest in her business and keep her livestock, thus increasing her family's income.

loans.use: to buy livestock in order to increase her herd

loans.name: Wilson

texts.es:
Wilson es un joven emprendedor increíble a su corta edad encontró una oportunidad de salir adelante y monto un negocio de venta de productos de la canasta familiar, el cual lo hizo con un amigo muy cercano, juntos trabajaron para crecer el local, crecer en clientes, en mercancía hasta tener un negocio consolidado y auto sostenible.
Ahora Wilson quiere dar un paso grande en su vida personal, se encuentra solicitando un préstamo para comprar la parte del negocio a su amigo y el resto de capital en mercancía, un gran paso, espera recibir tu apoyo y quiere que seas parte de la historia de un joven que con sueños y ganas de trabajar ha logrado grandes logros.
texts.en:
Wilson is an incredible young entrepreneur who, at a young age, found an opportunity to get ahead and establish a business selling family pantry items, which he did with a very close friend. Together, they worked to grow the space and grow in customers and merchandise until they had a strong and self-sustaining business.

Now Wilson wants to take a big step in his personal life, he is asking for a loan to purchase his friend's share of the business and the rest of the capital is for merchandise. It is a big step, he wants to get your help and wants you to be part of the history of a young man who, with dreams and desire to work, has managed to do great things.

loans.use: to purchase his friend's share of the business and the rest of the capital is for merchandise.

loans.name: Orlando

texts.es:
(Una foto increíble), Hermoso es el paisaje que puede apreciar el señor Orlando todos los días, un agricultor nacido y criado en el campo, vive feliz en sus terrenos, comparte con su familia y a pesar de las dificultades, viven bien y no pasan necesidades.
Su principal objetivo en la vida es comprar una vivienda con su esfuerzo y sudor, por ello se encuentra buscando la manera de aumentar su producción, mejorar la operatividad y aumentar sus ingresos.
Orlando actualmente se encuentra solicitando un préstamo para la compra de abonos, riegos, e insumos agrícolas, para mantener e iniciar un nuevo cultivo.
texts.en:
(An incredible photo) The landscape that Orlando can appreciate every day is beautiful. He is a farmer born and raised in the countryside, he lives happily on his land, shares his life with his family, and despite the difficulties, they live well and don't want for anything.

His primary objective in life is to purchase a house with his efforts and sweat, for this he is seeking a way to increase his production, improve his efficiency and increase his income.

Orlando currently is asking for a loan to purchase manure and agricultural supplies and pay for irrigation to maintain and begin a new crop.

loans.use: to purchase manure and agricultural supplies, and pay for irrigation to maintain and begin a new crop.

loans.name: Cesar Rafael

texts.es:
Cesar es un padre amoroso, una persona carismática, luchadora y trabajadora, a sus 49 años de edad se encuentra soltero y desempleado, vive en una zona de inclusión social donde conseguir un empleo digno es difícil, pero esto no lo detiene, su vocación y deber como padre es generar el sustento a su pequeño de 6 años de edad, por eso sin quejarse, con una sonrisa en el rostro, con esperanza, con ilusión  con algo de temor, peor muy decidido, el señor Cesar quiere solicitar un apoyo económico para iniciar un negocio de fabricación de calzado.
Cuenta con algunos materiales y maquinaria para realizar la profesión, el apoyo será para la compra de materiales para elaborar el calzado.
texts.en:
Cesar is a loving father, a charismatic, determined and hard-working person who, at 49 years old, is single and unemployed. He lives in a social inclusion zone where it is difficult to find a dignified job, but this does not stop him. His vocation and duty as a father is to generate the support for his 6-year-old little one, so, without complaining, with a smile on his face, with hope and vision, and with some fear, but a lot of determination, Cesar wants to ask for a loan to begin a business making shoes.

He has some materials and machinery to do this work, the support will be to purchase the materials to make the shoes.

loans.use: to purchase materials to make shoes.

loans.name: Alvaro Javier

texts.es:
Alvaro se ha dedicado a la carpintería gran parte de su vida, pues desde muy temprana edad inició trabajando como empleado en algunas carpinterías y ebanisterías donde aprendió a realizar la actividad. Alvaro al ver que su negocio estaba muy mal remunerado decidió independizarse y montar su propio taller de carpintería donde gracias a la buena calidad de sus trabajos ha podido tener una gran cantidad de clientes. 
Trabaja con 2 empleados durante 6 horas todos los días.

Alvaro se encuentra soltero y no tiene hijos. Debido a que tiene dificultades de capital, Alvaro ha tenido que rechazar algunos pedidos de sus clientes por la poca capacidad para conseguir las materias primas necesarias. 

Con el ánimo de mejorar esta condición, Alvaro aspira a que un préstamo le brinde la posibilidad de acceder a la compra de materias primas como madera, pegante, clavos, entre otros, para la fabricación de grandes pedidos de sus clientes. 

Alvaro aspira que el préstamo le permita elaborar estos pedidos sin que se afecten sus ingresos mensuales. 

Además, Alvaro espera que el negocio le genere ingresos con los cuales pueda salir adelante.
texts.en:
Alvaro has worked in carpentry a large part of his life, since when he was very young he began working as an employee in some carpentry shops and furniture making shops where he learned to do the work. When Alvaro saw that his business paid very poorly, he decided to become independent and establish his own carpentry shop where, thanks to the good quality of his work, he has been able to have a large number of customers.

He works with 2 employees for 6 hours each day.

Alvaro is single and doesn't have any children. Due to having difficulties with capital, Alvaro has had to turn down some customers' orders due to his small capacity to get the necessary raw materials.

With the desire to improve this situation, Alvaro hopes that a loan will offer him the possibility to access the purchase of raw materials such as wood, adhesive, nails, and more, for his business to make his customers' large orders.

Alvaro hopes that the loan will allow him to make these orders without affecting his monthly income.

In addition, Alvaro hopes that the business will generate income with which he can get ahead.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials such as wood, adhesive, nails, and more, for his business.

loans.name: Gulnar

texts.ru: Гулнар, 39 лет, замужем, 4 детей. У Гулнар среднее образование, уже 10 лет в качестве основного дохода занимается сельским хозяйством. У нее в хозяйстве есть 2 коровы. Гулнар известна, как принципиальный, честный, порядочный и надежный человек. На сегодняшний день ее деятельность приносит ежемесячную прибыль в сумме 22,000 сом (KGS). Гулнар решила развить свою деятельность и обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS), который направит на покупку коровы с теленком. Доходы от кредита она планирует использовать для развития своего хозяйства и улучшение материального положения семьи.
texts.en: Gulnar is 39 years old, married, and has four children. Gulnar has a secondary education. She has been farming for ten years for her main income. She has two cows. Gulnar is known as a principled, honest, decent and reliable person. Today her business brings her a monthly profit of 22,000 som (KGS). Gulnar has decided to develop her business and has applied to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) which she will direct towards the purchase of a cow and calf. She plans to use the proceeds of the loan to develop her farm and improve her family's material situation.

loans.use: to buy a cow with calf in order to increase her herd.

loans.name: Yeis Paola

texts.es:
Yeis es una mujer soñadora, trabajadora, una mujer que cree en un mejor futuro, en que haciendo las cosas bien se pueden lograr los objetivos trazados, ella inició con un modesto negocio de venta de alimentos fritos, iba prestando capital y compro una pequeña vitrina, una pipeta de gas e insumos para mejorar su profesión, progresaba paso a paso, siempre llevaba una sonrisa en su rostro y sus clientes la buscaban mucho, su carisma y aseo la hizo ganadora.
Ahora está mujer que empezó a soñar está a punto de dar un paso, pues se encuentra solicitando un préstamo que le permitirá crecer, un dinero para comprar una estufa de 4 puesto para cocinar mayor cantidad de alimentos, también parte del dinero será para reparar y adecuar su cocina.
texts.en:
Yeis is a visionary, hard-working woman, a woman who believes in a better future, that by doing things well, one can achieve established goals. She began with a modest business selling fried foods, she borrowed capital and purchased a small display case, a gas cylinder and supplies to improve her profession, she progressed step by step, always with a smile on her face and her customers sought her out a lot, her charisma and cleanliness made her a winner.

Now, this woman who began to dream is at the point of taking a step, since she is asking for a loan that will allow her to grow, money to purchase a 4-burner stove to cook a larger quantity of food, and also part of the money will be to repair and outfit her kitchen.

loans.use: to purchase a stove with 4 burners and supplies.

loans.name: Cirila

texts.en:
Cirila, 54, is a widowed woman with five children, three of whom are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Cirila has a food-vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 15 years.

Cirila requested a PHP 11,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food-vending business such as vegetables, spices, fish, meat, etc.

In the future, Cirila would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food-vending business such as vegetables, spices, fish, meat, etc.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 49 years old, married and has two children.

Gina is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines.

Gina requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig.

Gina has been in this business for three years now, and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Gina would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig.

loans.name: Ariane

texts.en:
Ariane, 31, is a married woman with three children, two of whom are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Ariane has a food-vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for two years

Ariane requested a PHP 8,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food vending such as spices, vegetables, fish, etc.

In the future, Ariane would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food vending such as spices, vegetables, fish, etc.

loans.name: Azenith

texts.en:
Azenith is 32 years old and widowed with three children, who are all in school. Azenith works very hard to provide for them.

Azenith runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items.

Azenith requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, snack foods, home care products, and other groceries.

In the future, Azenith would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, snack foods, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Belen

texts.en:
Belen, 55, is a married woman with four children, two of whom are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Belen has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years.

Belen requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy variety of fish to sell.

In the future, Belen would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy a variety of fish to sell.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is a married woman with one child. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Delia is 53 years old now.

Delia has a buy and sell firewood business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 10 years.

Delia requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more stock of firewood to sell.

In the future, Delia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock of firewood to sell.

loans.name: Norma Luz

texts.es:
Norma es una persona carismática, inteligente, una mujer que a pesar de no haber tenido una formación escolar, tiene una mentalidad ganadora, ganas de salir adelante y luchar por su familia.
Norma siempre se había desempeñado como madre cabeza de familia, ahora que sus hijos mayores de edad, puede dedicarse a crecer como empresaria, busca tener independencia economía, invertir en su hogar y construir un mejor futuro.
Normal vende helados, tiene su negocio ubicado en su hogar, poco a poco a crecido y se ha ganado el cariño de sus vecinos.
Como estrategia de crecimiento y consolidación la señora Norma busca un apoyo económico para comprar insumos, enseres recetas, y sabores de helados en grandes cantidades.
texts.en:
Norma is charismatic and intelligent. In spite of having no education, she has a winning mentality, and a desire to move forward and fight for her family.

Norma has always been the head of her family. Now that her children are adults, she can work to grow as a trader. She is looking for financial independence and to invest in her home and to build a better future.

Norma works selling ice creams. Her business is in her home. The business has grown gradually, and it has won the favour of her neighbours.

As part of her growth and consolidation strategy, Norma is applying for a loan in order to buy supplies, ktichen tools and ice cream of various flavours in bulk.

loans.use: to buy supplies, ktichen tools and ice cream of various flavours in bulk.

loans.name: Lien

texts.en: Mrs. Lien is 53 years old, married and has one child. She works hard to support her family. She needs loan to build a sanitation latrine to improve health of her family’s member and also for environment protection. Husbandry and fishing are the main income of her family and she is able to repay the loan monthly.

loans.use: to build a latrine to improve the health of her family.

loans.name: Srean's Group

texts.en:
Srean is a 43-year-old married mother of two children, one of whom (a daughter) depends on her. She and her husband support family’s living through growing rice and selling grocery items. They have been in farming business for 20 years. Lack of working capital is the main challenge to her farming. 
She is leading a group which comprises of three members to apply for loans from VisionFund. She is going to use her loan to buy organic fertilizer to improve her farmland. She dreams of earning more income to upgrade the living condition.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer to improve farmland so that she can get more income to upgrade the living condition.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Rani's Group

texts.en:
Raniaged 39 years, responsible mother of six children; her son has been running a tailoring shop for many years; he takes orders from boutique keepers and sews ladies clothes on order.
His shop is situated near his house in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. One of his brothers helps him with sewing the cloth. In this way; he is generating a little income for his family as well as helping his sibling. He belongs to the middle standard family, due to low earnings. He is unable to provide better living standard to his sibling and parents.

He has been facing tough times due to low income generated source; he can not do any other business because he he is not skillful in any other profession, so he decided to expand his current enterprise.

He does not want to sew the garments to order because the contractors criticize and find drawbacks in his completed shipments. He wants to buy his own fine cloth, a professional sewing machine and over-lock machine for sewing garments for direct selling to the retailers.
Therefore, RANI has requested a Kiva loan through BRAC Pakistan, so her son can buy an additional professional sewing machine, over-lock machine and cloth for sewing garments. She seems happy after receiving loan and thanks to Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy cloth, sewing machine and over-lock for her son's tailoring business.

loans.name: Sophay

texts.en:
Sophay, 60, who is a lovely mother of three children, one married, lives in Prey Chhor District, Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. 

So far, it is more than 20 years that she has been involved as a farmer which can earn a net profit of USD 2.5 per day. During this time, Sophay has been faced with a financial issue in her family which she still can’t afford. 
She decided to apply for a Kiva loan through HKL to open a new garment shop to expand her business to get more income. She would like to thank all the lenders for their generosity.

loans.use: to open a new garment shop to expand her business to get more income.

loans.name: Faith

texts.en: Faith, 34 years old and single. She comes from Poblacion 4, Clarin. She has been working very hard for 3 years selling fish to support her family. The microcredit from GDMPC enables her to develop her business to purchase additional fingerlings to triple her income. It may also serves as her gateway to hopefully achieve her plans to invest in her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional fingerlings for her fish aquarium to sell.

loans.name: Cindy

texts.en: Cindy runs a Sari-sari or variety store business, selling various goods and items to the people in her place, in Jagna, Bohol. Cindy is married and has three children who are still attending school, aged 11, 14 and 16. Cindy is asking for a loan to buy more stocks to sell like cvita health drinks, cooking oil, vinegar, soy sauce, salt, canned goods, diapers, coffee and biscuits. Through this, she will be able to improve her business as well as her income. Cindy dreams of expanding her store, saving money for the schooling of her children, and also of repaying her loan on time.

loans.use: to buy vita health drinks, cooking oil, vinegar, soy sauce, salt, canned goods, diapers, coffee and biscuits.

loans.name: Iyum

texts.en:
Iyum, is a 48-year-old married woman with five childs. Iyum and her husband have been selling ice for twenty years. She has asked for a loan of IDR 7.000,000 from KPP-UMKM Syariah. This loan will be used to build a toilet at their home to improve access to clean water and sanitation for their family. Her family income is insufficient to build toilets and water sources but Iyum will be able to repay the loan received.
She and her family want to live a healthy life with healthy sanitation and clean water. She is very grateful for the opportunity and wants to thank to all lenders.

loans.use: This loan will be used to build a toilet at their home to improve access to clean water and sanitation  for their family.

loans.name: Scovia

texts.en:
Scovia aged thirty six is an amazing single mother of five children living in Masindi,Uganda. After realizing that she could not handle her husband's violence and promiscuous behavior ,she decided to live a single life and take care of her children instead of exposing herself to health risks. The responsibility of looking after the children solely rests on her and she is very hardworking.

She rears cattle and her cattle gives her a lot of milk which she sells to restaurants and her neighbors. Her dreams are to educate her children up to the university and to own a very big farm for dairy production despite challenges of unpredictable weather changes and diseases .Scovia intends to use the loan to buy cows for rearing.

loans.use: to buy cows for rearing

loans.name: Benkadi N°2 Group

texts.fr:
SABINE  est la femme qui tient la corde du bélier en main sur la photo.
Elle est malienne , agée de 54 ans , mariée et mère de 2 enfant dont une fille et un garçon qui  sont âgées respectivement de 8 et 12 ans. Ils sont tous les 2  scolarisés. Elle est éleveuse depuis 7 ans et sont mari est cultivateur. Elle a des difficultés tel que le problème de financement , le moyen de déplacement pour aller acheter des aliment bétail. C’est pourquoi elle demande  un prêt au RMCR  pour pouvoir  améliorer  sont élevage en achetant  quelque moutons de plus et des aliment bétails. Elle achète ses bétails dans son village, les élève pendant quelque mois et les revend parfois sur les mêmes marché avec profit et ce profit  lui aidera à prendre quelques  charges  familiale.Elle rêve d’être une grande éleveuse et avoir beaucoup d’animaux d’espèce variable.
texts.en:
Sabine is the woman holding on to the rope attached to the ram in the photo. She is a Malian woman, who is 54 years old, married and mother to two children, a boy and a girl, who are eight and 12 years old respectively. The children are both at school.

Sabine has been raising animals for the past seven years and her husband is a farmer. They have difficulties such as financing and transport to go and buy food for the livestock, and it is for this reason she is requesting a loan from RMCR to be able to improve her animal-raising activity by buying several more sheep and food for her livestock. She gets her livestock in her village, raises them for several months and then resells them, sometimes in the same markets, at a profit. This profit helps her to cover some of the family expenses. She dreams of being a significant raiser of animals with a large quantity of diverse animals. T

loans.use: to buy sheep for resale.

loans.name: Rani Bibi

texts.en:
Rani bibi is a 45-year old married woman, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of three children.
She has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan for her husband's tailoring business. He is a tailor by profession and very expert in sewing fine dresses. He has been sewing cloths for many years. This is the reason he has lot experience about his profession.

His sewing machine has become out of order and need to be replacement with a new one but he does not have sufficient cash in hand to buy new sewing machine.
Therefore, Rani bibi has requested a loan, so that her husband can buy new professional sewing machine.

Her family has to do hard work to getting income for huge family; Rani bibi is very thankful to the Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a professional sewing machine for her husband's tailoring business.

loans.name: Marine

texts.en:
Marine is 42 years old and she lives with her husband in Kapan city of Syunik region. Marine has higher pedagogical education and already for many years has worked as a teacher of mathematics. Marine’s husband works at the private workshop. They have two pretty daughters and both of them are students.

Marine’s elder daughter studies at the Yerevan State University the faculty of International Relations. The smaller daughter studies at the Yerevan State Economical University the faculty of Finance. Both of them are studying at the paid division and it is very hard for Marine and her husband despite of being employed and doing savings on their everyday needs. This loan of 450.000 Armenian drams Marine asks as she must pay for her daughter’s tuition fees for the first semester and for this great help she harries to be thankful beforehand.

loans.use: to pay for her two daughter’s university fees for the first semester, one for a BA in International Relations and the other in Finance

loans.name: Imad Al-Deen

texts.en:
Imad Al-deen is a youth man live in Gaza strip also he works in the public sector, where the salary is very low and unstable. As a result of high cost of living, he decided to open new business. his business idea is to transport the goods and inventory between trader in the rickshaw.

A few years ago Imad Al-deen Bought a new rickshaw and become well known, also has loyal customer. Know Imad Al-deen took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to make some maintenance for his rickshaw. By taking this loan Imad Al-deen can be working more efficiently and increase his sales also his profit.

loans.use: to make some maintenance for his rickshaw,

loans.name: Annah

texts.en:
Annah is 42 years old, married, and has has nine children. She lives in Bundibugyo Uganda. 

She trades in cocoa, mainly buying and selling to agents and cocoa companies. She also gets additional income from selling cassava flower in the markets. 

She started the business to raise income for the family and pay school fees for the children. Her main challenge is limited capital. 

She hopes to expand the business, educate her children and support the family in getting basic needs. Annah used the first loan to pay school fees for her children,she is again asking for a second loan to continue paying school fees

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Nurtilek

texts.en:
Nurtilek says that he agrees with Benjamin Disraell’s saying that university should be a place of light, of liberty and of learning. Liberty is valued at AUCA. Freedom of speech, freedom in choising make AUCA more interesting to study here for Nurtilek. He likes AUCA due to its international atmosphere and educational system. He says that while studying here he will have a chance to meet new international friends, learn more about the world, different customs and traditions thanks to them, and get perfect Bachelor’s Degree in Business Administration.

According to Nurtilek’s words, AUCA’s BA Program is one of the top 1000 BA Programs in the world, in the top 5 in CIS and the best in Kyrgyzstan. He believes that this degree will open the gates of great opportunities and prospects for him in the future. He decided to enter BA Program to be able to start his own business in the future. Gained knowledge in Management, Marketing, Finance, Accounting and Business areas, will contribute to the development of Kyrgyzstan economy and provide new job-places for unemployed people.

Nurtilek is from Osh city, which is located in the South of Kyrgyzstan. He moved to Bishkek to realize his dreams and studying at AUCA is one of his hardest made decisions according to financial difficulties in his family.

loans.use: to pay for his higher education fees in the Business Administration Program at AUCA.

loans.name: Solo Voahangy

texts.fr:
55 ans, Solo Voahangy est mariée et le couple travaille ensemble pour une bonne gestion  de l'activité. Il s'agit d'un petit atelier d'ouvrage métallique. Solo voahangy cherche des marchés et clients et son mari assure l’exécution des travaux c'est à dire la fabrication. Le couple emploi quand même d'autres personnes pour aider monsieur dans la fabrication. Elle commençait en 2009. Avant (de 2007 au 2009), elle travaillait en tant que couturière dans une entreprise de confection de vêtement avec un très faible salaire. 
C'est une femme courageuse et persévérante. Elle envisage de développer  et étendre l'activité, construire d'autres maisons pour assurer la retraite du couple. Elle a trois enfants déjà mariés.
texts.en:
Solo Voahangy is 55 years old and married. The couple works together to manage their small metal work atelier. Solo Voahangy looks for markets and customers, while her husband carries out the work, that is to say the manufacturing. The couple does, however, employ other people to help out the husband with the manufacturing.

Solo Voahangy began doing this in 2009. Before (from 2007 to 2009) she worked as a seamstress in a clothes-making factory for a very low wage. She is a courageous and persevering woman and is planning to develop and extend the business, and also build other houses to ensure a good pension for the couple. She has three children who are already married.

loans.use: to buy iron: round, corner, flat, as well as posts.

loans.name: Amah

texts.en:
Amah is a 58-year-old married with one son. Amah has been selling snacks and her husband has been selling meat balls for five years. She has asked for a loan of IDR 7.200,000 from KPP-UMKM Syariah. This loan will be used to build a toilet at their home to improve access to sanitation and water source for their family. Her family income is insufficient to build toilets and water sources but Amah will be able to repay the loan received.
She and her family want to live a healthy life with healthy sanitation and clean water. She is very grateful for the opportunity and wants to thank to all lenders.

loans.use: this loan will be used to build a toilet at their home to improve access to sanitation and water source for their family.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is 43 years old, married and a father of three children. He has greatly benefited from the Hand in Hand Eastern Africa enterprise development training specifically on record keeping. 
He is currently practicing dairy and vegetable farming. He is borrowing Kiva loan so as to buy manure, fertilizers and a sheep. This will enable him diversify his farming for increased income to enable him pay school fees and also provide better clothing to his children.

David is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for the financial support.

loans.use: to buy manure, fertilizers and a sheep hence diversify farming for increased production and income to pay school fees and provide better clothing to his children.

loans.name: Nu

texts.en: Mrs. Nu, 48 years old,  is a hardworking woman and the mother of three children. They are the driving force of her life and the reason why she works so hard in her business. She specializes in cows, a job that she’s been doing for more than 20 years. She wants to stock up so she can increase her profits and let the business be more successful; that’s why she wants to buy two more calves that will let her increase her inputs to work. She wants to see her work be sustainable over time, so she’s willing to invest more in her business. Someday, she expects to pay for her children’ education because she believes that is the way to do better in life.

loans.use: to buy two more calves that will let her increase her inputs to work.

loans.name: Mavlyuda

texts.en: Mavlyuda was born in 1996. Mavlyuda is not married and she lives with her parents. She is a student of the first course Medical Collage. She is studying pharmacology.  Mavluda studies well. She also works in a pharmacy where her brother works also. She learns and helps her brother. Mavlyuda must pay for the university tuition and with this aim she is asking for a loan. She awaits your kindness..

loans.use: to pay for her university tuition leading to a BSc. in Pharmacology

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en:
Hussein is a 28-year-old married father of one child. Due to the low financial situations of his family, he left school at early age and started fourteen years ago working in installing air conditioners. He is trying hard to satisfy his family's needs and expenses.

Today, Hussein is acquiring a YOUTH loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to develop his business through buying a car which will help him move easily between his workshops. He hopes to expand his business more in the future to increase his income and provide his family with descent living conditions.

loans.use: to develop his business through buying a car which will help him move easily between his workshops

loans.name: Nzasa Group

texts.en:
Rahabu who is in her late 20s is married with no child. She has been a tailor for three years now. She works from 08am to 06pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be her 1st loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She will use this loan to buy materials to make good suits and dresses according to her customers' requirements. She dreams of owning a tailoring company with many tailors and many advanced machines.

Rahabu will share this loan with his loan group Nzasa which consists of two members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy materials to make good suits and dresses according to her customers' requirements.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Patricia is 40 years old. She is married and blessed with two children. Her business is farming and selling firewood. She has been in the business for two years. 


She earns a monthly income of eight thousand Kenya shillings. This is her fourth loan term with VisionFund Kenya. She will use the loan to purchase firewood for sale. 


She will use the profits from expanded business to service the loan as well as pay school fees for her children.  Her hopes and dreams are to be financially stable.

loans.use: to purchase firewood for sale.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine is also a repeat client having been appraised from Namungo village in Mityana. She rears pigs on a small scale that she sells to get income besides which she grows cassava and also operates a canteen. She is aged 40 years and married with six children. She is acquiring a loan of five hundred thousand to buy piglets that she will rear and sell when they have grown and produced many other piglets. She is hard working.

loans.use: to boost her piggery.

loans.name: Kyamazima Tweyimukye Group

texts.en:
Joseph is a member of Kyamazima Tweyimukye Group where members guarantee each other in order to borrow and make loan repayments. He deals in the sale of firewood and tea farming on a large scale that has increased his overall income at the end of the month. He faces challenges of high transport costs and low profits as a result of some customers delaying to pay him. However, he has future prospects of having a financially stable income to support his family.

Joseph has asked for a loan to help him buy firewood to sell. The extra person in the photo is also a group member who has guaranteed his fellows but has not taken a loan at this time.

loans.use: to buy firewood to sell.

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is aged 65 a very hard working married man with 14 children who entirely depend on him for basic needs and all attend school in Hoima Uganda. He ventured into buying and selling of maize, beans and rice among other items. In order to supplement his incomes he rides a motor cycle for transport. He hopes to grow and expand his business the more only to be limited by in adequate capital and poor road net work. He is seeking for a loan facility to buy more beans and maize for sell.

loans.use: to buy more beans and maize for sell.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for the financial support that she used to buy animal feeds that increased milk production.  She was also able to add stock to her clothes selling business hence earned more income. With increased income, she was able to meet her family's basic needs at ease.

She is applying a second Kiva loan to further boost her farming by buying manure, fertilizers and certified seeds for more additional income.  This will enable her pay school fees for her children.

Mercy is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for the continued financial support.

loans.use: to buy manure, fertilizers and certified seeds hence further boost farming for increased income to pay children's school fees.

loans.name: Benkan Group

texts.fr: BAKARY est le monsieur qui tient le mouton sur la photo. BAKARY est un malien âgé de 31 ans non scolarisé. Il est marié père de 04 enfants, 02 garçons et 02 filles. Les enfants sont âgés de 2 à 08 ans dont une(01) fille fréquente l’école. Sa femme est une ménagère. BAKARY fait recourt au RMCR pour pouvoir bien mener son activité d’élevage de mouton. Il mène cette activité depuis 6 ans. Cette  activité lui plait beaucoup. Il s’approvisionne sur les marchés environnants et revend dans le marché de sa localité.  Le profit qu’il gagne lui permettra de prendre en charge certaines dépenses  de sa famille. Il rencontre souvent des problèmes de mévente sur le marché et des ventes à crédit. Dans l’avenir, BAKARY veut avoir un prêt plus élevé pour pouvoir  acheter beaucoup de moutons afin de tirer un maximum de profit.
texts.en:
Bakary is the man holding on to the sheep in the photo. He is a Malian man who is 3I years old and uneducated. He is married and father to four children, two boys and two girls. The children's ages range from two to eight years old, and one of the girls attends school. His wife is a housewife.

Bakary is turning to RMCR so that he can carry out his sheep-raising activity well. He has been carrying out this activity for the past six years and he likes it very much. He gets his supplies in the surrounding markets and resells them in the market in his town. The profit he makes will enable him to cover some of his family's expenses. He often encounters the problems of a slump in sales at the market and sales made on credit. In the future he would like to have a more significant loan so he can buy a lot of sheep in order to make a maximum of profits.

loans.use: to buy sheep for resell.

loans.name: Fydia

texts.fr:
Fydia est une femme débrouillarde de 49 ans. Elle est mariée à un jardinier. Le couple a trois enfants de 15, 26 et 28 ans. Seul le dernier est à leur charge et scolarisé.
Elle dirige depuis 2012 une petite gargote et livre des repas (déjeuner) à des entreprises pour leurs personnels. Auparavant, elle exerçait d'autres activités, elle était couturière mais à cause d'une maladie, elle lui est interdit par son médecin de continuer cette activité.
Elle a déjà une maison et envisage de faire de l'extension. Elle voudrait donner en location pour augmenter son revenu. Le but de son travail acharné c'est pour assurer sa retraite car elle n'aura pas de pension et pour la continuité des études de son enfant pour qu'il réussisse.
texts.en:
Fydia is a resourceful woman, who is 49 years old. She is married to a gardener and the couple has three children, who are 15, 26 and 28 years old respectively. Only the youngest of the three children is still at home in their care and at school.

Fydia has been managing a small café since 2012 and she delivers meals (lunches) to companies for their staff. Beforehand, she had other activities; she was a seamstress, but because of an illness she was forbidden by her doctor to continue this activity. She already has a house and is planning to add an extension, which she would like to rent out to increase her income. The aim of her tireless work is to be able to ensure a good retirement, since she will not have a pension, and for her child to continue and successfully complete his studies.

loans.use: to buy a second-hand refrigerator, rice and table oil.

loans.name: Dukerebuke Group

texts.fr:
Janvier  fait partie du groupe  Dukerebuke et  habite à  Gitega. Il a 41 ans et est marié à Leila, une élève. Ensemble ils ont 2 enfants âgés de 2 à 3 ans.
Il a sous sa charge une sœur qui étudie qui étudie. 

Il fait le commerce des  habits  depuis  22 ans. 

Il est à son sixième   crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il  va  augmenter son capital et acheter beaucoup d’habits à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, il voudrait avoir une habitation décente, et voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Janvier belongs to the Dukerebuke group and lives in Gitega. He is 41 years old and married to Leila, who is a student. They have two children who are two and three years old respectively. He also has a sister in his care, who is studying.

Janvier has been selling clothes for the past 22 years and is on his sixth loan from Turame. With the Kiva loan he is granted he is going to increase his capital and buy a large quantity of clothes to resell and make more money. In the coming years he would like to have a decent home and see his children through school.

loans.use: to increase his capital and buy a large quantity of clothing to resell, so he can earn more money.

loans.name: Shohkarimi

texts.en:
Shohkarimi is a freshman in the Software Engineering Program at AUCA. He finished Haji Kemal Joint Tajik Turkish High School. His devotion to his academic studies sparkled there: he participated in the City and International Olympiads, held second place in the City English Language Olympiad and second place in the International Biology Olympiad, was actively involved in other school activities, participated in many projects, volunteering activities and competitions outside of school. His team got first place in a volleyball tournament among schools in his town. Involvement in all these activities didn’t have any negative impact on his academic achievements. Therefore, he strongly believes that he will be able to continue his studies with the same spirit while studying at the American University in Central Asia.

Shohkarimi has a family of five people: parents, two elder sisters and himself. He says that Tajikistan’s economy is so weak and his parents’ salaries are too low to support his family members and pay his tuition university fees. His parents are proud of him and understand that it is not easy to get admitted to a well-known university abroad. And they decided to support him in these undertakings. In order to fulfill Shohkarimi’s academic needs, he needs financial aid and he is happy to apply for a Kiva loan that is available just for AUCA students in Kyrgyzstan.

loans.use: to pay for his higher education in the Software Engineering Program at AUCA.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en: Ahmad is 33, married, and has one son and one daughter. He is financially responsible for his father and he has a small poultry farm in his house for ducks and chickens. He is requesting a 10,000 EGP loan to buy more ducks and chickens after preparing his place.

loans.use: To buy more ducks and chickens

loans.name: Maher

texts.en:
Maher is a 36-year-old married father of five.

Nineteen years ago, he started working as a barber to cover the increasing needs and expenses of his beloved children. He is a hard worker who has a good reputation among his region for his professional skills.

Maher's limited income is not enough to cover any additional expenses, and so today he is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner, Al Majmoua, to pay his children's school tuition fees. He believes that education is the only guarantor for his children's future.

Maher hopes to expand his business in the future to increase his income and improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to pay his children's school tuition fees

loans.name: Alexander Fredy

texts.es: Alexander  de 34 años de edad,  soltero y sin hijos, es una agradable estudiante de la facultad de Ingeniería Ambiental y Recursos Naturales, estudia mucho para alcanzar sus metas en la vida. Alexander  tiene la meta de culminar sus estudios de titulación con éxitos y poder ser un buen Ingeniero Ambiental y Recursos Naturales. Con el préstamo otorgado lo invertirá  para el pago de su titulación universitaria y  realizar la compra  de libros que necesite. Alexander  se encuentra muy agradecido  por la ayuda brindada y se despide con muchos deseos de culminar sus metas propuestas agradece a  kiva por la oportunidad brindada.
texts.en:
Alexander is 34 years old, single and has no children.  He is a likable student in the school of Environmental Engineering and Natural Resources, and he studies a lot to achieve his goals in life.   

Alexander's goal is to finish his university studies successfully and be able to be a good environmental and natural resource engineer.  He will use the loan to pay for his university degree and the books he needs.  Alexander is very grateful for the help, and says goodbye by saying he has the desire to meet the proposed goals. He thanks KIVA for providing the opportunity.

loans.use: to pay for his university title.

loans.name: Hector De Jesus

texts.es:
Héctor actualmente se encuentra solicitando un préstamo para pagar por la construcción de invernadero (ver foto), comprar semillas, abonos y riegos.
La razón del préstamo es que se encuentra buscando alternativas de cultivo ya que el bajo precio de venta de la producción ha afectado su economía.
Él es padre de 3 hijos, el mayor de 18 y las dos niñas menores de 16 y 14 años de edad, su propósito es trabajar para comprar una vivienda y vivir junto con su esposa e hijos bajo techo propio, aprendió la actividad de su padre pero todo lo que ha logrado ha sido fruto de su esfuerzo, nadie le ha dado nada.
Por tal motivo este trabajador hombre necesita de tu apoyo, no para salvar su cultivo, sino, para explorar otras alternativas que pueden ser muy beneficiosas económicamente hablando.
texts.en:
Héctor is currently requesting a loan to pay for the construction of a greenhouse, and buy seeds, compost, and irrigation supplies, the reason being that he is seeking alternatives to his cultivation as the low prices have affected his household economy.  

He is the father of 3 children.  The oldest is 18, and he has two daughters ages 16 and 14.  His goal is to work to buy a house and live with his wife and children under their own roof.  

He learned his trade from his father, but has achieved everything through the fruits of his labor, as no one has given him anything.   For this reason, this hard-working man needs your help, not to save his crops, but to explore other alternatives that could be more economically beneficial.

loans.use: to pay to construct a greenhouse, buy seeds, compost, and irrigation supplies.

loans.name: Joudi Group

texts.en:
Saturnina is the featured borrower of Joudi's group. She is the first one from the right with a green top. She, along with the other group members, has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner, Al Majmoua, and they have been friends since they came to Lebanon to earn a living.

Saturnina works as a housekeeper. She is a 58-year-old married woman and mother of four children. She has applied for a loan to pay for her children's school education fees.

As for the other group members, Gloria is the second from the right with a pink top, and her acquired loan will also be invested in paying for her children's school education fees.

Erlinda is the second from the left in the dress with colorful orange circles, and her acquired loan will also be invested in paying for her children's school education fees.

Judianne is the first from the left, and her acquired loan will be sent back to her family in the Philippines.

loans.use: to pay her children's school education fees.

loans.name: Anahit

texts.en:
Anahit from the Lori region is very thankful for her previous Kiva deal and she hopes very much to be supported again. She has higher pedagogical education and has been engaged in her beloved occupation for 39 years. She works at the school as a teacher of mathematics. After her school work, she also has a group of pupils to whom she gives paid private courses of mathematics and prepares them for their entrance exams. Anahit mentions that with the passing of years she becomes more and more devoted to her work, realizing the great and very responsible work managing each pedagogue.

Anahit is married and has a daughter who works as a journalist at the TV channel. Her husband is a driver. Anahit will be very thankful to receive this loan of 600,000 AMD as she wants to repair and make more comfortable the room where she works and gives courses to her pupils.

loans.use: to repair and make more comfortable the room where she works and gives courses to her pupils

loans.name: Kulmairam

texts.ru: Кулмайрам успешно погасила свой кредит, использовав его по назначению. Она благодарна Фонду Кива и всем, кто помог ей в финансировании. В хозяйстве Кулмайрам на сегодняшний день имеется 2 коровы, 25 овец. На 2,22 ГА собственной земельной доли, она выращивает фасоль, в саду выращивает фруктовые деревья для собственного потребления. На ежедневной основе продает молоко. Ежемесячная прибыль Кулмайрам - 25,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Кулмайрам вновь обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 60,000 сом (KGS) на покупку теленка и сбор урожая фасоли. Доходы от кредита Кулмайрам планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие своего бизнеса.
texts.en: Kulmairam successfully repaid her loan, having used it for its intended purpose. She is grateful to the Kiva fund and to everyone who helped to finance her. Today Kulmairam has two cows and 25 sheep. She grows beans on a 2.22 hectare plot of her own land, and she grows fruit trees in her garden for her own consumption. She sells milk on a daily basis. Kulmairam's monthly profit is 25,000 som (KGS). In order to develop her business further, Kulmairam has once again applied to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 60,000 som (KGS) to buy a calf and pay for her beans to be harvested. Kulmairam plans to invest the proceeds of the loan in the further development of her business.

loans.use: to buy a calf and to pay for the harvesting of her beans.

loans.name: Jorge Andrés

texts.es: Jorge es un microempresario de 21 años de edad, habitante de una localidad ubicada en la capital del país, él estuvo relacionado desde pequeño con el comercio de producto puesto que su familia por años se ha mantenido gracia a esta actividad y hace tres años se independizó e identificó su propia base de clientes a quienes ofrece prendas de vestir exterior e interior y ropa de cama. Su cadena de comercialización no se limita a su lugar de residencia, él vende sus productos al por mayor a familiares que residen en Pasto un municipio del departamento de Nariño. Sus pedidos se generan semanalmente y realiza sus compras a mayoristas de la ciudad. En la temporada que se avecina las ventas se incrementan y debe estar preparado con un mayor stock de productos, es por ello que está aplicando una solicitud de crédito,  su primer credikiva financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para comprar sabanas, edredones y prendas de vestir para damas y caballeros. Su principal meta es concluir sus estudios profesionales en licenciatura de lengua castellana y para continuar con su actividad comercial desearía poder tener un local en un centro comercial de la ciudad.
texts.en:
Jorge is 21 years old and a small time trader. He lives in Bogota, Colombia's capital.

From a young age, Jorge has been involved in business as, for years, his family has supported itself through trade. Three years ago, Jorge went independent and found his own customer base to whom he sells clothes and underwear, and bed clothes. He does not just sell at home but also in bulk to relatives living in Pasto, a town in the southern department of Nariño.

Jorge receives weekly orders, and makes his purchases at Bogota's wholesalers.

Sales will increase over the next season and Jorge must be prepared with more stock. He is therefore applying for a loan, his first Kiva loan through Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo. He will use this loan to buy bed sheets, quilts, and men's and women's clothing.

Jorge's main goal is to finish his studies in Spanish and to continue with his trade. He would also like to have premises at a shopping centre in the city.

loans.use: to buy bed sheets, quilts, and men's and women's clothing.

loans.name: Sophiko

texts.en:
Sophiko is a 30-year-old married woman. She lives in the Telavi district with her husband, child and pensioner parents-in-law.

Sophiko and her husband are unemployed and have decided to start a family business. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables her to get a loan to purchase a car. Once the car is purchased, they will purchase seasonal fruits and vegetables and will start trading.

Sophiko is very motivated and hopes that the business will be profitable for her family. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase a car in order to start trading in fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Dinara

texts.ru: Динара, 27 лет, замужем, мать 3 детей. Динара вот уже 7 лет занимается торговлей продуктами питания. На сегодняшний день в обороте Динары есть товар на сумму 100,000 сом (KGS). Ежемесячная прибыль составляет около 15,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего расширения бизнеса, Динара обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на увеличение ассортимента товара в магазине. Доходы Динара планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие бизнеса.
texts.en: Dinara is 27 years old, married, and the mother of three children. Dinara has been selling food goods for seven years now. Today Dinara has goods in stock to the value of 100,000 som (KGS). Her monthly profit is about 15,000 som (KGS). In order to develop her business further, Dinara has applied to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) to increase the range of goods in her shop. Dinara plans to invest the proceeds in the further development of her business.

loans.use: to buy food for retail sale in her shop.

loans.name: Lendi Beatriz

texts.es:
Lendi es una madre de familia perseverante, sincera y muy amable tiene todas las ganas de seguir superándose con su familia.
