Lendi como muchas personas con el préstamo logro la construcción de sus baños y esto es un gran logro para ella, mas sin embargo no está conforme porque aunque los baños ya estén faltan algunas remodelaciones para que quede presentable a raíz de esta necesidad solicita un préstamo para la compra de materiales como: cemento, Cal, arena.
Su gran sueño es contar con un hogar digno para su familia.
texts.en:
Lendi is a perseverant, sincere, and friendly housewife who wants to continue improving herself and her family.  

Lendi, like many people, was able to build bathrooms, which was a great accomplishment for her.  However, she isn't satisfied, because although the bathrooms are there, they lack some upgrades so that they are presentable.   For this reason, she is asking for a loan to buy materials such as cement, lime, and sand.  

Her great dream is to have a dignified home for her family.

loans.use: to buy materials such as cement, lime, and sand.

loans.name: Manuela

texts.es: Manuela  madre de familia que todos los días se esmera para darle a su querida familia lo necesario, ella con el préstamo realizo la inversión en su negocio de compra y venta de banano, con sus productos pudo abastecer las necesidades de los clientes, afortunadamente le dejo una mejor ganancias, pero Manuela con el afán de surtir mejor su negocio ha tomado la decisión de realizar un nuevo préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de más mercadería de banano tales como: seda, oro, chocolate y morado. Con esta inversión espera atraer a más clientes y fortalecer más su negocio.
texts.en:
Manuela is a mother who works hard every day to provide her beloved family with everything they need.

She invested the previous loan in buying and selling bananas, being able to meet her customers' needs with her products. Fortunately, this improved her income, but Manuela wants more supplies for her business so has decided to take out a new loan. She will invest this in purchasing more banana-related goods such as: silk, gold, chocolate and red bananas. She hopes this investment will attract more customers and strengthen her business further.

loans.use: to purchase banana-related goods such as: silk, gold, chocolate and red bananas.

loans.name: Alymkan

texts.ru: Алымкан, 51 год, не замужем, есть ребенок, образование у нее средне-специальное. У Алымкан очень хорошие отзывы от соседей. Они отзываются о ней как об ответственной и трудолюбивой женщине. Она занимается торговлей детской одежды. Также сельским хозяйством, на сегодня у Алымкан есть 2 коровы, 4 овцы. Ежемесячный доход 26,000 сом (KGS). Алымкан обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 40,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 2 коров и сена для скота. Кредит поможет улучшить и развить бизнес.
texts.en: Alymkan is 51 years old, unmarried, and has a child. She has a secondary vocational education. Alymkan has very good feedback from her neighbors. They speak of her as a responsible and hard-working woman. She sells children's clothes. She also farms. Today Alymkan has two cows and four sheep. Her monthly income is 26,000 som (KGS). Alymkan has applied to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 40,000 som (KGS) to buy two cows and hay for her livestock. The loan will help to improve and develop the business.

loans.use: to buy two cows and hay for her livestock.

loans.name: Mnatsakan

texts.en:
Mnatsakan is 28 years old, and he already managed to have one very successful partnership with Kiva lenders. He lives in Zovaber village of the Gegharkunik region with his parents. He also has a sister, who is already married and lives with her family.

Mnatsakan has been farming since his very young age, of course with the help of his parents, who are unemployed and have a lot of time to lighten their son’s work about the farm.

Now on his farm, Mnatsakan has cows, calves, heifers, goats, pigs, a sheep and chickens. As he mentions, he is very happy about the big size of his farm and he puts a lot of work in it, as it is the only source of income for his family.

From the farm with his mother, Mnatsakan sells a lot of meat, milk, macun (national dairy product) and cheese made by his mother, also curds and eggs.

Mnatsakan will be very happy and thankful to receive his second Kiva loan, as he has decided to spend it on the purchase and storage of a lot of animal fodder for his farm cattle, getting prepared for the winter months.

loans.use: to purchase and store a lot of animal fodder for his farm cattle, getting prepared for the winter months.

loans.name: Noura

texts.en: Noura is 30, married, and has one daughter. She has a small fruits and vegetables sales project and is requesting a 5,000 EGP loan to buy winter season fruits and vegetables such as oranges, tangerines, and tomatoes.

loans.use: to buy winter season fruits and vegetables such as oranges, tangerines, and tomatoes.

loans.name: Sofik

texts.en:
Sofik is 69 years old, and she lives with her daughter in Sevan city of the Gegharkunik region. Sofik used to work as a worker in different workshops, but now she works as a saleswoman and at the city’s wholesale market; she sells women's and men's clothes.

Sofik is a very strong and positive woman, who through all the hardships of her life never stops believing and smiling, and at the same time, she teaches her daughter, who is disabled. Without her mother’s help, Sofik's daughter is not able to manage her everyday needs.

Sofik, with great hope and with more impatience, waits for this Kiva loan, which she will use for paying for her daughter’s treatment course. She waits and sends her best wishes to all the lenders.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter’s treatment course.

loans.name: Saydi

texts.en:
Saydi is a 49-year-old, married mother of two children. Due to the limited income of her husband, she opened 10 years ago a tailoring shop to help her husband in covering the needs and expenses of their children. She is well-known among her region for her professional skills. She succeeded throughout the years in gaining loyal customers and building a good reputation.

Saydi is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to maintain her car, which she uses in transporting textiles and tailoring materials.

Saydi hopes to expand her business more in the future to increase her income and stay capable of providing her family with better living conditions.

loans.use: to maintain her car, which she uses in transporting textiles and tailoring materials.

loans.name: Aleksey

texts.en:
Aleksey and his family are very thankful for the Kiva support and would like to continue it.

Living in Ddmashen village of the Gegharkunik region with his big and nice family (he lives with his wife, four children and retired mother), this farmer, as previously, works very hard and looks for any way that may bring some more income to his big family.

On his farm Aleksey has cows, a calf, a bull, and chickens, which give him products for sale such as milk, macun (national dairy product), meat and eggs. Land cultivation is also part of his daily work, which he does very properly in order to have good and tasty products for sale to resellers.

Aleksey, like many farmers, is pleased and greatly appreciates his Kiva support. With this loan of 250,000 Armenian drams, he will use it this time for the purchase of animal fodder for all his farm cattle.

loans.use: to purchase animal fodder for all his farm cattle.

loans.name: Hava

texts.ru: Хава, 50 лет, замужем, мать 3 детей. У Хавы среднее образование, много лет занимается сельским хозяйством. В хозяйстве есть 4 коровы, 10 овец, также земельный надел мерою 1,0 ГА, где она выращивает клевер. Супруг и дети с радостью помогают Хаве в ведении ее бизнеса. Есть все условия для содержания скота. Хава обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 20,000 сом (KGS) на сбор урожая экологически чистого клевера. Доходы от кредита Хава планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие бизнеса и хочет накопить на ремонт дома.
texts.en:
Hava is 50 and married with three children. She has a high school education and has been working in agriculture for many years. She has four cows and 10 sheep on her farm as well as 1 hectare of land where she grows clover. She also has everything necessary to keep livestock. Her husband and children help her with her business happily. 

Hava has approached Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 20,000 KGS to harvest her organic clover. She plans to put profits from the loan toward further developing her business and wants to save toward renovating her home.

loans.use: to harvest her organic clover

loans.name: Hanaa

texts.en:
Hanaa is a 46-year-old, single lady who has run her medicine distributing business since 2009, and is working hard to develop it.

Hanaa distributes her products in nearby villages and works with selected pharmacies. She is putting so much effort to expand her working sector; that's why she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to increase her medicine capital and distribute to pharmacies in a wider region.

Her business comes in parallel with her acquired university degree in pharmacy, but unfortunately, since she couldn't open her own pharmacy, she is currently working as a provider.

She hopes that in the future, she can develop her business properly and expand her working sector.

loans.use: to increase her capital to buy medicine and distribute it to pharmacies in a wider region.

loans.name: Santa Rosa De Lima De Lucmapampa Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “SANTA ROSA DE LIMA DE LUCMAPAMPA”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Santa Teresa, perteneciente a la provincia de La Convención y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Vilma, la socia continua con su  negocio de agricultura, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia continua cultivando café, plátanos y cacao para sus clientes que le solicitan, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
 La socia solicita el crédito para comprar fertilizantes, abono entre otros.
Los socios en general agradecen el crédito y se comprometen a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
These members belong to the Santa Rosa de Lima de Lucmapama community bank. The bank is located in the Santa Teresa district of the La Convention province in the department of Cuzco.

Mrs. Vilma is a member who continues to works in agriculture. She has had this business a long time and, thanks to the work she puts in every day, it is going well. This member is a responsible, hard working person. She continues to grow coffee, bananas and cocoa for her customers and in this manner is able to support her family.

This member is requesting a loan to buy fertilizers, compost and other supplies.

As a group, the members are grateful for the loan and promise to make all the payments.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, compost and other supplies.

loans.name: Gulnara

texts.ru: Гулнара, 50 лет, в разводе, дети взрослые и самостоятельные. С 1985 года она занимается животноводством и полеводством, мастер в своем деле. У Гулнары среднее образование. По хозяйству активно помогают дети. Она достигла больших успехов в своем бизнесе. В хозяйстве имеет 4 коровы. Также есть земельный надел, 1,20 ГА собственной земли, где она выращивает картофель и клевер для реализации. Совокупная прибыль Гулнары составляет около 18,000 сом (KGS). Все накопленные средства она старается вкладывать в развитие бизнеса. Гулнара в этом году решила отремонтировать и утеплить свой дом, поэтому она обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку гипсокартона, шпаклевки и прочих материалов. Свои доходы Гулнара будет вкладывать в дальнейшее развитие бизнеса и улучшение жилищных условий семьи.
texts.en: Gulnara is 50 years old. She is divorced and her children are grown up and independent. She has been rearing animals and growing crops since 1985, and is a master in her field. Gulnara has a secondary education. Her children actively help her on the farm. She has achieved great success in her business. She has four cows. She also has a 1.2 hectare plot of her own land where she grows potatoes and clover for sale. Gulnara's gross profit is about 18,000 som (KGS). She tries to invest all of her savings in the development of the business. This year Gulnara has decided to renovate and insulate her house, so she has applied to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 100,000 som (KGS) to buy drywall, filler and various other materials. Gulnara is going to invest her income in the further development of her business and the improvement of her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy drywall and fillers to repair and insulate her house.

loans.name: Hülya

texts.en:
Hülya is a mother of two. She started working in her husband's shoe and clothing store in order to help him. After a divorce, she started taking care of the whole business by herself. Her dream is to provide her children a good future and a good life with her earnings. With the help of this loan she is planning to buy shoes for her store.

Translated from Turkish by Maya staff
2 çocuk annesi olan Hülya hanım ilk olarak iş hayatına eşinin açmış olduğu ayakkabı ve giyim mağazasın da eşine yardımcı olmak amacıyla başlamış. Eşiyle ayrıldıktan sonra dükkânın bütün işleriyle kendisi ilgilenmeye başlamış. Hayali ise dükkânından sağladığı kazanç ile çocuklarına iyi bir gelecek ve güzel yaşam sağlamak. Aldığı kredi ile dükkanına ayakkabı alacak.

loans.use: to buy shoes

loans.name: Huda

texts.en:
Huda is a 44-year-old, single lady who has worked in selling shoes and clothes from her house for 15 years. She is well-known in her region and supported by most of her customers.

Her acquired income is good enough to cover her living needs, but unfortunately, not enough to cover sudden requested living expenses. Currently, Huda is requesting a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to pay for necessary personal medical expenses.

She hopes that she won't have a serious medical situation, and also hopes to continue developing her business and replying to customers' needs.

loans.use: to pay for necessary personal medical expenses.

loans.name: Carolina

texts.en:
Carolina is a 52-year-old, married woman with 12 children. Three of her children are still attending school. Five years ago, she started manufacturing concrete blocks to help her husband in covering the needs and expenses of their children.

She is a hard worker who is trying desperately to develop her business, but she is also a sacrificing mother who deprives herself for the sake of her children.

She has requested a loan from Kiva's field partner CEVI to acquire capital to purchase materials like cement. With these, she could slowly cope with demand. She could now be able to set aside some of the profits for future expansion.

Carolina hopes that someday, her concrete blocks business will become productive and able to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to acquire capital to purchase materials like cement.

loans.name: Shaemaa

texts.en:
Shaemaa is a 17-year-old single lady from Rafah city. Her father is an employee in the public sector where he earns a low and unstable income. This income is barely enough to cover all the family's needs.

Shaemaa is a high school student. She wants to take the tawjihi degree recorded at a local university. She dreams of becoming a doctor in the future to help her country.

Shaemaa took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy a new laptop for her studies. By taking this loan, Shaemaa will be able to do her homework and reports easily.

Shaemaa appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for her studies.

loans.name: Mihriye

texts.en:
Mihriye raised her two daughters alone and by herself. Her retirement salary was not enough, so she started to knit things and sell them. She knits baby blankets, sweaters and baby socks, and makes money.

With the help of the loan from Maya, she will buy bulk threads and minimizes her costs. In the future, she is planning to offer a knitting course.

Translated from Turkish by Maya staff
Mihriye Hanım 2 kızını tek başına büyütmüş bir anne. Aldığı emekli maaşı yetmeyince el emeği örgülerini satmaya başlamış. Mihriye Hanım bebek battaniyesi, yelek ve patikleri örerek kendisine ek gelir sağlıyor. MAYA’dan aldığı kredi ile toptan ip ve yün alarak maliyetini minimuma indiriyor. Ve gelecekte bir örgü kursu açmayı hedefliyor.

loans.use: to buy yarn and thread.

loans.name: Roukaya

texts.en:
Roukaya is a 41-year-old married mother of four children. Almost a year ago, she decided to open a scarf shop to help her husband in covering the needs and expenses of their beloved children. She is trying hard to develop her business and improve her family's living conditions, thus today she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to pay her children's school tuition fees. She is a sacrificing mother who deprives herself for the sake of her children, as she believes that education is her children's only guarantor.

Roukaya hopes to expand her business more in the future to increase her income and provide her family with descent living conditions.

loans.use: to pay her children's school tuition fees.

loans.name: Sobhi

texts.en:
Sobhi is a 68-year-old Palestinian refugee and a married father of seven children.

Sobhi has been running his fruits and vegetables selling business since 2000 and is working hard to develop it as much as he can to make sure he can support his family's living.

Sobhi is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to increase his business merchandise with special seasonal fruits and vegetables.

He hopes to stay in good health to provide his family with the necessary standards of living.

loans.use: to increase his business merchandise with special seasonal fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Olimpia

texts.es: Olimpia es una apasionada por la culinaria que emprendió su restaurante de comidas típicas hace 20 años en un tradicional barrio de Cartagena de Indias, esta valerosa mujer que no cuenta con el apoyo de su cónyuge puesto que se encuentra separada, es madre de dos hijos; un hijo de 22 años y una hija de 29 años, a quienes ofreció bienestar con su negocio, el cual inició cuando eran apenas unos niños.  Olimpia a sus 64 años de edad, trabaja con entusiasmo y dinamismo, y todos los días de la semana a partir de las 9 a.m. empieza a elaborar sus comida y atienden a sus comensales al medio día en jornada continua hasta las 3 p.m., ellos llegan a la terraza de su vivienda que adecuó con una carpa, sillas y mesas, a degustar de deliciosos manjares; comida ejecutiva y  sancochos. Ella realiza sus compras en el mercado de Bazurto y desea contar con un mejor stock de productos para evitar desplazamientos que le generan sobre costos, es por ello que está aplicando una solicitud de crédito, su primer credikiva financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para comprar víveres al por mayor a precios de oportunidad, inversión que le permite contar con el mercado suficiente para abastecerse por mucho más tiempo.  Olimpia desea que su negocio siga siendo próspero y continúe como de costumbre: satisfaciendo las necesidades alimenticias de la comunidad con su sazón.
texts.en:
Olimpia, a woman passionate about cooking, started her typical food restaurant 20 years ago. She started it in a traditional neighborhood in Cartagena de Indias. This brave woman, who does not have her husband's support because she is separated, has two children. She has a 22 year old son and a 29 year old daughter. She provided for their well-being with her business, which she started when they were just little children.

Olimpia, age 64, works with enthusiasm and energy. Beginning at 9:00 a.m. everyday she starts to make her food. She tends to her customers at midday, and her work day goes until 3:00 p.m. Her diners come to the terrace of her house, which she adapted with an awning, tables, and chairs. The diners come to enjoy the delicious food, specials and soups.

She makes her purchases at the Bazurto market. She wishes to have a better stock of products in order to avoid trips that generate cost overruns for her. That is why she is requesting a loan, her first Kiva loan with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She will use the loan to buy supplies wholesale at good prices. This investment will allow her to have sufficient supplies to stock up for a mch longer time.

Olimpia wishes for her business to contineu being prosperous and to continue her custom of meeting the food needs of her community with her delicous food.

loans.use: to buy supplies wholesale.

loans.name: Pamoja Group

texts.en: Happy, who is in her mid 20s, is married with one kid who is still in school. She has been selling clothes for two years now. She works from 8am to 6pm daily and is able to make a very good monthly profit. This will be Happy's first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She will use this loan to increase stock and to buy up-to-date clothes to sell. She dreams of being a big businesswoman. Happy will share this loan with her loan group, "PAMOJA", which consist of five members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to increase stock and to buy up-to-date clothes to sell.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a youth man living in Khan Younis in the Gaza strip. He works in the public sector, where the salary is very low and unstable.

As a result of the high cost of living, he decided to open new business. His business idea is to transport goods and inventory between traders with a rickshaw. A few years ago, Mohammad bought a new rickshaw and become famous; he also has loyal customers.

Now Mohammad took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to do some maintenance on his rickshaw.

By taking this loan, Mohammad can working more efficiently and also increase his sales and his profit.

loans.use: to do some maintenance on his rickshaw,.

loans.name: Füsun

texts.en:
After retirement Füsun started a felt business as a hobby and then it became a business for her. She is making bags, shawls, brooch and key chains from felt. She sells them on stands. She aims to open a store of her own at a touristic place. She wants to be known worldwide with her felt productions. With the help of her third loan from Maya she bought bulks of felt.

Translated from Turkish by Maya staff
Füsun Hanım emekli olduktan sonra hobi olarak başladığı keçe işini, meslek haline getiriyor.  Keçeden kadın çantası, şal, broş, anahtarlık gibi birçok şey yapıyor.  Bu ürünlerini stantlarda satıyor.  Hedefi turistik bir yerde dükkân açmak olan Füsun Hanım Keçe işlerini yurtdışına da satarak dünya çapında tanınmak istiyor.  Maya dan 3. kredisini kullanan Füsun Hanım kredileri toptan keçe aldı.

loans.use: to buy supplies for felt working.

loans.name: Rexhep

texts.en:
Rexhep needs this loan to build some shelves in the store he operates; it is a neighborhood store.

Recently, the government made it mandatory that no matter how small the activity is, it should have to be registered and pay taxes. The truth is that a store like his does not make more than $120/month net income.

Imagine someone like Rexhep being the breadwinner for a family of five.

loans.use: to  build some shelves in the store and pay for its license registration

loans.name: Linet

texts.en:
Linet is a married woman with four children. She describes herself to be dedicated.

Linet operates a retail business where she sells firewood. She has been involved in this business for 12 years. Her primary customers are locals. Linet describes her biggest business challenge to be rains, which affect business. She will use the 50,000 KES loan to buy more stock of firewood.

Linet's business goal is to have a wholesale business within 5 years. She hopes that in the future she will have a successful business. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. She successfully repaid the previous loan.

loans.use: to buy more stock of firewood.

loans.name: Mwanaresa

texts.en:
Mwanaresa is a married woman. She describes herself to be proactive.

Mwanaresa operates a retail business where she sells clothing. Her business is located in a busy area, and her primary customers are locals. Mwanaresa describes her biggest business challenge to be transportation costs. She will use the 50,000 KES loan to stock more clothing.

Mwanaresa's business goal is to own a boutique within 5 years. She hopes that in the future she will have the best boutique. Mwanaresa will save the anticipated profits.

loans.use: to stock more clothing.

loans.name: Leila

texts.en:
Leila is a Kiva borrower with two children. She describes herself to be honest.

Leila operates a retail business where she sells clothing. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located in a busy area, and her primary customers are locals.

Leila describes her biggest business challenge to be transportation costs. She will use the 50,000 KES loan to stock more clothing. Her business goal is to own a boutique within 5 years. She hopes that in the future she will be successful. Leila will save the anticipated profits.

loans.use: to stock more clothing.

loans.name: Aysel

texts.en:
Aysel is married and a mother of two. She has been dealing with glass art for three years. She has a small shop of her own where she designs and produces her products. She gets small orders from outside the country. She designs and produces different models. Her husband and children help her.  With the help of her loans from Maya she bought bulks of glass raw materials.

Translated from Turkish by Maya staff
Aysel hanım evli ve 2 çocuk annesi.  3 yıldır cam sanatları işi ile uğraşıyor.  Müşterileri genellikle yerli ve yabancı turistler.  Hem ürünlerini tasarladığı hem de ürünlerinin satışını yaptığı küçük bir dükkanı var.  Yurt dışından aldığı küçük çaplı siparişleri olmuş.  Farklı modeller tasarlayıp üretiyor.  Eşi ve çocukları da üretim yaparken kendisine yardımcı oluyorlar.  Maya’dan aldığı krediler ile camı hammadde olarak toplu alıyor.

loans.use: to buy glass raw material.

loans.name: Fahriye

texts.en:
Fahriye is a mother of three. She made mantı, börek and pastas at home. Everybody loved her products so she decided to sell them. She has been getting orders for five years. She is selling them on stands and in bazaars from time to time. She wants to open her own shop and expand her business.  With the help of her third loan from Maya she bought bulks of flour, meat, eggs, etc.

Translated from Turkish by Maya staff
Fahriye Hanım 3 çocuk annesi.  Evinde yaptığı mantı, makarna, börek  herkes tarafından beğenilince ticaretini yapmaya karar vermiş.  5 yıldır evden sipariş alıyor.  Zaman zaman pazarlara ve stantlara çıkıyor.  Küçük bir dükkân açarak işlerini geliştirmek istiyor.  Mayadan 3. kredisini kullanan Fahriye hanım kredi ile un, kıyma, yumurta vs. aldı.

loans.use: to buy flour, meat, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Serpil

texts.en:
After her divorce Serpil started living with her parents. Her baklavas were very much appreciated so she started getting orders. Now she is making baklava regularly to a company as well as other individual orders. With the help of her loan from Maya she bought bulks of sugar, flour and nuts.

Translated from Turkish by Maya staff
Serpil hanım eşinden ayrıldıktan sonra ailesiyle birlikte yaşamaya başlamış.  Yaptığı baklavalar çevresi tarafından çok beğenilince sipariş almaya başlamış.  Şu an bir işletmeye düzenli olarak baklava yapıyor.  Bunun dışında gelen siparişleri de değerlendiriyor.  Maya ‘dan aldığı kredi ile toptan olarak şeker, un ve ceviz aldı.

loans.use: to buy sugar, flour and walnuts wholesale.

loans.name: Rotha's Group

texts.en:
Rotha, who is a farmer living in a bedroom house located in Battambang province. She is 26 years old and the mother of a child who is below school age.

To support herself, she has been raising chickens for 2 years. Her business is not doing well as the chickens got sick. She can earn an income of only about 11 USD per day and she is able to save around 6 USD each day after expenses.

After being successful with the past two loans which enabled her to improve her lifestyle to be better than before, she decided to get a new loan with VisionFund to support her business. As the group leader, she will use her entire portion of the loan to buy more chickens and chicken feed, which are expected to support her business well. She hopes her chickens will grow well and that she will be able to sell them at a good price so that she can expand her business to be larger than last year.

loans.use: to buy more chickens and chicken feed, which are expected to support her business well.

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
Liza has animals at home and she needs to build a fence around the open space where the cow and calf stay during the daytime. The earth around it has slipped as well, thus she must build a barrier in order to prevent this. By profession, Liza is a seamstress, whereas her husband was born with some sort of illness and he receives a disability income. Both Liza and her husband live with their married son's family of four. 

Liza has been photographed with her granddaughter in the stable of the animals.

loans.use: To build a fence around the open place where she keeps the animals during the daytime.

loans.name: Alberto

texts.en: Alberto started doing some basic repairs previously with your loan; however, he has more things to do and this is why he is seeking your financial help again. This loan will be used to improve sanitation and make basic repairs to his home where he lives with his mother.

loans.use: to improve sanitation and make basic repairs to his home

loans.name: Grupo Chuisanto Tomas 3 Group

texts.es: Maria es una persona con un corazón generoso, es la represéntate del grupo Chuisanto Tomas 3, un grupo que busca superarse con el apoyo de créditos. Maria utilizo su préstamo en la compra de hilos y con ello pudo elaborar güipiles, cortes y fajas para su respectiva venta, a Dios gracias esta inversión le dejo una buena ganancia. Maria (la primera del lado izquierdo de la fotografía) con grandes aspiraciones en la vida, busca nuevamente un préstamo para seguir invirtiendo en su negocio de ropa, en esta ocasión comprara: cortes, güipiles y fajas. Con este nuevo anagrama ella espera satisfacer mejor las necesidades de los clientes.  Su gran sueño es construir una casa más digna para su familia.
texts.en:
Maria is a person with a generous heart. She is the representative for the Chuisanto Tomas 3 group, a group that is working to get ahead with the help of loans.

Maria used her loan to buy thread to make güipiles (traditional Guatemalan blouses), cortes(traditional Guatemalan skirts) and traditional sashes to sell. With God's help this investment gave her a good return. Maria (the first on the left of the photo), who has big aspirations in life, is requesting a new loan in order to continue investing in her clothing business, in this case to buy hand woven cortes, güipiles and traditional sashes. With this new effort she hopes to better meet the needs of her customers.

Her big dream is to build a better house for her family.

loans.use: to buy clothing such as Cortés (traditional Guatemalan skirts), traditional sashes, and güipiles (traditional Guatemalan blouses).

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en: Ahmad is a 23-year-old single man who started an electricity power supply service business nine years ago after he got experience through working in a power generator company. His established business is doing just fine, but he needs external financial support to expand it properly. For this reason, Ahmad is acquiring a Youth Loan from Kiva's field partner, Al Majmoua, to buy more electric cables to expand electricity supply to nearby villages. Electricity is a major issue in his region, and he is working hard to help people acquire it as requested. He will work hard to develop his business so that in the future he will purchase more developed electricity generators and cover wider regions.

loans.use: To buy more electric cables to expand electricity supply in his working area

loans.name: Vingunguti B Group

texts.en:
Selemani is in his mid 30s and is married with three school children. He has been running a business of animal sales for 13 years now. He works from 5am to 4pm daily and is able to make a very good monthly profit.

This will be Seleman's second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans to buy goats and has been able to pay back all his loans successfully.  He is doing fine with the loan and appreciates Kiva for the support of their group. He used the profit to pay school fees, bought a plot of land to repay the loan and covered household expenses. He will use this loan to increase his goat stock for resale. He dreams of buying a good stock of goats to keep for future sales when the market is high.  

He will share this loan with his loan group Vingunguti B which has three members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to increase his goat stock for resale.

loans.name: Rima

texts.en:
Rima is a 46-year-old widowed mother of two children. She has run a daycare at her house for twelve years to cover her family's living expenses since she is her children's sole breadwinner.
Rima is the hard working father and the caring mother. She has put in so much effort to increase her family's income and develop their living.
Today, she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, to pay for her daughter's college tuition fees.
She hopes that her daughter will graduate and support her in establishing and opening a separate daycare outside her house in a well managed way.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter's college tuition fees.

loans.name: Husein

texts.en:
Husein is a 27-year-old married father of one child. He has been running his tire maintenance and selling business since 2007 and is working hard to develop it properly.

His wife works as a tutor from her house to make sure she can support her husband with their increasing living expenses.

Husein is working hard to expand his business and increase his capital. For this reason he is acquiring a YOUTH  loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to buy necessary business tools and tires to expand his working sector and improve his living.

He hopes to stay capable of developing his business and covering his family's needs.

loans.use: to buy necessary business tools and tires to expand his working sector and improve his living conditions.

loans.name: Phonephas

texts.en:
Phonephas is a married man with six children.

He operates a retail business where he sells sugar, soda, flour, soap, and other items. Phonephas has been involved in this business for six years. His business is located in a busy area, and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be transportation costs.

Phonephas will use the 55,000 KES loan to buy more rice, bread, sugar, salt, and other items to sell. His business goal is to expand his business within five years. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Phonephas successfully repaid his previous loan. He will use the anticipated profits to set up a bigger shop.

loans.use: to buy more rice, bread, sugar, salt, and other items to sell.

loans.name: Nahide

texts.en:
Nahide is married and 48 years old. She is making  a contribution to the family budget by making and selling mantı and pastas. First she got an order for mantı from a friend. When her mantıs were appreciated she got lots of orders. With the help of her loan from Maya she bought bulks of flour and meat and produced mantı. Since she has bulks of ingredients she can make mantı whenever she gets orders.

Translated from Turkish by Maya staff
Nahide hanım evli ve 48 yaşında.  Mantı ve makarna yaparak ev bütçesine katkı sağlıyor.  Bir arkadaşı kendisine mantı yapması için sipariş veriyor ve yaptığı mantılar beğenilince çevresi sürekli sipariş vermeye başlamış.  Maya’dan aldığı kredi ile toptan un ve kıyma aldı.  Aldığı toptan malzemeyle mantı yaptı.  Gelen siparişleri bekletmeden elinin altında sürekli bulunan mantılardan verebiliyor.

loans.use: to buy ground beef and flour wholesale to make manti (Turkish ravioli).

loans.name: Julia

texts.en:
Julia is a married woman. She has three children. She describes herself as honest. She operates a retail business where she sells shoes. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge as inadequate working capital.

She will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy more inventory of shoes. She hopes that in the future, she will be successful. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. She will use the anticipated profits to expand her business and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy more inventory of shoes.

loans.name: Moryne

texts.en: Moryne is a married woman with one child. She describes herself to be focused. For four years, she has operated a retail business where she sells beauty products. Her business is located in a busy area, and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. She will use the 50,000 KES loan to buy more inventory of beauty products. Her business goal is to be a large-scale distributor of beauty products within five years. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. She will use the anticipated profits to buy a piece of land.

loans.use: to buy more beauty products to sell.

loans.name: Nurşen

texts.en:
Nurşen started making and selling dolma because of an advice from a friend. First she got very little orders. Later on, as she became known, her orders increased and she started making dolma to restaurants, wedding parties and religious meetings. With the help of her loan from Maya she bought bulks of grape leaves and rice and increased her orders.

Translated from Turkish by Maya staff
Nurşen Hanım arkadaşının teşvikiyle sarma yapıp satmaya başlamış.  Önceleri siparişleri çok azmış.  Zamanla tanınmaya başlayınca siparişleri artmış ve lokantalara, düğünlere ve mevlitlere toptan olarak sarma yapmaya başlamış.  Maya ‘dan aldığı kredi ile toptan asma yaprağı ve pirinç alarak siparişlerini arttırdı.

loans.use: to buy grape leaves and rice wholesale.

loans.name: Gjergj

texts.en: Gjergj's daughter is continuing her studies in a public university located in the capital city. As such, she not only has to pay the cost of the education, but she also needs to pay for the dormitory. The daughter is in her second year of schooling.

loans.use: to pay for his daughter's university/dormitory fees.

loans.name: Dafina

texts.en:
Dafina is 24 years old and engaged. She is very optimistic when it comes to business and works hard. She is employed doing administrative work in a water company together with her fiancé, and she also does freelance work as an English translator for different companies. She started to translate for a friend, and from there her freelance work grew and expanded into her being able to provide services through the internet.

Normally, she is able to generate more income from her translation work than from her regular job. At this time she is in need of a loan to purchase a new laptop for her work. This loan will help her to be able to do her translation work much faster and better. Up to now, she has had to fix her laptop several times and it is very outdated.

Her goal is to be able to save money for her future. She hopes that she will be able to start her own business doing translations and eventually add other languages as well.

loans.use: to purchase a new laptop for her translation work.

loans.name: Burulkan

texts.ru: Бурулкан успешно погасила свой кредит, использовав его по назначению. Она благодарна Фонду Кива и всем, кто помог ей в финансировании. Благодаря упорному труду Бурулкан, на данный момент в ее хозяйстве имеется 2 коровы, 30 овец. на 3,20 Га земли она выращивает кукурузу, перец, ячмень и клевер. Ежемесячный доход составляет примерно 9,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Бурулкан обратилась в Банк «Бай–Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 25,000 сом (KGS) на покупку нетелей. Доходы от кредита она планирует вложить в дальнейшее расширение бизнеса и мечтает накопить на поездку с супругом в оздоровительный центр.
texts.en: Burulkan successfully repaid her loan, having used it for its intended purpose. She is grateful to the Kiva fund and to everyone who helped to finance her. Thanks to Burulkan's hard work, at the present time she has two cows and 30 sheep. She grows corn, pepper, barley and clover on 3.20 hectares of land. Her monthly income is about 9,000 som (KGS). In order to develop her business further, Burulkan has applied to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 25,000 som (KGS) to buy some heifers. She plans to invest the proceeds of the loan in the further expansion of her business and dreams of saving up for a trip to a wellness center with her husband.

loans.use: to buy some heifers in order to increase her herd.

loans.name: Carmen Trinidad

texts.es: Carmen tiene 30 años de edad madre de 4 hijos un varón Donovan de 4 añitos y 3 mujeres Andrea de 7 años quien tiene  retardo mental, Cristina de 10 años y Ximena de una añito , por motivos económicos solo vive con 3 de sus 4 hijos y su esposo, quien trabaja como taxista , sus ingresos de este trabajo son muy pocos ya que los gastos son exagerados por la  discapacidad de la niña ,Carmen  gracias a su negocio ayuda a su esposo con los gastos de la casa, su pequeña tienda le permite estar al cuidado de sus 3 pequeños y ayudar económicamente, con el crédito surtirá su tienda para generar más ingresos y poder cubrir los gastos de Andrea
texts.en:
Carmen is 30 years old, mother of 4 children:  a 4 year old boy named Donovan and 3 girls:  Andrea, who is 7 years old and is mentally handicapped, Cristina who is 10, and Ximena who is one.

Due to economic reasons she lives with only 3 of her 4 children and her husband, who works as a taxi driver.  Income from this work is very limited and expenses are great and exasperated by the disability of the one child.  

Carmen helps her husband with the household expenses through her business.  Her small shop allows her to care for her 3 children and help financially.

With the loan she will stock up her store so as to be able to generate more revenue to cover the costs of Andrea's care.

loans.use: to purchase products for her store

loans.name: Halim

texts.en:
Halim is a professional cook and has been employed in a restaurant for a long time now. He has been planning on opening a small Kebab place of his own and already has a small space in his home he can use as a shop to avoid paying rent. 

At this time he is in need of a loan to purchase equipment and to renovate the space for his restaurant. Although his wife works as a nurse, they have more expenses to take care of than they can with her salary. Halim is very optimistic that his business will be successful and help him enough to satisfy the needs of his family and children.

loans.use: to purchase equipment and to renovate the space for his restaurant.

loans.name: Mihrije

texts.en: Mihrije wants to thank all of the lenders for the previous loan. She has used the loan to buy windows and door frames for her house. She has managed to  improve the living conditions for her family and is very happy for this opportunity. Mihrije, together with her husband, is involved in selling used shoes in a market each day. They have been in business recently and very optimistic that they will be able to generate income. Her husband is able to purchase shoes from different European countries and then sell them here for a higher price. Mihrije tries to fix the shoes and cleans them before selling them. She is now requesting a loan so that she can purchase more used shoes. She hopes that this loan will generate more income for their business as they will be able to provide a better variety and more selections. She is very thankful for this opportunity.

loans.use: to purchase shoes from different European countries and then sell them here for a higher price.

loans.name: Didera

texts.en: Didera is 50 years old and comes from a minority community in the western part of Kosovo. She has never been married and currently lives alone. She is very famous in the area for her designs and the traditional clothing she makes. She is very active in the fair for the entire Balkan region. Didera has a lot of customers and requests for her work to create different traditional clothing. She has been in business for more than three years now and is very happy with her work. She is now requesting a loan to be able to purchase new material and other items such as needles and equipment. She hopes to be able to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase new material and other items such as needles and equipment.

loans.name: Serbeze

texts.en:
Serbeze works together with her husband in his auto service business. She has tried to find her own job but was never successful and now works by helping her husband cleaning and maintaining his business and tools. This auto service has been the main source of income for their family for more than 10 years now, but her husband also works as a driver for an electrical company. 

At this time, she is requesting a loan in order to purchase a machine to fix vehicles. Without the loan, they will not be able to obtain this machine which is essential for their business. Serbeze would like to thank all of the lenders for their support and help.

loans.use: to purchase a machine to fix vehicles.

loans.name: Sevdije

texts.en: Sevdije comes from an Ashkali community and is the mother of four children. She earns a living by working together with her husband in a small restaurant that they own in their area. Customers go to their place to purchase various beverages, such as coffee and tea, to enjoy and relax. Her husband serves the clients and Sevdije maintains the cleaning and washing. They have been in business for more than three years now. Recently they had a house fire which started from electrical problems. They have been trying to save money to fix it, but it has been hard to save the money and invest in their business. At this time she is asking for a loan to purchase beverages for the restaurant and to fix their home. She is extremely grateful for this opportunity and wants to thank all of the lenders for their support.

loans.use: to purchase beverages for the restaurant and to fix their home.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Most of the Kenyan people struggle to make their way in the world because of unemployment and lack of capital. This is true for Elizabeth, 28, who is based in the Kapsowar area of Kenya. She is a mother of five adorable and lovely children. She has been practicing mixed farming for the past five years and managed to earn a decent income. Her primary source of income has been sheep, eggs, crops and some personal businesses she engages in to make ends meet. She passionately loves sheep farming and when asked what is most enjoyable about sheep farming, she stated “feeding my sheep." Her hobby is grazing her sheep. She sells wool and mutton to her neighbors and at the local market but the demand has been overwhelming and she cannot meet it. For this reason, she is seeking a loan to buy sheep, which will assist in increasing wool and mutton productivity. The sheep she plans to buy is not just ordinary sheep; it’s a quality breed of sheep that will produce more wool and mutton. This will immediately translate into more profit and increased income levels. Profits from selling mutton and wool will be used in repaying back the loan in full, and the extra income will be used to increase her business enterprise. Elizabeth is very ambitious. In the near future, she intends to start adding value to her sheep business by packaging the wool before selling it. By joining Juhudi Kilimo, which assists smallholder farmers, she will also benefit from free extension services and links to markets.

loans.use: to buy sheep.

loans.name: Essi

texts.fr: Mariée et âgée de 45 ans, Essi est une femme qui vit à Adidogomé. Avec quatre enfants à sa charge, Essi est une revendeuse des objets en plastiques. Essi s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché et le revend à domicile et en parcourant les quartiers environnant. Essi sollicite ce prêt pour commander des unités de sceaux en plastiques et des douzaines de plats en vue de mieux vendre puis de satisfaire parfaitement les attentes de ses clients et réaliser une bonne marge bénéficiaire afin d’aider son mari à subvenir aux charges et besoins quotidiens de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Essi is a 45 year-old woman who is married with 4 dependent children, and she lives in Adidogomé. She is a reseller of plastic wares. She buys her stock twice a month at the market and sells it from her home or as an itinerant vendor around neighboring districts.

Essi is seeking this loan to purchase plastic buckets and dozens of plates to bolster her sales, to fully meet customer demand and to make substantial profits. This will allow her to help her husband provide for their children's day-to-day needs.

loans.use: to buy 35 plastic buckets and 10 dozen plates.

loans.name: Zheenbu

texts.ru: Жээнбу, 60 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитали 4 детей. У Жээнбу - высшее образование, она на пенсии, в качестве дохода для своей семьи она занимается животноводством, стартовав в 1989 году, с покупки скота на 13,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Жээнбу, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 6 коров, 40 овец, лошадь. Ежемесячный доход составляет примерно 31,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Жээнбу обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 40,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота для увеличения поголовья. Доходы от кредита она планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины.
texts.en: Zheenbu is 60 years old and married, and she and her husband have raised four children. Zheenbu has a higher education. She is retired. She rears animals to get income for her family, having started in 1989 with the purchase of some livestock for 13,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Zheenbu's hard work, today she has six cows, 40 sheep, and a horse. Her monthly income is about 31,000 som (KGS). In order to develop her business further, Zheenbu has applied to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 40,000 som (KGS) to buy some livestock to increase her herd. She plans to invest the proceeds of the loan in further increasing her number of domestic livestock.

loans.use: to buy some livestock in order to increase her herd.

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es:
Miguel es un padre de familia generoso y muy entusiasta, su préstamo lo utilizo para el mantenimiento de su cultivo de banano afortunadamente obtuvo una muy buena cosecha y logro venderlo a un buen precio en su mercado regional.
Miguel con el afán de seguir mejorando sus ingresos ha tomado la decisión de solicitar un préstamo para invertirlo en la compra 975 manojos de pacaya pues es la  temporada de esta verdura, por lo tanto él quiere aprovechar la demanda que ahora se tiene.  El espera que con este anagrama fortalecerá su negocio. Su gran sueño es construir una casa más amplia para su familia.
texts.en:
Miguel is a generous family man and very enthusiastic. He used the previous loan to maintain his banana plantation and fortunately he had a great harvest and was able to sell it at a good price in his local market.

Miguel wants to continue to increase his revenue and decided to request a loan to invest in the purchase of 975 bundles of "pacaya" (the initial blossom of a variety of date palm tree), because it is in season and he wants to take advantage of the current demand. He hopes that this investment will strengthen his business. His dream is to build a more spacious house for his family.

loans.use: to purchase 975 bundles of pacaya (a vegetable) to sell them.

loans.name: Luz Dary

texts.es:
Luz Dary es una mujer de 48 años de edad, una guerrera una luchadora que a lo largo de su vida ha tenido que trabajar bastante y pasar largas jornadas laborales para llevar un bocado a su hogar, ella cansada de las injusticias laborales de ser empleada, decidió comenzar un negocio de restaurante, poco a poco ha salido adelante.
Su principal objetivo es tener sostenibilidad en el tiempo, sostenibilidad económica y expandirse.
Luz Dary siempre le pregunta si tiene servicios a domicilios que sería muy buena oportunidad de generar mayores recursos y generaría un empleo, ella no estaba segura de hacerlo, temía a lo que pudiera pasar, pero ahora gracias a la inclusión de Interactuar está segura de que va a tomar la decisión correcta.
Por tal razón Luz Dary quiere solicitar un préstamo para iniciar un servicio complementario de domicilios en su restaurante, el dinero será para la compra de una motocicleta de segunda mano con la que llevara los almuerzos con el plus de que se desplazara a veredas.
texts.en:
Luz Dary is a 48-year-old woman, a warrior, and a fighter. All her life she has had to work a lot and endure long work days to put food on the table. She was tired of the injustices of being an employee, so she decided to open a restaurant. Little by little, she has gotten ahead.

Her main goal is to have economic sustainability over time and to expand.

Luz Dary is always asked if she offers home delivery service, which would be a very good opportunity to generate additional income and create a job. She was not sure about doing it. She was afraid of what could happen. However, now, thanks to joining Interactuar, she is sure that she is going to make the right decision.

For this reason, Luz Dary is requesting a loan to begin home delivery service in her restaurant. The money will be used to purchase a used motorcycle, with which to deliver lunches. An added bonus is that the motorcycle can travel on sidewalks.

loans.use: to start a home delivery service in her restaurant.

loans.name: Tha

texts.en:
Tha, 37 years old, is a worker who lives in Phnum Sruoch District, Kampong Speu Province. He is a hard-working father of three children who are enrolling in primary school. His wife is a farmer. This couple can make a net profit of approximately USD 7.5 a day.

During this time, Tha is facing a financial issue with his family. He needs some money to buy a new tractor cart but he cannot afford to. Therefore, he would like to get a Kiva loan and he has decided to apply for a Kiva loan to help out.

He is thankful to all lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: to buy a new tractor cart.

loans.name: Diego Armando

texts.es:
Diego es un empresario del campo, una persona sagaz, comprometida con su familia y orgullosa de su progreso, como ven en la foto ha construido su casa en material un paso enorme para su familia,  tiene dos princesas de 4 y 2 años de edad que significan todo para él, son su motor de vida y quiere brindarles el mejor futuro.
Pensando en la problemática del bajo precio de venta de leche el señor Diego quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra de dos vacas lecheras para regular su producción y le reste capital para seguir invirtiendo en su terreno y su familia.
texts.en:
Diego is a country businessman, a wise person, committed to his family and proud of his progress. As you see in the photo, he has built his house of cement blocks, a huge step for his family. He has two princesses of 4 and 2 years of age who mean everything to him; they are his chief motivation and he wants to provide them with the best future.

Thinking about the problem of the low sales price of milk, Don Diego wants to apply for a loan for the purchase of two dairy cows, to regulate his production and keep some capital to continue investing in his land and his family.

loans.use: buy two dairy cows.

loans.name: Estefania

texts.es: Estefania labora junto con su familia en su propio taller de soldadura. Solicita un préstamo de un millón cincuenta mil colones (₡ 1 050 000), dinero que usará para la compra de equipo de soldadura. De esta forma lograrán aumentar la participación de su negocio en el mercado y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en: Estefania works with her family in their own welding shop. She is requesting a loan of one million fifty thousand colones (₡ 1,050,000) [approx. USD$1,975], money that she will use to purchase welding equipment. In this way they will succeed in augmenting their business’s participation in the market and improve their quality of life.

loans.use: buy welding equipment.

loans.name: Maluda

texts.ru: Малуда, 57 лет, замужем, 4 детей. У Малуды среднее образование, с 1980 года в качестве дохода для своей семьи занимается животноводством и полеводством. У нее есть 2 коровы, 9 овец, 2 лошади. Малуда известна как ответственный, честный, порядочный и добросовестный человек. Ее ежемесячная прибыль доходит до 12,000 сом (KGS). Для дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Малуда обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 45,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коров для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Малуда будет вкладывать в дальнейшее расширение бизнеса.
texts.en: Maluda is 57 years old, married, and has four children. Maluda has a secondary education. She has been rearing animals and growing crops since 1980 to get income for her family. She has two cows, nine sheep, and two horses. Maluda is known as a responsible, honest, decent and kind-hearted person. Her monthly profit is up to 12,000 som (KGS). In order to develop her business further, Maluda has applied to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 45,000 som (KGS) to buy some cows to increase the size of her herd. Maluda is going to invest the proceeds of the loan in the further expansion of her business.

loans.use: to buy some cows in order to increase the size of her herd.

loans.name: Kevin

texts.en:
Kevin is a married man with 3 children. He describes himself to be hardworking. He operates a retail business where he sells sugar, bread, salt, flour,rice and other items. He has been involved in this business for 6 years. His business is located in a busy area and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital.

He will use the Kes 100,000 loan to buy more stock of rice, bread, sugar, salt and other items. His business goal is to own a wholesale business within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will educate his children to university level. This is his fifth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully. He will use the anticipated profits to buy more stock.

loans.use: to buy more stock of rice, bread, sugar,salt and other items

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is a married woman with 2 children. She describes herself to be focused. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for 6 years. Her business is located in an open air market. and her primary customers are of all kinds. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital.

She will use the Kes 100,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes. Her business goal is to be a large scale distributor of clothes within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will have improved living standards and business. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is a married woman with 4 children. She describes herself to be determined. She operates a retail business where she sells cereals. She has been involved in this business for 4 years. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are locals.

She will use the Kes 120,000 loan to buy more stock of cereals.This will enable her to have more stock to sell hence more profits. Her business goal is to have a big wholesale business within 5 years. This is her fifth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to buy a piece of land.

loans.use: to buy more stock of cereals

loans.name: Kihondo Abagambakamu Group

texts.en: Stephen is a 33 year old married man with 4 children aged 12, 9, 5 and 3 all living in Fort Portal Uganda. He is a motorcyclist for three years now and he is actively in this business 12 hours a day. He spends part of his time growing banana and maize  on a large scale that has added him more income to his family. He has future prospects of buying another motorcycle so as to expand his business and generate bigger income, though he faces hardships of poor roads especially the rainy season that makes roads impassable and destroy the motorcycle tyres. Stephen has asked for a loan in a group of Kihondo Abagambakamu so as to rehabilitate his banana plantation.

loans.use: to rehabilitate his banana plantation.

loans.name: Loenor

texts.es:
Leonor, de 55 años de edad, es una mujer emprendedora, estudio hasta cuarto grado, dejo la escuela para ayudarle a sus padres con el cuidado de ganado y procesar la leche, así también  cuando se casó ayudaba a su esposo pero él ya falleció, pero juntos tuvieron 6 hijos, pero 3 de ellos ya no viven con ella y los otros 3 estudian.

Leonor, se dedica a la crianza de ganado desde que era adolescente, porque le ayudaba a sus padres, también aprendió a  ordeñar  y a elaborar lácteos; actualmente tiene una vaca que ordeña y una vaquilla que espera cría y la leche la procesa y vende la cuajada y la mantequilla y la leche  por botellas.

Leonor, necesita el préstamo para comprar una vaca lechera para la producción de leche y para producir queso para la venta, ella cuenta con las herramientas y el conocimiento necesario para   hacerlos y es por eso que quiere poner en práctica sus conocimientos.  

Leonor, sueña con aumentar la producción de lácteos, porque  mucha demanda de  sus clientes y de sus vecinos cercanos, para aumentar su patrimonio y la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Leonor is a 55 year old entrepreneur woman. She attended school until the 4th grade. She stopped going to school to help her parents care for the cattle and to process the milk. When she got married, she also helped her husband, but he passed away. They had 6 children, 3 of them do not live with her, the other 3 attend school. Leonor makes a living raising cattle since she was a teenager because she used to help her parents. She also learned to milk the cows and make dairy products. Currently, she has a dairy cow and a pregnant heifer and she process the milk, sells the milk curd, the butter and the milk in bottles.

Leonor needs the loan to purchase a dairy cow to produce milk and cheese to sell. She has the necessary tools and the knowledge to do this and she would like to put into practice her knowledge. Leonor dreams of increasing the production of dairy products because there is a lot of demand from her customers and neighbors, and of increasing her assets and the quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow to produce milk and cheese to sell.

loans.name: Narciza Elizabeth

texts.es: Narcisa con 43 años de edad  es una madre soltera tiene un hijo de 16 años Samuel está estudiando en una unidad educativa cerca del sector donde vive, con muchas ganas de surgir hace 16 años atrás se dedica a la crianza de pollos y gallinas de campo que han permitido compensar la alimentación y educación del hogar sin que Narcisa descuide a su hijo por salir a trabajar a otro lugar. Ella requiere el dinero para construir un nuevo galpón para estas aves ya que el anterior esta sumamente deteriorado se filtra el agua en épocas de invierno y mueren algunos de los pollos significando menos dinero de ingresos para esta humilde mujer y su hijo.
texts.en: Narcisa is 43 years old. She is a single mother of a 16 year old son, Samuel, who is studying in an educational unit close to where they live. Sixteen years ago with the desire to get ahead she started to work raising native chickens and hens. This has allowed her to offset the food and education of her household without Narcisa having to neglect her son going to work in another place. She needs the money to construct a new shed for the poultry as the old one is very dilapidated. Water filters in during the winter and some of the chickens die which means less income for this humble woman and her son.

loans.use: to build a new shed for her chickens.

loans.name: Lina Camila

texts.es:
Lina es un joven de tan solo 22 años, Lina se ha convertido en todo una dama, una persona responsable, educada, organizada, a pesar de tener un hijo de 6 años de edad, supo administrar su tiempo y actividades, no se dejó opacar por ser madre con 16 años de edad, busco un trabajo, encontró la forma de estudiar y trabajar y sigue adelante, sacando a su hijo adelante, ganándose el sustento diario y preparándose para la vida profesional.
Lina se dedica a vender mercancía, con esta profesión ha podido apoyarse monetariamente, espera seguir realizando este trabajo y ser empleada al mismo tiempo.
Lina se encuentra solicitando un préstamo para comprar ropa de dama, accesorios y pijamas.
texts.en:
Lina, 22, is quite a young lady: polite, responsible, organized.  She successfully manages her time and work schedule while still taking care of her 6-year old son.  Despite having a child when she was only 16 years old she soldiered on, finding time to both work and continue her schooling.  

Lina operates a business selling personal products and says that she has supported herself with her earnings. She hopes to have a paid career and continue her business too.  For now, she is applying for a loan that she will use to buy women's clothing, accessories and pajamas.

loans.use: to stock her retail business.

loans.name: Afiwa

texts.fr: Mère d’un enfant, Afiwa est une veuve femme  âgée de 62 ans qui vit à Adidogomé. Afiwa est une revendeuse de bananes torréfiées qu’elle achète quatre fois par mois au marché  et les revendent à la devanture de son domicile. Afiwa sollicite ce prêt pour commander des sacs de bananes plantains afin d’augmenter son stock puis gagner plus de bénéfices en vue de soutenir sa famille dans les différentes charges et permettre une bonne éducation à son enfant.
texts.en:
The mother of one child, Afiwa is a widow aged 62 who lives in Adidogomé. She sells roasted plantains that she buys four times a month at the market. She resells them in front of her house.

Afiwa is requesting this loan to order some sacks of plantains so as to grow her stock and earn more profit. She aims to cover her family's various expenses and permit her child to get a good education.

loans.use: to buy two sacks of plantains.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a married woman. She has two children. She describes herself to be polite and humble. She operates a retail business where she sells bananas. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be price changes.

Josephine will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy more stock of bananas. Her business goal is to have a large-scale business within five years. She will save the anticipated profits for building a house.

loans.use: to buy more stock of bananas

loans.name: Sabina

texts.en: Sabina lives with her family in the capital of Tajikistan. She is very kind and smart girl. Sabina is 19 years old. She is not married. Sabina has graduated school successfully and she has applied to the National University of Tajikistan. Sabina now is a student of the 2nd course. She is one of the smart students in her group and she always tries to be ready for home-tasks. Sabina is asking for a loan of 10000 Somoni to pay for the university tuition. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to pay for her university tuition.

loans.name: Jose Eduardo

texts.es:
José, es casado, él y su esposa tiene 41 años de edad, tienen dos hijos de 4 y 17 años de edad, por el momento su pareja no trabaja, es propietario de un taller de reparación de vehículos, su hijo mayor le apoya para desarrollar las actividades del negocio, aprendió el oficio con la ayuda de un tío, desde hace 20 años cuenta con su propio negocio que atiende de lunes a sábado, con un horario de 7:00 am. a 5:30 pm.
El préstamo le servirá para comprar repuestos automotrices como: fajas, baterías, filtros y herramientas para perfeccionar su trabajo, pretende cubrir las demandas que hacen sus clientes en un menor tiempo.
Tiene la esperanza que con la ayuda que Padecomsm le brinda podrá tener un nivel económico favorable para salir adelante con su familia.
texts.en:
José is married. He and his wife are 41 years old. They have two children aged 4 and 17 years old. At present his wife is not working. He is the owner of a car repair shop and his oldest son helps him to carry out the work in the business. He learned the trade with the help of an uncle. For 20 years he has had his own shop that he looks after from Monday to Saturday with a timetable from 7 am until 5:30 pm.

The loan will allow him to buy automotive parts like belts, batteries, filters and tools to improve his work. He wants fill the needs of his clients in less time. He hopes that with the support Padecomsm provides he can have an economic standard that will allow him to get ahead with his family.

loans.use: to buy automotive parts like belts, batteries, filters and tools to improve his work.

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es:
Luis Alberto es un joven emprendedor de 21 años de edad que actualmente se encuentra solicitando un apoyo para iniciar un negocio de distribución de productos lácteos, un negocio que toma por necesidad ya que tiene la responsabilidad de mantener a su hermosa hija de tan solo 20 meses de edad. 
Aunque inicia de 0, tiene una meta trazada, crecer, sacar adelante su familia y en un futuro tener una casa propia.
Ahora Luis Alberto en el afán de iniciar rápido su negocio, necesita un dinero para comprar surtido de productos lácteos en grandes cantidades.
texts.en: Luis Alberto, 21, is an enterprising young man.  He is applying for a loan that he will use to start a business selling bulk supplies of milk.  He has a beautiful 20-month old daughter and needs an income to support her.  Even though he's starting from scratch, he has a defined plan for moving ahead: grow his business, support his family and own a house of his own one day.  For now, Luis Alberto needs to quickly set up his business.  He will use the loan to buy wholesale supplies of milk for resale.

loans.use: to start a business selling bulk supplies of milk.

loans.name: Zyinat

texts.ru: Зыйнат, 51 год, замужем, у нее среднее образование. Зыйнат в качестве дохода для своей семьи, 15 лет занимается животноводством и полеводством. В хозяйстве Зыйнат на сегодняшний день имеется 7 коров, 14 овец, лошадь. На 1,0 Га земли она выращивает кукурузу. Ежемесячная прибыль Зыйнат составляет 20,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Зыйнат обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота. Зыйнат доходы от кредита планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение хозяйства и хочет облагородить территорию дома.
texts.en: Zyinat is 51 years old, married, and has a secondary education. Zyinat has been rearing animals and growing crops for 15 years to get income for her family. Today Zyinat has seven cows, 14 sheep, and a horse. She grows corn on 1.0 hectares of land. Zyinat's monthly profit is 20,000 som (KGS). In order to develop her business further, Zyinat has applied to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 150,000 som (KGS) to buy some livestock. Zyinat plans to invest the proceeds of the loan in further growing her farm and wants to improve her house.

loans.use: to buy some livestock in order to increase her herd.

loans.name: Afi Marie

texts.fr: Veuve et mère de d’un enfant, Afi est une femme âgée de 60 ans résidant à Adidogomé. Afi est une revendeuse de fruits qui s’approvisionnent deux fois par mois au marché et le revend au bord de la route à la devanture d’une église. Afi sollicite ce prêt pour commander des paniers de bananes et des sacs d’ananas en vue de bien vendre puis d’aider son enfant dans son éducation scolaire et aux charges quotidiennes éprouvées par la famille.
texts.en:
The widowed mother of one child, Afi is 60 years old and lives in Adidogomé. Afi sells fruit and stocks up twice a month at a market. She resells her fruit beside a street in front of a church.

Afi is asking for this loan to order some baskets of bananas and sacks of pineapple. Her goal is to have a good turnover and then help her child with his schooling and with the day-to-day expenses of the family.

loans.use: to buy 15 sacks of pineapples and three baskets of bananas.

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Nasreen is a fifty two year old married woman living along with her spouse and children in the backward area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her family members run a single business, sewing bags, and each family member is assigned a specific task according to their experience. Nasreen sews bags along with her daughter, one of her sons fixes buckles and her husband sells then from his store. In this way her family generates money through their mutual efforts.

Nowadays the household expenses and the children's basic requirements have increased and they need to be fulfill by generating more income. Nasreen wants to increase the stock of the day to day raw materials available so her family members can sew more bags and can earn maximum profits from their efforts. Due to a lack of availability of funds, Nasreen requested a Kiva loan through BRAC Pakistan, so that she can buy Rexene (PU leather), buckles and zippers for sewing ladies' shoulder bags. Then her husband can sell them from from his bag store.

Nasreen seems very happy after receiving this loan and will be very thankful to lenders for supporting her.

loans.use: to buy rexene, buckles and zippers for sewing school bags and ladies' shoulder bags with the help of her family members.

loans.name: Alfred

texts.en:
Alfred is a married man. He has four children. He describes himself to be God-fearing. He operates a transport business where he transports customers using his motorcycle. He has been involved in this business for 10 years. His business is located in a busy area and his primary customers are locals.

Alfred describes his biggest business challenge to be the rainy season which affects business. He will use the Kes 60,000 loan to buy another motorcycle. He hopes that in the future, he will have a good business. This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. His previous loans were repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy another motorcycle.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is a married woman. She has three children. She describes herself to be patient. She operates a retail business where she sells beverages and various food snacks. She has been involved in this business for one year. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are locals.

Judith describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital to enable her to expand her growing business. She will use the Kes 120,000 loan to buy more stock of beverages and snacks. Her business goal is to have a big retail shop within five years.

Judith hopes that in the future, the business will expand and she will be able to send her children to good schools. This is her fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loans were repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to cater for family needs.

loans.use: to buy more stock of beverages and snacks.

loans.name: Iguad Viteri

texts.es: Flavio tiene 23 años de edad de estado civil soltero, vive con sus padres que tienen avanzada edad y su hermano Cristian de 12 años  al que ayuda para que  asista  a estudiar  en una unidad educativa del sector. El empezó hace doce años atrás en su país natal Colombia a criar pollos y gallos luego tuvieron que abandonar su casa por la difícil situación que transformo la tranquilidad familiar en ese entonces,  vino en calidad de refugiado,  a tratar de salir adelante en este país, continua con mucho esfuerzo y constancia con su pequeño negocio que es su única fuente de ingresos. Flavio necesita el dinero para poder comprar más gallos, balanceado, y vitaminas obtener  dinero para ayudar a su hermano en el estudio para que tenga mayores oportunidades en la vida.
texts.en: Flavio is a 23 year-old bachelor who lives with his elderly parents and his 12 year-old brother Cristian, who he helps so that he can attend school in the locality. Flavio began raising chickens twelve years ago in his home country of Colombia but the family had to leave their home because of the difficult situation in that time period. He immigrated as a refugee to try to get ahead in Ecuador and he continues, with great effort and consistency, in his small business, which is his only source of income. Flavio needs this loan to be able to buy more chickens, chicken feed and vitamins to obtain money to help his younger brother at school so that he will have better opportunities in his life.

loans.use: to buy chickens, feed and vitamins.

loans.name: Zam

texts.en:
Zam is requesting for a new loan to help her to buy cassava flour and general merchandise, such as salt and sugar to sell.She is a very loyal customer to Hofokam and she is very keen in making her repayments on time. She is a 44-year-old, hardworking, single mother, living in Fort Portal, Uganda. She operates a retail shop as well as selling fire wood and charcoal.She also trades in agricultural produce such as beans and cassava flour so as to earn extra income.

She began the business 14 years back with the aim of educating her children and with this business she has since reaped tangible benefits. Price fluctuations is her major hardship, while her dream is to trade in whole sale and construct a good permanent residential house.

loans.use: to buy cassava flour and general merchandise, such as salt and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Tasleem

texts.en:
Tasleem is 40-years old, married, and has one child. She lives in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.
She requested a loan from BRAC Pakistan for her brother. He is a shoe maker and very expert in his profession. He has been manufacturing baby's shoes for many year and has a lot experience in his profession. He sews Rexine (imitation leather) shoes through a machine and attaches the sole through hand stitching. He recently got a huge contract but he does not have enough funds to buy the raw material such as Rexene, threads, glue, sole etc, to complete the contract.

Tasleem's brother will use the loan to buy raw material for shoe making and also she will thank to Kiva and field partner Brac pakistan.

loans.use: to buy raw material such as Rexine, threads, glue, soles, etc. for her brother's  shoe making business.

loans.name: Thuy

texts.en: Mrs. Thuy is 25 years old. She is married and has two children. She has operated a fish selling business for the past five years.
