She would like to borrow the loan to build a latrine, which can help to improve the living condition and health for her family. Her income is mainly from business and fishing so they have regular monthly income to repay the loan as scheduled.

loans.use: to build the latrine to improve the health of her family.

loans.name: Natali

texts.es:
Natali es una persona emprendedora, sagaz, inteligente y creativa que supo sortear las dificultades que se le presentaron en su vida, a pesar de no haber tenido oportunidades de empleo, está valiente joven no se rindió y busco alternativas para generar ingresos, monto una papelería y con estrategias de publicidad, marca propia ha generado en sus clientes confianza y expectativa, obteniendo una rápida acogida y fidelidad.
Ella es madre de un pequeño de 18 meses de edad, su propósito es ser una empresaria exitosa y darle una gran vida a su niño.
Para crecer y seguir generando confiabilidad y buenos comentarios con sus clientes la señora Natali quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra de surtido de papelería en grandes cantidades.
texts.en:
Natali is an enterprising young woman, smart and creative.  She knows how to overcome the problems that life presents and despite having few opportunities for paid work, she has never given up looking for ways to support herself.  She started her own office & school supplies business and has quickly built a loyal set of customers who rely on her honesty and competence.  

Natali has an 18-month old baby and her goal is to become a successful businesswoman and earn the money she needs to support her little boy.  For now, she is applying for a loan that she will use to buy merchandise for her office & school supplies business.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her office & school supplies business.

loans.name: Emi

texts.en:
Emi is a 59-year-old widow with one son. She has been selling food around the village for fifteen years. She has asked for a loan of IDR 6.000,000 from KPP-UMKM Syariah. This loan will be used to build water source at their home to improve access to clean water and sanitation for their family. Her family income is insufficient to build toilets and water sources but Emi will be able to repay the loan received.
She and her family want to live a healthy life with healthy sanitation and clean water. She is very grateful for the opportunity and wants to thank to all lenders.

loans.use: This loan will be used to build water source for a toilet at their home to improve access to clean water and sanitation  for their family.

loans.name: Optimism Group

texts.en:
Mai is 44 years old and married with two children. 
Mrs. Mai has been operating a food stall selling fish for more than ten years. 
She lives in Dong Son district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.
Her family is a low-income household in the village; moreover, the market need is low in this region. The income from this business is unstable because the price and the amount of fish are related to the weather conditions.
The main hardship that Mai faces in her business is the lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase more fish to resell.
In 2010, Mai joined Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution to improve her business. Mai has successfully repaid one loan from Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution. She is the group leader of "Optimism", which consists of nine members.
In the future, Mai hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to find good jobs.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to resell for increasing her income and improving her living standard.

loans.name: Saltanat

texts.ru: Салтанат успешно погасила свой кредит, использовав его по назначению. она благодарна Фонду Кива и всем, кто откликнулся и помог ей в финансировании. На сегодняшний день у Салтанат имеется товар на 800,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Салтанат обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) для покупки продуктов питания для расширения ассортимента в магазине. В прошлом году благодаря доходам от бизнеса Салтанат удалось достроить дом. Теперь доходы от кредита она планирует вложить в образование ее сына.
texts.en: Saltanat successfully repaid her loan, having used it for its intended purpose. She is grateful to the Kiva fund and to everyone who responded and helped to finance her. Today Saltanat has goods worth 800,000 som (KGS). In order to develop her business further, Saltanat has applied to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 150,000 som (KGS) to buy food products to increase the range in her shop. Last year thanks to the income from the business Saltanat was able to finish building her house. Now she plans to invest the proceeds of the loan in her son's education.

loans.use: to increase the range of goods in her shop.

loans.name: Maria Sofia

texts.es:
María, tiene como fuente de ingresos la venta de comida, está casada, tiene cinco hijos, tres de los cuales ya son independientes, vive con su esposo y dos de sus hijos, el negocio lo tiene desde hace 12 años y está ubicado en el mercado municipal de su localidad, atiende el negocio con ayuda de sus hijos.
Requiere de un financiamiento para comprar de contado una cocina para tener un mejor equipo de trabajo para preparar la comida que vende, considera que es de mayor beneficio hacer uso de un crédito que adquirir el articulo por pagos en una casa comercial, espera que la afluencia de clientes se mantenga para poder resarcir la deuda sin problemas.
Su sueño es enseñar a sus hijos solteros a trabajar para que no sean dependientes y se forjen un buen futuro.
texts.en: María's source of income is food sales. She is married and has five children, three of whom are already ion their own. She lives with her husband and two of their children. She has had her business for twelve years and it is located in the city market of her town, where she runs the business with the help of her children. She needs a loan to buy a cook stove with cash in order to have better equipment to prepare the food she sells. She believes it will be more beneficial to use a loan than to buy the stove on time-payments through a store. She expects that the flow of clients will continue so that she will be able to repay the debt without problems. María's dream is to teach her unmarried children to work so that they will be self-sufficient and will forge a bright future.

loans.use: to pay cash for a cook stove in order to have better equipment to prepare the food that she sells

loans.name: Rosa Elena

texts.es:
Rosa es una mujer luchadora que se dedica a vender tortillas para poder cubrir las necesidades de sus tres hijos, ella es madre soltera, el oficio lo aprendió de familia, debido a la necesidad de tener recursos económicos decidió fundar su negocio propio.
Invertirá su crédito en una plancha industrial y en maíz, le permitirá continuar vendiendo tortillas  y atraer más clientes a su negocio, espera adquirir experiencia en el uso de créditos para poder progresar.
La visión que ella tiene es mantener su negocio con vida, tener estabilidad financiera y resarcir la deuda adquirida.
texts.en: Rosa is a hard-working woman who operates a tortillas sales business to support her three children.  She is a single mother.  She grew up selling tortillas and started her own business when she needed a means of providing for her family.  She will use this loan to buy maize and an industrial-sized press for her business.  The investment will allow her to grow her sales and her income.  She also hopes to gain experience using credit to move her business ahead.  Her goals for the future are to build her business, gain a steady income and pay off the debt that she is taking on.

loans.use: to buy supplies, including an industrial-sized press, for making tortillas.

loans.name: Magu Group

texts.en:
Bibiana,who is in her early 30's is married with two kids,one of them is in school while the rest is still a small. She has been running a retail shop for four years now. She is working hard,at 06am to 09pm daily and is able to earn a good monthly profit.

This will be Bibiana's 2nd loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.She used the previous credit to increase her shop stocks and is managed to repay all her loan successfully. She is happy with the loan. She used the profit to make loan repayments,to pay school fees for her kid, saved some in her bank account and to take care of her family.

She requests another credit's from Tujijenge Tanzania a partner of Kiva lender's to increase her shop stocks and serve more people.She dreams of expanding her business to cover each customer.
Bibiana will share this loan with her loan group MAGU which consists of two members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to increase her shop stocks and serve more people

loans.name: Racheal

texts.en: Racheal is a married woman. She has 1 child. She describes herself to be ambitious. She operates a retail business where she sells livestock. She has been involved in this business for 1 years. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be drought which affects livestock. She will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy more livestock. Her business goal is to open a butchery within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will expand business. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to cater for her family needs.

loans.use: to buy more livestock

loans.name: Olga Marìa

texts.es: Olga tiene  43 años  de edad, tiene 2 hijos Byron de 21 años trabaja como cargador para ayudar a su madre, Johana de 22 es discapacitada, hace doce años atrás enviudo, es  muy fuerte y trabajadora se dedica a criar pavos este pequeño negocio ayudado a que no les falte el plato de comida durante estos últimos años y permanezca Junto a Johana que necesita cuidados especiales. Olga requiere el dinero para comprar maíz, balanceado, pavos aumentaría así sus ventas y por ende sus ingresos para seguir cubriendo la alimentación  de ella y sus hijos.
texts.en: Olga, 43, has two children: Byron, 21, works hauling freight to help his mom and Johana, 22, has a disability.  Olga has been a widow for 12 years.  She has worked hard to build a business raising and selling turkeys and her earnings from the business cover the family's expenses and provide the special care that Johana needs.  Olga is applying for a loan that she will use to buy maize, feed and more birds so that she can grow her business and increase her sales.  The investment will allow her to carry on her business and provide for her family.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her farming and animal sales business.

loans.name: Nga

texts.en: Mrs. Nga is a hardworking woman, 38 years old. She is married and has two children. Her family’s income is mainly from fishing. She would like to borrow the loan to build a latrine, which can help to improve the health of her family’s member. With support from her husband, she is able to repay the loan monthly.

loans.use: to build the latrine to improve the health of her family.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en: Nenita is a widow. Nenita is 55 years old, residing at Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines.Nenita sells processed meat products, including longanisa and tocino, in the local community to earn a living and she has been five years in this business. Each month, she earns 8,000 PHP doing this business. She requested a loan of 15,000 PHP to purchase additional meat to sell.In 2012, Nenita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase meats for processing.

loans.name: Fayza

texts.en:
Fayza is 37, married, and has two children.

She has a small poultry business (chickens and ducks). She raises the poultry for one cycle and sells them after buying medication and feed for them.

Fayza is requesting an EGP 5,000 loan to buy more ducks and chickens, feed, and medication for her small business.

loans.use: to buy more ducks and chickens, feed, and medication.

loans.name: Orn's Grup Group

texts.en: Orn’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Orn makes a living cultivating rice and he also does extra work as factory laborer to support his family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these woman and man to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer is a 28-year-old resident of Gata Daku, Clarin. She's married and runs a banana plantation business for a living.

At present, she applies for a loan at GDMPC microfinance to buy fertilizer. She hopes to improve her business someday.. .

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her banana farm.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is a married man with 4 children. He describes himself to be ambitious. He operates a restaurant and he has been involved in this business for 12 years. His business is located in a busy area and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be the high cost of products.

He will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy more ingredients for preparing food. His business goal is to open more outlets within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will educate his children to university level.

This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. His previous loans were repaid successfully. He will use the anticipated profits to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients for preparing food.

loans.name: Kamene

texts.en:
Kamene is a married woman with 5 children. She describes herself to be ambitious. She operates a restaurant and she has been involved in this business for 12 years. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the high cost of products.

She will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more ingredients for preparing food. She hopes that in the future, she will educate her children to university level.

This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to expand the business further.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients for preparing food.

loans.name: Bintiali

texts.en:
Bintiali is a married woman. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a retail business where she sells snacks, onions, and other vegetables. Her business is located in a rural area and her primary customers are locals.

She will use the KES 60,000 loan to buy more stocks of vegetables. Her business goal is to have a wholesale business within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will be successful.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of vegetables.

loans.name: Magaly Cristabel

texts.es:
Magaly, administra una tienda en la que ofrece a sus vecinos azúcar, aceite, jabón, sal, etc., desarrolla esta actividad desde hace más de cinco años y ya cuenta con la preferencia de sus clientes, es la forma como ella genera entradas de dinero, vive con su esposo e hijos, no tiene ayuda económica del extranjero.
Para incrementar el inventario de la tienda solicita un crédito con el que comprara jugos, gaseosas, boquitas, huevos, granos básicos, etc., tendrá mayores alternativas de compra para sus clientes, ella pretende cubrir las necesidades que sus clientes tengan, ya que de esta manera sus ganancias serán mayores.
Sus aspiraciones son atender mejor a sus clientes y ser un ejemplo para que sus hijos puedan ser personas honestas y responsables.
texts.en:
Magaly administers a store that offers sugar, oil, soap, salt, etc. to her neighbors. She has had this business for more than five years and she now has the preference of her clients. It is her way of generating income. She lives with her husband and children and has no economic support from abroad.

To increase the inventory of her store she is requesting a loan which she will use to buy juice, soft drinks, snacks, eggs, basic grains, etc. to have more alternatives for her clients to buy. She hopes to fill the needs of her customers as doing this her profits will be greater.

Her ambition is to serve her customers better and be an example so that her children become honest and responsible people.

loans.use: to buy juice, soft drinks, snacks, eggs, basic grains, etc. to have more alternatives for her clients to buy.

loans.name: Ayuba

texts.en:
Ayuba is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Ayuba is thankful that the days of poor yields are long gone. As a Babban Gona member, he has the opportunity to achieve yields of up to 8 metric tons of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times the yield of the average Nigerian farmer.

Traditionally, Ayuba would have had to sell his maize for low prices at harvest to meet his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Ayuba will store the maize he harvests and delay its sale until a later date in the season. He can then obtain a significantly higher price for his maize at a premium up to 37% more than the harvest price.

With the opportunity to earn up to $2000/Ha, Ayuba now has the opportunity to actualize his dream to grow his agriculture business for himself and family members and would like to use this additional income to build a house for his family.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: America Libertad

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal PITUSIRAY,el banco está ubicado en el distrito de Calca ,provincia de Calca y departamento de Cusco.
La socia America Libertad continua dedicándose a ejercer su carrera de docente en uno de los colegios de la zona, la socia se siente agradecido por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, también la socia sigue con su negocio de venta de ropa para sus clientes que le solicitan, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de chompas entre otros.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the community bank PITUSIRAY. The bank is located in the district of Calca, in the province of Calca and department of Cusco.

The member, America Libertad, continues to make a living as a teacher in one of the schools in town. She is grateful for the loan that was granted to her and promises to complete the established repayments. She is a responsible and diligent person.

She also continues with her business of selling clothing for customers who request it, since this is the way she gets her family ahead in life. She is asking for the loan in order to buy sweaters, among other items.

loans.use: to buy sweaters among other things.

loans.name: Yosep Steven

texts.es: El socio Yosep Steven se sigue dedicando al negocio de compra y venta de ropa, el socio vende pantalones, blusas y chompas, el socio por medio de este negocio quiere sacar adelante a sus hijos, el socio es un hombre emprendedor , el sueño del socio es tener un local donde pueda vender la ropa. El socio solicita el crédito para comprar pantalones, blusas y chompas.
texts.en:
Yosep Steven continues with his business of buying and selling clothes. He sells pants, blouses, and sweaters. It is through this business that he wants to get his children ahead.

He is an enterprising man.

His dream is to have a place where he is able to sell clothes.

He is requesting the loan to buy pants, blouses, and sweaters.

loans.use: to buy pants, blouses, and sweaters.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a 19-year-old married mother of one child, who decided fourteen months ago to start her own beauty business. She runs the business from her house to support her husband who gets a limited monthly salary and help him in providing for their family's increasing living needs.

Mariam quit school during her intermediate classes, and got married at an early age. She got a good experience in the tattoo business and became skillful in her domain.

Since she got a good reputation in her domain, she is acquiring a YOUTH loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, to buy an updated tattoo machine that will help her develop her business and reply to customers' diversified needs.

She hopes that one day she can open a beauty salon where she can provide her specialized tattoo beauty services.

loans.use: to buy an updated tattoo machine that will help her develop her business and reply to customers' diversified needs.

loans.name: Agali Awamu Dev Group Kisangani Namasuba

texts.en:
Beatrice is a repeat client with UGAFODE Microfinance Ltd. (MDI). She applied for a loan of 700,000 UGX. She is a married woman with children.

She is a businesswoman making clothes. In a bid to increase her working capital/expand on the business, she has applied for a loan of 700,000 UGX. However, she is faced with a challenge of competition and lack of enough capital.

She is very grateful for the support that UGAFODE Microfinance and Kiva lenders offered to her, since she is now able to fund her business.

loans.use: to add in more capital for her clothes-making business.

loans.name: Leonard

texts.en:
Leonard is a married man with 5 children. He describes himself to be God fearing. He operates a mini movie theater. He has been involved in this business for 7 years. His business is located in a rural area and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be power outages.

He will use the KES 70,000 loan to buy a new video machine and a bigger power generator. He hopes that in the future, he will be prosperous. He will use the anticipated profits to educate his children.

loans.use: to buy a new video machine and a bigger power generator.

loans.name: Claris

texts.en:
Claris is a married woman. She has 5 children. She describes herself as God-fearing. She operates a food café. She has been involved in this business for 6 years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals.

She will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy more utensils for café use. Her business goal is to open a hotel within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will educate her children to university level.

This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to purchase an additional stock of utensils.

loans.use: to buy more utensils for café use.

loans.name: Sakina

texts.en:
Sakina is a 50-year-old widow. Her son (the man shown with her above) operates a construction business, which is the primary source of their income. He is responsible for building the roofs of houses during their construction. In this way, he is able to earn a sufficient income to provide for their family.

However, in order to meet the everyday household expenditures, more income is required. For the growth of her son's business, Sakina has requested a loan of 50,000 PKR. This will allow him to purchase good quality timber, metal, and slate so he can meet his customers’ demands without any delays.

loans.use: to purchase good quality timber, metal, and slate so her son can meet his customers’ demands without any delays.

loans.name: Penjani

texts.en:
Penjani is 30 years old. He is married with one three-year-old child. At the present time, Penjani runs four Zoona mobile money outlets, and he is looking to keep this momentum going as this will improve his standard of living as well as that of his wife and child. His main objective is to make easy, quick and mostly safe money transfer facilities accessible to everyone in the rural communities of Zambia, and to increase the footprint of his Zoona business in the Eastern region of Zambia.

Currently, Penjani uses the revenue generated by his Zoona outlets to generate capital in order to expand his business and be a source of employment in his community. He is also looking to purchase a home for himself and his family, as well as further his education, thus empowering himself so that he is able to plough all his future skill and knowledge back into his business.

Being able to run his own business by having been able to open these Zoona outlets has allowed Penjani to keep his family afloat. However, he is now looking to build on that capital base and progressively have his outlets become a more lucrative, sustainable business solution. This would ensure the long-term comfort and peace of mind of himself and those who depend on him, including his family as well as a large part of his community.

A huge challenge for Penjani are the constant float shortages he currently experiences, especially when assisting a client who needs to send a large sum of money. This results in him losing clients to other mobile money transfer competitors and also results in his clients losing faith in his services. It also results in him having to close his outlets early and send clients home because he is unable to assist them. These are not the values he wishes to embody nor is it the type of rapport he wants to build with his clients and community members.

On a broader spectrum, Penjani would like to be able to give back to his community by not only creating employment opportunities and thus helping others achieve the same peace of mind he now currently enjoys, but also by being a viable, trustworthy alternative in a country where banking is simply too expensive for most of the working class. This would not only save his community members' time, but it would also lower their expenses as this would reduce the need to travel long distances in order to send and receive money. One of his objectives is to take safe money transfer facilities to the community, and clients no longer having to spend on travel would make this a reality as well as improve the overall customer experience. He would like to increase his Zoona footprint in the Southern region of Zambia and eventually expand into his home town, Kitwe.

Zoona has done market research and in so doing have found that the locations in which Penjani is looking to open new outlets would be ideal not only for employment opportunities for those communities, but also to generate the traction he envisions for his business.

At the present time, Penjani does not have the necessary capital needed to execute his vision and objective. Connecting with Kiva lenders would jump start his endeavour while simultaneously jump starting opportunities for future employees who are also looking to become entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to generate enough capital to expand his Zoona mobile money transfer business into more locations.

loans.name: Rudis Evenilson

texts.es:
Rudis vive con su esposa y una hija de 7 años de edad, aprendió de sus padres a cultivar granos básicos, desde hace 8 años lo está haciendo de manera independiente, su horario de trabajo es de ocho de la mañana a cinco de la tarde, cuando recoge las cosechas de maíz y frijol almacena para poder alimentar a su familia y otra parte la comercializa con sus clientes ya establecidos.
Invertirá el capital en la compra de fertilizantes, fungicidas y fóliales, espera poder incrementar la producción de maíz, pues la época de lluvia es bastante favorable en éste momento.
Sus sueños son continuar mejorando su negocio para tener estabilidad económica y brindar a su familia una vida con menos carencia.
texts.en: Rudis lives with his wife and a daughter of seven years of age. He learned from his parents how to grow basic crops and he has been farming independently for eight years. His work hours are from eight in the morning to five in the afternoon. When he harvests his crop of corn and beans, he stores part of it away to be able to feed his family and sells the rest to established clients. He will invest the loan in the purchase of fertilizers, fungicides and foliar sprays. He hopes to be able to increase his production of corn, since the rainy season looks quite favorable right now. His dreams are to continue improving his business in order to have economic stability and to give his family a life with less scarcity.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, fungicides and foliar sprays to be able to increase his corn production

loans.name: Margarito Antonio

texts.es:
Margarito, es un joven trabajador y muy honrado, está acompañado y es padre de 2 hijos, en su casa viven sus padres a quien él apoya mucho en los trabajos agrícolas y también en la panadería porque es el sustento para su familia. 

Margarito, se dedica a la agricultura desde muy joven, porque su padre le enseño el trabajo y desde entonces es su principal fuente de ingresos para su familia.

El dinero del préstamo será destinado para comprar insumos agrícolas como abono y fertilizantes que serán usados para la milpa y que pueda dar una buena cosecha.

Margarito, sueña con conocer las personas que le ayudaron para recaudar los fondos para su préstamo.
texts.en:
Margarito is a hardworking and very honest young man. He is in a relationship and is the father of 2 children. His parents lives in his house, and he supports them a lot with farming and also in the bakery, because it is how he supports his family.

Margarito has worked in farming from a very young age, because his father taught him the work. Since then, it has been the primary source of income for his family.

The money from the loan will be used to buy agricultural inputs such as compost and fertilizers, that will be used for the cornfield, so that it can yield a good harvest.

Margarito dreams about meeting the people who helped him raise money for his loan.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs such as compost and fertilizers that will be used for the cornfield so that it can yield a good harvest.

loans.name: 2 De Enero Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “2 DE ENERO”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Santa Ana, perteneciente a la provincia de La Convención y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Natalia ella es soltera y tiene 26 años y tiene 1 hijo; La socia trabaja en su negocio de venta de restaurant, la socia realiza diferentes platos como pollo al horno, sopas y saltados de carne, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 8 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener un restaurant. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar productos para cocinar como arroz, verduras y pollo.
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de agricultura, negocio de venta de ropa, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de comida.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The group members belong to the community bank "JANUARY 2"; this bank is located in the district of Santa Ana, in the province of La Convencion and department of Cusco.

The member requesting a loan is Natalia, who is a 26 year old single woman with one child. She works in a restaurant making different dishes including baked chicken, soups and saltados (traditional beef dishes). Natalia works from 8:00 am to 6:00 pm, and has been working in the business for 8 years and is doing very well. Her dream is to have her own restaurant one day. She is requesting a loan to buy cooking products such as rice, vegetables, and chicken.

The other partners are in the business of agriculture, clothing sales, grocery stores, and food sales.

Natalia is grateful to those who contribute to her dream through this platform, and agrees to comply with the payment of her dues by the deadline.

loans.use: to buy cooking ingredients such as rice, vegetables, and chicken.

loans.name: Bernard

texts.en:
Bernard is a married man. He has two children. He operates a farm where he grows tomatoes and eggplants. He has been involved in this business for three years.

His business is located locally to his primary customers, who are regular. He hopes that in the future, he will supply farm produce in a wider market. He says that his biggest business challenge is price changes of commodities.

This is Bernard's second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank, and he successfully repaid his previous loan. He will use this KES 50,000 loan to buy farm inputs and will use his anticipated profits to open a grocery store.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs.

loans.name: Candida Antonia

texts.es: Candida se dedica a la actividad de cría de cerdos. Solicita un préstamo de un millón cincuenta mil colones (₡ 1 050 000), para la compra de cerdos, que le permitirán aumentar su número de animales y de esta forma incrementar los ingresos familiares provenientes de esta actividad y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en: Candida makes her living raising pigs.  She is applying for a loan of one million fifty thousand colones (₡ 1 050 000), to buy pigs.  This will allow her to increase the number of animals she has, and in this way, increase the money the family earns from this business, and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Sezaltina

texts.en: Sezaltina has been involved in running her business since a few years ago. She started her business with her own working capital. Her business is pieces of wood. Sezaltina is married and her husband is an operator. Sezaltina has machines for cutting wood. So she is requesting a loan of $1,000 from Tuba Rai Metin to add with her capital, because she wants to buy additional materials, including trees, gasoline, oil, chain, split and spare parts for machine tools and other materials. She is happy because with the loan from Tuba Rai Metin, she can build her business so big in the future, and her income can be increased.

loans.use: to buy trees, gasoline, oil, chain, split and spare parts for machine tools and other materials.

loans.name: Blanca Esther

texts.es: Blanca tiene 55 años de edad, de estado civil divorciada, ella tiene 2 hijos, un hombre y una mujer de los cuales  viven con ella, y gracias al duro trabajo de su madre puede estudiar. Blanca vive en el sector rural y comenta que sus ingresos los obtiene de la venta de almuerzos, Blanca va a invertir el crédito en la compra de mas alimentos para incrementar negocio al que se dedica 20 años, su aspiración es lograr que sus hijos tengan una buena educación y pueda sacar un título profesional, y así seguir luchando por el bienestar de su familia.
texts.en:
Blanca, 55, is divorced and has 2 children; a son and daughter who both live with her. Thanks to her hard work both of her children are able to study.

Blanca lives in a rural area and she makes her income from selling lunches. She will invest the loan in buying more food to boost her business which she has been running for 20 years. Her aspiration is to ensure that her children have a good education and can get a professional degree. For this reason she will continue fighting for the well-being of her family.

loans.use: to buy food to expand her business.

loans.name: Miguel Dario

texts.es: Miguel tiene 20 años de edad, tiene un hijo, el pequeño Maickel de dos años de edad, Miguel es de estado civil soltero, es un padre responsable pues trabaja muy duro para darle lo necesario a su niño. Se dedica a la agricultura hace dos años, solicita el crédito para la siembra y cultivo de papas y así obtener ganancias para seguir cumpliendo con su responsabilidad de padre.
texts.en:
Miguel, aged 20, has a 2-year-old son called Maickel. He is single, and is a responsible and caring father who works hard to give his child the necessities.

He has been working in agriculture for the last two years, and is requesting a loan to buy seeds for cultivating potatoes so that he can earn a living in order to continue fulfilling his parental responsibilities.

loans.use: to plant and cultivate potatoes

loans.name: Julian

texts.es: Julián es un padre de familia, que todos los días trabaja para que a su familia no le haga falta nada, él cuenta que gracias al crédito pudo comprar sus materiales de construcción y su casa pudo construir con este avance él está contento mas no conforme porque falta una parte pero sus recursos económicos sean agotado, por esa razón solicita un nuevo préstamo para la compra de cemento y block. Su gran sueño es finalizar la construcción de su casa para que su familia tenga un mejor hogar.
texts.en: Julian is a head of household who works every day to be sure that his family doesn't want for anything, He says that, thanks to a previous loan, he was able to buy construction materials. He is happy that he was able to build his house with that loan but part of it was left incomplete. His funds ran out and for this reason he is asking for a new loan for the purchase of cement and cement blocks. His dream is to finish the construction of his house so that his family will have a better home.

loans.use: to buy materials such as cement and cement blocks.

loans.name: Deysi Marina

texts.es:
Deysi tiene 42 años, está casada con Ardulfo, con quien tiene 3 hijos, Su principal actividad económica es la agricultura, produce café certificado bajo los sellos Orgánico y Comercio Justo que vende en COCAFCAL de la cual es socia además Deysi es miembro activa de un grupo de mujeres donde procesan productos derivados del café, Deysi sueña con hacer crecer su grupo de mujeres no se limite solo a café y que sus ingresos sean buenos para mejorar la calidad de vida de todas sus miembros. 
Deysi es apasionada por los temas que se refieren a producir lo que consumimos es por eso que quiere construir un invernadero para producir tomates, Chile dulce y Pepinos que comercializara con el apoyo de su grupo de mujeres, la producción de alimentos en invernadero es una novedad en la región por que facilita la producción orgánica y mejora la calidad del alimento producido.
Deysi solicita un préstamo para comprar materiales para construir su invernadero en el cual producirá con el apoyo técnico de COCAFCAL tomates 100% orgánicos para venta en los mercados locales, con las ganancias obtenidas por el producto vendido Deysi espera mejorar las oportunidades de su familia y hacer crecer su grupo de mujeres.
texts.en:
Deysi, 42, is married to Arnulfo with whom she has three children. Her primary economic activity is agriculture. She grows coffee, certified under the seals of Organic and Fair Trade, which she sells in COCAFCAL of which she is a member. In addition, Deysi is also an active member of a group of women who process products derived from coffee. Deysi dreams about making her group of women grow so that they don't limit themselves only to coffee and that their income be good enough to improve the quality of life of all of its members.

Deysi is passionate about the topics that refer to producing what we eat and for this reason she wants to construct a green house to produce tomatoes, sweet peppers, and cucumbers which she will sell with the support of her group of women. The production of food in a greenhouse is news in the region because it facilitates organic production and improves the quality of the food produced.

Deysi is requesting a loan to purchase materials in order to construct her greenhouse in which she will grow, with the technical support of COCAFCAL, 100% organic tomatoes to sell in the local markets. With the earnings obtained from the product sold, Deysi hopes to improve the opportunities for her family and make her women's group grow.

loans.use: to buy an antivirus blanket, tomato plants, and organic supplies for the construction of a greenhouse.

loans.name: Chinyavu

texts.en:
Chinyavu is a married woman with six children. She describes herself as trustworthy. She operates a retail business where she sells processed tea leaves. She has been involved in this business for seven years.

Her business is located in a populated place and her primary customers are regular. Her business goal is to expand the business within five years. She says that her biggest business challenge is inadequate working capital.

This is Chinyavu's third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank, and she successfully repaid her previous loans. She will use this KES 100,000 loan to buy more tea leaves to sell.

Chinyavu will use her anticipated profits to improve her family's living standards. She hopes that in the future, she will expand the business and be able to support her family.

loans.use: to buy more tea leaves to sell.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David age 33, is a married man with 4 children living in Hoima, Uganda. He ventured into a very lucrative business of selling motor spare parts like super rockets and tires, among other items.

As a way of supplementing his income, he carries out farming of mainly maize. He has been able to recoup a lot of income to support his family. He has always desired to grow and expand his business and also educate his children to university.

He is seeking a loan facility to buy tires for sell.

loans.use: to buy tires for sell.

loans.name: San Hilarion Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “SAN HILARION”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Curahuasi, perteneciente a la provincia de Abancay y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Bertha ella es soltera y tiene 43 años y tiene 2 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de venta de cereales, la socia vende maiz,papa y quinua,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 4 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño del socio es tener un local donde pueda vender los cereales. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar papa, maíz y quinua.
La socia que esta pegada a la foto grupal se le tomo la foto despues de la reunion porque pidio permiso por motivos de trabajo.

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de animales, negocio de venta de cereales, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de comida.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en: The members of this group belong to the San Hilarion community bank. This bank is located in the district of Curahuasi, which belongs to the province of Abancay in the department of Cusco, Peru. One member is señora Berta, an unmarried woman of 43 years who has two children. She works in her business selling basic foods: she sells corn, potato and quinoa and works from 8 am to 5 pm. Señora Berta has been doing this for four years and her business is going quite well. Her dream is to have a stall where she can sell her products. She is asking for the loan to buy potatos, corn and quinoa. The group member at the lower left had her photo taken after the group meeting due to reasons of her work. The other members of this group earn their livings in animal sales, sale of cereals, a general store and food sales. Señora Bertha thanks those who form part of this dream through this organization and promises to comply with her payments on the loan according to the established dates.

loans.use: to buy potatoes, corn and quinoa.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a married woman with four children. She operates a retail business where she sells flour, rice, cooking oil, sugar and other items. She has been involved in this business for three years.

Her business is located in a marketable place and her primary customers are regular. She says that her biggest business challenge is low stock.

She will use this KES 40,000 loan to buy more sugar, bread, flour, salt and other items for her stock. She will use the anticipated profits to purchase additional items for her stock.

This is Mariam's second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. She successfully repaid her previous loan. She hopes that in the future, she will have better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy more sugar, bread, flour, salt and other items to sell.

loans.name: Kadzo

texts.en: Kadzo is a married woman. She has six children. She describes herself as patient. She operates a farm where she keeps livestock. She has been involved in this business for 15 years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of enough pasture. She will use the 60,000 KES loan to buy more livestock. Her business goal is to expand business within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will educate her children to university level. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to expand the business.

loans.use: to buy more livestock.

loans.name: Mupa

texts.en: Mupa is a married woman. She has three children. She describes herself to be God fearing. She operates a retail business in which she sells tomatoes, fruits and other vegetables. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be transport. She will use the 60,000 KES loan to buy more stock of vegetables and fruits. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to puchase additional stock

loans.use: to buy more stock of vegetables and fruits.

loans.name: José Arnoldo

texts.es:
José, de 53 años de edad, es agricultor de profesión y criador de cerdos, está casado y su esposa junto a sus hijos le apoyan; pero desde hace unos años José, está ayudándole a su padre con los trabajos agrícolas porque es muy viejo y necesita que le ayude.

José, trabaja en la agricultura desde hace 35 años, han sido mucho camino de trabajo y esfuerzo pleno, en las duras faenas del campo, pero de esa manera lleva el sustento a su familia y a sus hijos.

El dinero del préstamo será para comprar insumos agrícolas y para comprar cerdos para criarlos y venderlo.

José, sueña con seguir trabajando y seguir cosechando frutos de la tierra y con ello llevar el sustento a su hogar.
texts.en:
José, 53 years old, is a farmer by profession, and a raiser of pigs. He is married, and his wife and his children support him. However, for the past few years, José has been helping his father with the agricultural work, as he is very old and needs his help.

José has been working in agriculture for 35 years. It has been a long road and a lot of hard work in the tough conditions of the farm, but this is how he has supported his family and his children.

The money from the loan will be for buying agricultural inputs and for buying pigs to raise and sell. José dreams about continuing to work and reap the fruits of the land, and supporting his home in this way.



José, trabaja en la agricultura desde hace 35 años, han sido mucho camino de trabajo y esfuerzo pleno, en las duras faenas del campo, pero de esa manera lleva el sustento a su familia y a sus hijos.



El dinero del préstamo será para comprar insumos agrícolas y para comprar cerdos para criarlos y venderlo.



José, sueña con seguir trabajando y seguir cosechando frutos de la tierra y con ello llevar el sustento a su hogar.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs and to buy pigs to raise and sell.

loans.name: Alexander

texts.es:
Alexander, de 33 años de edad, es muy responsable, trabajador y dedicado a su familia, vive con su esposa y sus dos hijos que asisten a la escuela, su esposa es ama de casa y se encarga del cuidado de sus bebés. 

Alexander, trabaja como motorista del transporte público, también tiene un trabajo extra como arbitro de partidos amistosos de fútbol, ese es un ingreso adicional que el recibe para lograr sacar adelante a su familia.

Alexander, necesita el préstamo para colocar una tienda de productos de primera necesidad en su casa, para que su esposa la atienda y no trabaje fuera de casa y lejos de los niños; él considera que la tienda le generara buenas entradas de dinero y ayudará para cubrir las necesidades de su familia. 

Los sueñps de Alexander, es poder colocar su tienda y también desea ver a sus hijos graduados de una carrera universitaria.
texts.en:
Alexander is 33 years old. He is very responsible, hard-working and dedicated to his family. He lives with his wife and their two children who are in school. His wife is a homemaker and takes care of the children.

Alexander works as a driver of public transportation. He also has an extra job as a referee of soccer games. That provides additional income that helps him support his family.

Alexander needs the loan to place a store of basic necessities in his house. This will allow his wife to attend to it rather than work outside of the home and far away from the children. He believes that the store will generate good income and will help to meet the needs of his family.

Alexander's dreams are to start his store and to see his children graduate with a university degree.

loans.use: to place a shop of basic necessities in his house.

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en:
Nelly is a married woman with two children. She describes herself as honest. She operates a retail business where she sells charcoal. She has been involved in this business for six years.

Her business is located in a marketable place and her primary customers are regular. She says that her biggest business challenge is inadequate working capital.

This is Nelly's third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. She successfully repaid her previous loans. She will use this KES 50,000 loan to buy more sacks of charcoal to sell and will use the anticipated profits to improve the living standards of her family.

She hopes that in the future, she will have a productive business. Her business goal is to expand within five years.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Dulce Nombre De Jesus Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “DULCE NOMBRE DE JESUS”; Este banco se ubicado en el departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Yake Elizabeth, la socia tiene 20 años de edad y es soltera, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias dedicándose al negocio de crianza de animales menores, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
 La socia solicita el crédito para comprar animales entre otros.
Los socios en general agradecen el crédito y se comprometen a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
Los socios que salen en la foto adjunta pidieron permiso para llegar tarde a la reunión por motivos de trabajo.
texts.en: The members of this group belong to the Dulce Nombre de Jesus community bank, located in the department of Cusco, Peru. One member is Señora Yake Elizabeth, who is 20 years old and unmarried. She raises small animals [usually chickens, pigs, etc.] and is having good success with her business, thanks to the effort she puts in to her business every day. She is a responsible and diligent person and she wants to be able to keep on working to be able to continue to help her family. She is asking for this loan to be able to buy more animals, and some other items. The group members in general appreciate the loan and commit themselves to complying with the established schedule of payments. The members who are shown the the attached photos at the bottom asked for permission to arrive late to the meeting due to obligations at work.

loans.use: to buy animals, and some other items.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is a married man. He has two children. He describes himself to be ambitious.

He operates a retail business where he sells shoes, plastic containers, and clothes. He has been involved in this business for ten years. His business is located in a good area, and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be low stock.

He will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy more stock of plastic containers, clothes, and shoes.

His business goal is to have a wholesale shop within five years. He will use the anticipated profits to buy more goods.

loans.use: to buy more stock of plastic containers, clothes, and shoes.

loans.name: Vingunguti A Group

texts.en:
Daniel is in his early 40s and is married with four children. Three of them are still in school and one is still small. He has been running an animal sales business for 15 years now. He works from 5 a.m. to 4 p.m. daily and is able to make a very good monthly profit.

This will be Daniel's 15th loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans to increase the number of goats and cows he has available to satisfy his customers' needs and requests. He will use this loan to buy more goats and cows to resell.

Daniel managed to pay back all of his loans successfully. He used his profit to pay school fees, make loan payments, buy a plot of land, renovate his house, increase his stock of animals for future use, and cover household expenses.

Daniel will share this loan with his loan group, Vingunguti A Group, which has three members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan. He is happy with the loan experience and appreciates Kiva for the support of their group.

loans.use: to buy goats and cows to resell.

loans.name: Andrew

texts.en:
Andrew is a married man. He has five children. He describes himself to be focused.

He operates a retail business where he sells maize. He has been involved in this business for 15 years. His business is located in a good area, and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital.

He will use the KES 70,000 loan to buy more stock of maize.

His business goal is to have a posho mill within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will educate his children to university level.

This is his fifth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. His previous loans were repaid successfully. He will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to buy more stock of maize.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is a married man. He has one child. He operates a pharmacy. He has been involved in this business for three years. His business is located in a good area, and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital.

He will use the KES 100,000 loan to buy more stock of medicine. This will enable him to increase sales and hence have more profits. He will use the anticipated profits to buy more stock.

loans.use: to buy more stock of medicine.

loans.name: Habiba

texts.en:
Habiba is a married woman. She has seven children. She describes herself to be God-fearing.

She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for 12 years. Her primary customers are locals.

She will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes.

She hopes that in the future, she will educate her children to university level. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loans were repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine is a married woman. She has seven children. She describes herself to be competent. She operates a dairy farm where she sells milk and also grows potatoes. She has been involved in this business for seven years. Her primary customers are regular. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the low prices of farm produce. She will use the KES 60,000 loan to buy a dairy cow. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loans were repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to reinvest in the business.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Sylvia

texts.en:
Sylvia is a married woman. She has two children. She describes herself to be ambitious.

She operates a beauty salon where she offers beauty services. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a busy area, and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be power outages.

She will use the KES 80,000 loan to buy more stock of beauty products for salon use.

She hopes that in the future, she will expand her business and educate her children to university level.

This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loans were repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of beauty products.

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina is 56 years old, married and has five children.

Rosalina is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Rosalina requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Rosalina has been in this business for 10 years now, and has borrowed 9 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Rosalina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Jeannette

texts.fr: Jeannette est une couturière qui confectionne des habits de prêt à porter dans son atelier de couture à domicile et les revendent dans un emplacement au marché. Pour s’approvisionner du nécessaire pour la confection, Jeannette se rend deux fois par mois au marché. Jeannette demande ce prêt pour commander des mètres de tissus et des pantalons de kaki en vue de bien revendre ses marchandises puis de gagner un gain et pouvoir subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants et à leur éducation scolaire.
texts.en: Jeannette is a seamstress who makes ready-to-wear clothing in her workshop at home. She resells her products at a location at the market. To stock up on necessities for her work, she goes to the market twice a month. Jeannette is asking for this loan to order meters of fabrics and some kaki pants with the aim of selling her merchandise and earning a profit, so as to meet the needs of her children and cover their schooling costs.

loans.use: to purchase 30 meters of fabrics and 30 kaki pants

loans.name: Silivan

texts.en:
Silivan is aged 73 years, married with 13 children and living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. He is a tailor mainly making clothes like dresses, trousers, school uniforms and gets additional income from his cocoa plantation.

He started tailoring 43 years ago to raise income for his family and school fees for the children and dependents; his main challenge is competition and high cost of materials. He wants to continue supporting his family for basic needs and educating his children.

Silivan has asked for a loan to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Maria Magdalena

texts.es: María de 39 años de edad, habita en vivienda propia desde hace 34 años. Vive al lado de su compañero de vida, sus hijas de 11 y 13 años, y sus hijos de 8 y 4 años de edad. María es una mujer trabajadora que en busca de mantener la economía del hogar se dedica a la elaboración y venta de quesos y requesón, negocio que administra desde hace varios años. Además su esposo le ayuda a cubrir los gastos básicos de la familia. Ella vive en una vivienda humilde construida con láminas y madera, la cual no cuenta con el servicio de energía eléctrica, con el deseo de poder mejorar esta situación solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: caja térmica, cables eléctricos, y demás herramientas para la instalación del servicio de energía eléctrica en su vivienda. De esta forma mejorar considerablemente su condición de vida.
texts.en:
María is 39 years old and has lived in her own house for the last 34 years. She lives with her husband, her daughters, 11 and 13, and her sons, 8 and 4. María is a hardworking woman who, trying to manage her home finances, makes and sells cheese and curd, a business which she has run for several years. Her husband helps her to meet the basic costs of the family.

She lives in a humble wood-built dwelling, which does not have an electricity supply. Hoping to be able to improve this situation, she is asking for a loan from FUSAI to invest in a fuse box, electric wiring and other equipment for installing an electrical power supply in her house. In this way, her living conditions will be substantially improved.

loans.use: to invest in a fuse box, electric wiring and other equipment for installing an electrical power supply in her house.

loans.name: Samson

texts.en: Samson is a married man. He has four children. He describes himself to be competent. He operates a retail business where he sells fruits and vegetables. He has been involved in this business for four years. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be low stock. He will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more stock of fruits and vegetables. His business goal is to have a stable business within five years. This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. His previous loans were repaid successfully. He will use the anticipated profits to purchase additional stock.

loans.use: to buy more stock of fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Violet

texts.en: Violet is a married woman. She has three children. She describes herself to be responsible. She operates a retail business where she sells timber. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. She will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more stock of timber. She hopes that in the future, she will be successful. This is her fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loans were repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of timber.

loans.name: Makamba Group

texts.en:
Epiphania, who is in her late 50's, is married with five kids who are grown up. For five years now, she has been supporting her family with a beauty salon business. She works from 08am to 9pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be Epiphania first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She will use this loan to buy up-to-date salon products and meet her customers' requests. She dreams of owning a dryer and steaming machine to give better services to her customers.

Epiphania will share this loan with her loan group Makamba Road which has five members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy up to date salon products and meet her customers' requests.

loans.name: Benard

texts.en:
Benard is a married man with one child. He describes himself as ambitious. He operates a retail business where he sells charcoal. He has been involved in this business for 10 years.

His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are locals. He says that his biggest business challenge is the rain season, which affects business.

He will use the KES 80,000 loan to buy more sacks of charcoal to sell. He will use the anticipated profits to replenish his stock. His business goal is to be a large supplier of charcoal within five years.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is a married woman. She has three children. She describes herself to be responsible.

She operates a retail business where she sells maize. She has been involved in this business for ten years. Her business is located in a favourable place, and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital.

She will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy more cereals. She hopes that in the future, she will be successful.

loans.use: to buy more cereals.

loans.name: José Santos

texts.es:
José, de 22 años de edad, está acompañado, su pareja le ayuda trabajando en su negocio y juntos tienen un bebé de un año de edad.  

José, tiene su propio negocio de peluquería en el centro de su pueblo, ahí trabaja junto a su esposa quien le ayuda con varias cosas del negocio, tiene más de 5 años de dedicarse a esta actividad y asegura que le está yendo muy bien y que espera seguir adelante. 

José, necesita préstamo para poder renovar la maquinaria que utiliza en la peluquería y para comprar otra silla y productos para vender en su negocio, así podrá atender más clientes y recibir mayores ingresos. 

Los sueños de José, son poder invertir en su negocio y tener muchos más clientes.
texts.en:
José is 22 years old. He is married and his partner helps him work in his business and together they have a baby who is one year old.



He has his own hairdressing business in the centre of his town. He works there with his wife who helps him with various parts of the business. He has been doing this for more than five years and he says that it is going very well and that he hopes to move ahead.



José needs a loan to be able to renew the machinery that he uses in the hairdressers and to buy another seat and products to be able to sell in the business. Thus he will be able to serve more customers and earn more.



His dreams are to be able to invest in his business and to have many more customers.

loans.use: to renew the machinery that he uses in the hairdressers and to buy another seat and products to sell in his business.

loans.name: Grupo Pala Group

texts.es:
Juan (el primero del lado derecho en la fotografía) es un hombre con mucho entusiasmo de superarse, tiene 51 años de edad, y está muy satisfecho por la inversión que en su cultivo de banano realizo pues con el apoyo del crédito logro darle mantenimiento a tiempo a su cultivo, afortunadamente obtuvo una muy buena cosecha y aun buen precio en el mercado pudo venderlos.
Juan con un corazón generoso es el representante del grupo ahora denominado  Pala, él solicita un crédito para invertirlo en la compra de fertilizantes y pago de mano de obra para el mantenimiento de su cultivo de café. El espera obtener al final del año una buena cosecha de café, su esperanza de vida es fortalecer su cultivo para el próximo año.
texts.en:
Juan (the first on the right side of the photograph) is a man with a lot of enthusiasm for outdoing himself. He is 51 years old, and is very satisfied by the investment he made in his banana crop. With the support of the loan, he achieved maintaining his crop on time. Fortunately, he obtained a very good harvest and even better price in the market; he could sell them.

Juan, with a generous heart, is the representative of the group named Pala. He is applying for a loan to invest it in the purchase of fertilizers and to pay for labor for maintaining his coffee crop. He hopes to obtain a good coffee harvest at the end of the year. His hope in life is to strengthen his crop for the next year.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pay for labor for maintaining coffee.

loans.name: Adjo

texts.fr: Adjo est une femme mariée âgée de 46 ans résidant à Adidogomé. Mère de quatre enfants, Adjo est une revendeuse de savons liquide qui s’approvisionne une fois par mois au marché et le revend par livraison à de service en service. Adjo sollicite ce prêt pour commander le tonneau de pâte de savon liquide en vue de bien revendre puis de répondre favorablement aux besoins de ses clients et avoir une autonomie financière considérable pour aider ses enfants dans leur éducation scolaire.
texts.en: Adjo is a married woman, 46 years old, residing in Adidogomé. The mother of four, she is a retailer of liquid soaps. Her supplies are gotten once a month from the market. She resells her products by making deliveries to services. Adjo is requesting this loan to order a cask of liquid soap paste with the aim of making retail sales and responding favorably to the needs of her customer, as well as to have considerable financial autonomy for helping her children with their education.

loans.use: to purchase a cask of liquid soap paste

loans.name: Catalina

texts.es: Doña Catalina junto a su familia se dedica a la actividad de ganadería. Con el fin de darle un uso más eficiente a su finca, solicita un préstamo de un millón cincuenta mil colones (₡ 1 050 000), dinero que usará para la compra de novillas, lo cual le permitirá mejorar sus ingresos familiares.
texts.en: Along with her family, Catalina earns a living in livestock breeding. In order to give her farm a more efficient use, she is asking for a loan of 1,050,000 colones that she will use to buy heifers which will improve her family's income.

loans.use: to buy heifers.

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.es: Jacqueline se dedica a la siembra de hortalizas. Solicita un préstamo de dos mil dólares ($2,000), para la compra de nutrientes y otros insumos agrícolas necesarios para el buen desarrollo de estos productos agrícolas, esto le permitirá aumentar sus ingresos y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en: Jacqueline earns a living planting vegetables. She is asking for a loan of 2,000 dollars to buy nutrients and other farming supplies necessary for the good development of these agricultural products. This will allow her to increase her income and improve the quality of life of her family.

loans.use: to plant vegetables.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is 49 years old. She is married and blessed with two children. Her business is running a retail shop. She has been in the business for 12 years. She earns a monthly income of KES 14,000 (fourteen thousand Kenya shillings).

This is Lucia's first loan with VisionFund Kenya. She will use the loan to purchase milk, sugar, rice, cooking oil, wheat and maize flour, cereals, etc. to sell in the shop.

She will use the profits from expanded business to educate her children. Her hope and dream is to have a financially stable business.

loans.use: to purchase milk, sugar, rice, cooking oil, wheat and maize flour, cereals, etc. to sell in the shop.

loans.name: Joel

texts.en:
Joel is a married man. He has three children. He describes himself as being honest.

Joel operates a retail business, where he repairs electronics. He has been involved in this business for five years. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital.

Joel will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy electronic spare parts. His business goal is to have a big business within five years.

loans.use: to buy electronic spare parts.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a single man. He describes himself as determined. He operates a retail business where he sells bread, flour, sugar, rice, cooking oil, salt, milk and other items. He has been involved in this business for 3 years. His business is located in a busy place and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be small storage space in the shop.

He will use the KES 80,000 loan to buy a weighing scale and expand storage space in the shop. His business goal is to own a supermarket within 5 years. This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. His previous loans were repaid successfully.

He will use the anticipated profits to expand his business further.

loans.use: to buy a weighing scale and expand storage space in the shop.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a married man. He has 2 children. He operates a retail business where he sells clothes. He has been involved in this business for 2 years. His business is located in a busy place and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be transport.

He will use the KES 60,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes. His business goal is to be an importer of clothes within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will have a stable business.

This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully. He will use the anticipated profits to puchase additional stock.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is a married man. He has 3 children. He operates a retail business where he sells sugar, flour, bread, soap and other items. He has been involved in this business for 2 years. His business is located in a busy place and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be transport.

He will use the KES 80,000 loan to buy more stock of sugar, flour, soap, rice and other items. His business goal is to be an importer of products within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will have a stable business. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

He will use the anticipated profits to puchase additional stock.

loans.use: to buy more stock of sugar, flour, soap, rice and other items.

loans.name: Colleta

texts.en: Colleta is a married woman. She has seven children. She describes herself to be innovative. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for 11 years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. She will use the KES 80,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes. Her business goal is to expand to be a company within five years. She will use the anticipated profits to expand the business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes.

loans.name: Hilda Paz

texts.es:
Hilda, de 49 años de edad, es una mujer muy responsable y luchadora, estudio hasta segundo grado, porque su familia no pudo financiar más su estudio por razones económicas, está casada y es madre de 2 hijos, uno de ellos de 24 años de edad y es futbolista y el otro de 20 años de edad que trabaja en estructuras metálica en su casa, ella vive con sus dos hijos y 3 nietos los cuales están estudiando.

Hilda, se dedica a los oficios del hogar y a cuidar a sus nietos, porque su esposo está en los Estados Unidos desde hace varios años y le ayuda con los gastos del hogar.

El crédito lo necesita para comprar una novilla para alimentarla, engordarla y luego venderla para que le de ganancias y luego comprar una vaca cargada con cría, para que le de producción de leche y así tener otra fuente de ingresos para ayudar a los gastos del hogar.

El sueño de Hilda, es para poder mejorar su casa, que su hijo encuentre una mejor fuente de empleo, para poder financiar el estudio a sus nietos y que estos gocen de mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Hilda, 49 years old, is a very responsible and tenacious woman. She studied until second grade, because her family couldn't finance her studies more due to economic reasons. She is married and is the mother of two children, one of them is 24 years old and a soccer player, and the other is 20 years old and works on metallic structures in his house. Hilda dedicates herself to the household chores and taking care of her grandchildren, because her husband has been in the United States for several years and helps her with the expenses of the home.

She needs the loan to buy a heifer to feed it, fatten it and sell it later so that it gives her profit and to buy a breeding calf later, so that it gives her milk production to therefore have another source of income to help with the expenses of the home. Hilda's dream is to be able to improve her house, that her son finds a better source of employment, to be able to finance the education of her grandchildren and that they enjoy better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a heifer to feed it, fatten it and sell it later.

loans.name: Antonieta

texts.en:
Antonieta is 47 years old and married, with five children, three of whom are in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Antonieta runs a general store in the Philippines and she has requested a PHP 20,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy items to sell, like shampoo, soap, milk, sugar, and coffee.

Antonieta has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, like shampoo, soap, milk, sugar, and coffee.

loans.name: Hiba

texts.en:
Hiba is a 30-year-old married mother of two children. Eight years ago, she started working as a hairdresser to help her husband in covering the needs and expenses of their family. She is a hard worker who has professional skills in this domain. She learned makeup art, tattooing, spa treatments, etc. at an institute.

Today, Hiba is acquiring a youth loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to develop her business through the purchase of a spa chair, tattoo machine and makeup to satisfy her customers' requests.

Hiba hopes to expand her business more in the future to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a spa chair, tattoo machine and makeup to satisfy her customers' requests

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en:
Mahmoud is a 25-year-old man from Rafah City, married and the father of one son and one little daughter.

Mahmoud was living with his family in a small humble house, but during the latest war in Gaza his house was destroyed completely and then he had to rent a small apartment in the same area.

Recently Mahmoud took a USD loan from Palestine for Credit and Development (FATEN) in order to rebuild his old house. The loan will allow Mahmoud to finalize the needed construction in a short time and return his family to their normal life.

Mahmoud appears in the photo.

loans.use: to rebuild his old house.

loans.name: Maria Guadalupe

texts.es: María de 37 años de edad, vive al lado de sus hijos de 18 y 15 años, sus hijas de 13 y 7 años de edad, y su compañero de vida quien le ayuda con la economía del hogar y de esta manera logra sacar adelante a sus hijos. María es una mujer responsable y muy trabajadora quien en busca de mejorar su condición de vida se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza y venta de platillos típicos. Negocios que le permiten obtener los ingresos económicos necesarios para satisfacer las necesidades básicas de sus hijos y de esta manera ofrecerle una mejor forma de vida. Este negocio lo administra desde hace varios años por lo que cuenta con una buena cantidad de clientes y la demanda ha aumentado, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cremas, lociones, desodorantes, maquillaje, labiales, etc. y también en materia prima para la elaboración de sus platillos típicos para aumentar sus ventas y así aumentar sus ganancias.
texts.en: María is 37 years old. She lives with her sons who are 18 and 15 years old and her daughters who are 13 and 7 years old. Her partner helps her with the family economy and in this way she manages to get her children ahead in life. She is a responsible and very hardworking woman  who, in the search to improve her living conditions, earns a living selling beauty products and selling small traditional dishes. These businesses allow her to earn the necessary income to meet the basic needs of her children and give them a better way  of life. She has had this business for many years and therefore has a good amount of customers and the demand has increased. This is why she is asking for a loan from FUSAI to buy creams, lotions, deodorants, make-up, lipstick, etc. and also ingredients to make her small traditional dishes to increase her sales and also to increase her earnings.

loans.use: to buy creams, lotions, make-up, lipstick, etc. and ingredients to make her traditional dishes to increase her sales.

loans.name: Josephat

texts.en: Josephat is a married man. He has two children. He describes himself to be honest. He operates a retail business where he sells poultry. He has been involved in this business for five years. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. He will use the KES 80,000 loan to buy more chickens. He hopes that in the future, he will have increased income. He will reinvest the anticipated profits back to the business.

loans.use: to buy more chickens.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret is a married woman. She has six children. She describes herself to be innovative. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for six years. Her business is located in a strategic place and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. She will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes. Her business goal is to own a boutique within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will own a company. She will use the anticipated profits to expand the business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther is a married woman. She has six children. She describes herself to be competent. She operates a dairy farm where she sells milk. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient animal feed. She will use the KES 70,000 loan to buy animal feed. She hopes that in the future she will have a stable income. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loans were repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to expand the business.

loans.use: to buy animal feed.

loans.name: Roselyne

texts.en: Roselyne is a married woman. She has six children. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a retail business where she sells fish (omena type). She has been involved in this business for four years. Her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be transport. She will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more stock of fish. She hopes that in the future, she will raise the living standards of her family. This is her fifth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loans were repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to buy a dairy cow.

loans.use: to buy more stock of fish
